Meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH, from a child's pronunciation of the final syllable. It is now associated with the main character from the television series Buffy the Vampire Slayer (1997-2003).

Name: BUNNY
Meaning: Diminutive of BERENICE.

Name: BURGUNDY
Meaning: This name can refer either to the region in France, the wine (which derives from the name of the region), or the colour (which derives from the name of the wine).

Name: BURKE
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from Old English burg meaning "fortress".

Name: BURT
Meaning: Short form of BURTON.

Name: BURTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally taken from an Old English place name meaning "fortified town". A famous bearer of the surname was Sir Richard Burton (1821-1890), an explorer of Africa and Asia.

Name: BUSTER
Meaning: Originally a nickname denoting a person who broke things, from the word bust, a dialectal variant of burst. A famous bearer was the silent movie star Buster Keaton (1895-1966).

Name: BYRNE
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from Ó Broin meaning "descendant of BRAN (1)".

Name: BYRON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from a place name meaning "place of the cow sheds" in Old English. This was the surname of the romantic poet Lord Byron (1788-1824), the writer of Don Juan and many other works.

Name: BYSSHE
Meaning: From an English surname, a variant of the surname Bush, which originally indicated a person who lived near a bush. This was the middle name of the romantic poet Percy Bysshe Shelley (1792-1822).

Name: CADE
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a nickname meaning "round" in Old English.

Name: CADEN
Meaning: Sometimes explained as a derivative of the Irish surname Caden, which is a reduced form of the Irish Gaelic Mac Cadáin meaning "son of Cadán". In actuality, its popularity in America beginning in the 1990s is due to its sound - it shares its fashionable den suffix sound with other popular names like Hayden, Aidan and Braden.

Name: CADENCE
Meaning: From an English word meaning "rhythm, flow". It has been in use only since the 20th century.

Name: CAELAN
Meaning: Anglicized form of CAOLÁN or CAOILFHIONN.

Name: CAELIE
Meaning: Variant of KAYLEE.

Name: CAETLIN
Meaning: Variant of CAITLIN.

Name: CAIDEN
Meaning: Variant of CADEN.

Name: CAILEIGH
Meaning: Variant of KAYLEIGH.

Name: CAILIN
Meaning: Variant of KAYLYN. It also coincides with the Irish word cailín meaning "girl".

Name: CAILYN
Meaning: Variant of KAYLYN.

Name: CAIRO
Meaning: From the name of the city in Egypt, called القاهرة (al-Qahirah) in Arabic, meaning "the victorious".

Name: CAITLIN
Meaning: Anglicized form of CAITLÍN.

Name: CAITLYN
Meaning: Variant of CAITLIN.

Name: CAL
Meaning: Short form of CALVIN.

Name: CALANTHE
Meaning: From the name of a type of orchid, ultimately meaning "beautiful flower", derived from Greek καλός (kalos) meaning "beautiful" and ἄνθος (anthos) meaning "flower".

Name: CALANTHIA
Meaning: Elaborated form of CALANTHE.

Name: CALE
Meaning: Short form of CALEB.

Name: CALEB
Meaning: Most likely related to Hebrew כֶּלֶב (kelev) meaning "dog". An alternate theory connects it to Hebrew כָּל (kal) meaning "whole, all of" and לֵב (lev) meaning "heart". In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the twelve spies sent by Moses into Canaan. Of the Israelites who left Egypt with Moses, Caleb and Joshua were the only ones who lived to see the Promised Land.... [more]

Name: CALEIGH
Meaning: Variant of KAYLEIGH or CALLIE.

Name: CALI (1)
Meaning: Variant of CALLIE.

Name: CALISTA
Meaning: Feminine form of CALLISTUS. As an English name it might also be a variant of KALLISTO.

Name: CALLA
Meaning: From the name of a type of lily, of Latin origin. Use of the name may also be inspired by Greek κάλλος (kallos) meaning "beauty".

Name: CALLAHAN
Meaning: From a surname, the Anglicized form of the Irish Ó Ceallacháin, which means "descendant of CEALLACHÁN".

Name: CALLAN
Meaning: From a surname, the Anglicized form of the Irish Ó Cathaláin, which means "descendant of CATHALÁN".

Name: CALLEIGH
Meaning: Variant of CALLIE.

Name: CALLIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CAROLINE, or sometimes of names beginning with Cal.

Name: CALLISTA
Meaning: Variant of CALISTA.

Name: CALVIN
Meaning: Derived from the French surname Cauvin, which was derived from chauve meaning "bald". The surname was borne by Jean Cauvin (1509-1564), a theologian from France who was one of the leaders of the Protestant Reformation. His surname was Latinized as Calvinus (based on Latin calvus "bald") and he is known as John Calvin in English. It has been used as a given name in his honour since the 19th century.

Name: CAM (2)
Meaning: Short form of CAMERON.

Name: CAMDEN
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name, perhaps meaning "enclosed valley" in Old English. A famous bearer of the surname was the English historian William Camden (1551-1623).

Name: CAMELLIA
Meaning: From the name of the flowering shrub, which was named for the botanist and missionary Georg Josef Kamel.

Name: CAMERON
Meaning: From a Scottish surname meaning "crooked nose" from Gaelic cam "crooked" and sròn "nose".

Name: CAMILLA
Usage: English, Italian, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, German, Ancient Roman, Roman Mythology
Meaning: Feminine form of CAMILLUS. This was the name of a legendary warrior maiden of the Volsci, as told by Virgil in the Aeneid. It was popularized in the English-speaking world by Fanny Burney's novel Camilla (1796).

Name: CAMILLE
Meaning: French feminine and masculine form of CAMILLA. It is also used in the English-speaking world, where it is generally only feminine.

Name: CAMMIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CAMILLA.

Name: CAMPBELL
Meaning: From a Scottish surname meaning "crooked mouth" from Gaelic cam "crooked" and béul "mouth".

Name: CAMRON
Meaning: Variant of CAMERON.

Name: CAMRYN
Meaning: Variant of CAMERON.

Name: CANDACE
Meaning: From the hereditary title of the queens of Ethiopia, as mentioned in Acts in the New Testament. It is apparently derived from Cushitic kdke meaning "queen mother". In some versions of the Bible it is spelled Kandake, reflecting the Greek spelling Κανδάκη. It was used as a given name by the Puritans after the Protestant Reformation. It was popularized in the 20th century by a character in the 1942 movie Meet the Stewarts.

Name: CANDI
Meaning: Variant of CANDY.

Name: CANDICE
Meaning: Variant of CANDACE.

Name: CANDIDA
Meaning: Late Latin name derived from candidus meaning "white". This was the name of several early saints, including a woman supposedly healed by Saint Peter. As an English name, it came into use after George Bernard Shaw's play Candida (1898).

Name: CANDIS
Meaning: Variant of CANDACE.

Name: CANDY
Meaning: Diminutive of CANDACE. It is also influenced by the English word candy.

Name: CANDYCE
Meaning: Variant of CANDACE.

Name: CAPRICE
Meaning: From the English word meaning "impulse", ultimately (via French) from Italian capriccio.

Name: CAPRICIA
Meaning: Elaborated form of CAPRICE.

Name: CARA
Meaning: From an Italian word meaning "beloved". It has been used as a given name since the 19th century, though it did not become popular until after the 1950s.

Name: CAREEN
Meaning: Variant of CARREEN.

Name: CAREN
Meaning: Variant of KAREN (1).

Name: CAREY
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from Ó Ciardha meaning "descendant of CIARDHA".

Name: CARI
Meaning: Variant of CARRIE.

Name: CARINA (1)
Usage: English, Portuguese, Spanish, German, Late Roman
Meaning: Late Latin name derived from cara meaning "dear, beloved". This was the name of a 4th-century saint and martyr. It is also the name of a constellation in the southern sky, though in this case it means "keel" in Latin, referring to a part of Jason's ship the Argo.

Name: CARIS
Meaning: Variant of CHARIS.

Name: CARISSA
Meaning: Variant of CHARISSA.

Name: CARL
Meaning: German form of CHARLES. Two noteworthy bearers of the name were the German mathematician Carl Gauss (1777-1855), who made contributions to number theory and algebra as well as physics and astronomy, and the Swiss psychologist Carl Jung (1875-1961), who founded analytical psychology. It was imported to America in the 19th century by German immigrants.

Name: CARLA
Usage: Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Catalan, English, German, Dutch
Meaning: Feminine form of CARLO, CARLOS or CARL.

Name: CARLENE
Meaning: Feminine diminutive of CARL.

Name: CARLETON
Meaning: Variant of CHARLTON.

Name: CARLEY
Meaning: Feminine form of CARL.

Name: CARLIE
Meaning: Feminine form of CARL.

Name: CARLISA
Meaning: Combination of CARLA and LISA.

Name: CARLISLE
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the name of a city in northern England. The city was originally called by the Romans Luguvalium meaning "stronghold of LUGUS". Later the Brythonic element ker "fort" was appended to the name of the city.

Name: CARLTON
Meaning: Variant of CHARLTON.

Name: CARLY
Meaning: Feminine form of CARL.

Name: CARLYLE
Meaning: Variant of CARLISLE.

Name: CARLYN
Meaning: Contracted variant of CAROLINE.

Name: CARMEL
Meaning: From the title of the Virgin Mary Our Lady of Carmel. כַּרְמֶל (Karmel) (meaning "garden" in Hebrew) is a mountain in Israel mentioned in the Old Testament. It was the site of several early Christian monasteries. As an English given name, it has mainly been used by Catholics.

Name: CARMELLA
Meaning: Latinized form of CARMEL.

Name: CARMEN
Meaning: Medieval Spanish form of CARMEL influenced by the Latin word carmen "song". This was the name of the main character in George Bizet's opera Carmen (1875).

Name: CAROL (1)
Meaning: Short form of CAROLINE. It was formerly a masculine name, derived from CAROLUS. The name can also be given in reference to the English vocabulary word, which means "song" or "hymn".

Name: CAROLINA
Meaning: Latinate feminine form of CAROLUS. This is the name of two American states: North and South Carolina. They were named for Charles I, king of England.

Name: CAROLINE
Usage: French, English, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch
Meaning: French feminine form of CAROLUS.

Name: CAROLYN
Meaning: Variant of CAROLINE.

Name: CARRAN
Meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of the Gaelic surname Ó Corraidhín meaning "descendant of CORRAIDHÍN".

Name: CARREEN
Meaning: Used by Margaret Mitchell in her novel Gone with the Wind (1936), where it is a combination of CAROLINE and IRENE.

Name: CARRIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CAROLINE.

Name: CARROL
Meaning: Variant of CARROLL (masculine) or CAROL (1) (feminine).

Name: CARRY
Meaning: Diminutive of CAROLINE.

Name: CARSON
Meaning: From a Scottish surname of uncertain meaning. A famous bearer of the surname was the American scout Kit Carson (1809-1868).

Name: CARTER
Meaning: From an English surname that meant "one who uses a cart". A famous bearer of the surname is former American president Jimmy Carter (1924-).

Name: CARVER
Meaning: From an English surname that meant "wood carver".

Name: CARY
Meaning: Variant of CAREY. A famous bearer was the British-American actor Cary Grant (1904-1986).

Name: CARYL
Meaning: Variant of CAROL (1).

Name: CARYN
Meaning: Variant of KAREN (1).

Name: CASE
Meaning: Short form of CASEY.

Name: CASEY
Meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Cathasaigh meaning "descendant of CATHASACH". This name can be given in honour of Casey Jones (1863-1900), a train engineer who sacrificed his life to save his passengers. In his case, Casey was a nickname acquired because he was raised in the town of Cayce, Kentucky.

Name: CASH
Meaning: From an English occupational surname for a box maker, derived from Norman French casse meaning "case". A famous bearer of the surname was American musician Johnny Cash (1932-2003).

Name: CASIMIR
Meaning: English form of the Polish name Kazimierz, derived from the Slavic element kaziti "to destroy" combined with miru "peace, world". Four kings of Poland have borne this name, including Casimir III the Great, who greatly strengthened the Polish state in the 14th century. It was also borne Saint Casimir, a 15th-century Polish prince and a patron saint of Poland and Lithuania. The name was imported into Western Europe via Germany, where it was borne by some royalty.

Name: CASON
Meaning: From a surname derived from the English place name Cawston, itself derived from the Old Norse given name KÁLFR combined with Old English tun meaning "enclosure, yard, town".

Name: CASS
Meaning: Short form of CASSANDRA, CASSIDY, and other names beginning with Cass.

Name: CASSANDRA
Usage: English, Portuguese, Italian, French, German, Greek Mythology (Latinized)
Meaning: From the Greek name Κασσάνδρα (Kassandra), derived from possibly κέκασμαι (kekasmai) meaning "to excel, to shine" and ἀνήρ (aner) meaning "man" (genitive ἀνδρός). In Greek myth Cassandra was a Trojan princess, the daughter of Priam and Hecuba. She was given the gift of prophecy by Apollo, but when she spurned his advances he cursed her so nobody would believe her prophecies.... [more]

Name: CASSARAH
Meaning: Recently created name intended to mean "what will be, will be". It is from the title of the 1956 song Que Sera, Sera, which was taken from the Italian phrase che sarà sarà. The phrase que sera, sera is not grammatically correct in any Romance language.

Name: CASSIDY
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from Ó Caiside meaning "descendant of CAISIDE".

Name: CASSIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CASSANDRA and other names beginning with Cass.

Name: CAT
Meaning: Diminutive of CATHERINE. It can also be a nickname from the English word for the animal.

Name: CATE
Meaning: Variant of KATE. A famous bearer is Australian actress Cate Blanchett (1969-).

Name: CATHARINE
Meaning: Variant of KATHERINE.

Name: CATHERIN
Meaning: Variant of KATHERINE.

Name: CATHERINA
Meaning: Variant of KATHERINE.

Name: CATHERINE
Meaning: French form of KATHERINE, and also a common English variant.

Name: CATHLEEN
Meaning: Variant of KATHLEEN.

Name: CATHRYN
Meaning: Variant of KATHERINE.

Name: CATHY
Meaning: Diminutive of CATHERINE.

Name: CAVAN
Meaning: Either from the name of the Irish county, which is derived from Irish cabhán "hollow", or else from the Irish surname CAVAN.

Name: CAYDEN
Meaning: Variant of CADEN.

Name: CAYLEY
Meaning: Variant of KAYLEE.

Name: CAYSON
Meaning: Variant of CASON.

Name: CEARA
Meaning: Variant of CIARA (2).

Name: CEARRA
Meaning: Variant of CIARA (2).

Name: CECE
Meaning: Diminutive of CECILIA and other names containing a similar sound.

Name: CECELIA
Meaning: Variant of CECILIA.

Name: CECIL
Meaning: From the Roman name Caecilius (see CECILIA). This was the name of a 3rd-century saint, a companion of Saint Cyprian. Though it was in use during the Middle Ages in England, it did not become common until the 19th century when it was given in honour of the noble Cecil family, who had been prominent since the 16th century. Their surname was derived from the Welsh given name Seisyll, which was derived from the Roman name Sextilius, a derivative of SEXTUS.

Name: CECILIA
Usage: English, Italian, Spanish, Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, Dutch, Romanian, Finnish
Meaning: Latinate feminine form of the Roman family name Caecilius, which was derived from Latin caecus meaning "blind". Saint Cecilia was a semi-legendary 2nd- or 3rd-century martyr who was sentenced to die because she refused to worship the Roman gods. After attempts to suffocate her failed, she was beheaded. She was later regarded as the patron saint of music and musicians.... [more]

Name: CECILY
Meaning: English form of CECILIA. This was the usual English form during the Middle Ages.

Name: CEDAR
Meaning: From the English word for the coniferous tree, derived (via Old French and Latin) from Greek κέδρος (kedros).

Name: CEDRIC
Meaning: Invented by Sir Walter Scott for a character in his novel Ivanhoe (1819). Apparently he based it on the actual name Cerdic, the name of the semi-legendary founder of the kingdom of Wessex in the 6th century. The meaning of Cerdic is uncertain, but it does not appear to be Old English in origin. It could be connected to the Brythonic name CARATACOS. The name was also used by Frances Hodgson Burnett for the main character in her novel Little Lord Fauntleroy (1886).

Name: CELANDINE
Meaning: From the name of the flower, which is derived from Greek χελιδών (chelidon) meaning "swallow (bird)".

Name: CELESTE
Meaning: Italian feminine and masculine form of CAELESTIS. It is also the English feminine form.

Name: CELESTINE
Meaning: English form of CAELESTINUS. It is more commonly used as a feminine name, from the French feminine form Célestine.

Name: CELIA
Meaning: Feminine form of the Roman family name CAELIUS. Shakespeare used it in his play As You Like It (1599), which introduced the name to the English-speaking public at large. It is sometimes used as a short form of CECILIA.

Name: CELINDA
Meaning: Probably a blend of CELIA and LINDA. This is also the Spanish name for a variety of shrub with white flowers, known as sweet mock-orange in English (species Philadelphus coronarius).

Name: CELINE
Meaning: Variant of CÉLINE.

Name: CHAD
Meaning: From the Old English name Ceadda, which is of unknown meaning, possibly based on Welsh cad "battle". This was the name of a 7th-century English saint. Borne primarily by Catholics, it was a rare name until the 1960s when it started to become more common amongst the general population. This is also the name of a country in Africa, though it originates from a different source.

Name: CHADWICK
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the name of towns in England, meaning "settlement belonging to CHAD" in Old English.

Name: CHALICE
Meaning: Means simply "chalice, goblet" from the English word, derived from Latin calix.

Name: CHANCE
Meaning: Originally a diminutive of CHAUNCEY. It is now usually given in reference to the English word chance meaning "luck, fortune" (ultimately derived from Latin cadens "falling").

Name: CHANDLER
Meaning: From an occupational surname that meant "candle seller" in Middle English, ultimately from Old French.

Name: CHANEL
Meaning: From a French surname that meant either "channel", indicating a person who lived near a channel of water, or "jug, jar, bottle", indicating a manufacturer of jugs. It has been used as an American given name since 1970s, influenced by the Chanel brand name (a line of women's clothing and perfume), which was named for French fashion designer Coco Chanel (1883-1971).

Name: CHANELLE
Meaning: Variant of CHANEL.

Name: CHANNING
Meaning: From an English surname of uncertain origin.

Name: CHANTAL
Meaning: From a French surname that was derived from a place name meaning "stony". It was originally given in honour of Saint Jeanne-Françoise de Chantal, the founder of the Visitation Order in the 17th century. It has become associated with French chant "song".

Name: CHANTÉ
Meaning: Means "sung" in French.

Name: CHANTEL
Meaning: Variant of CHANTAL.

Name: CHANTELLE
Meaning: Variant of CHANTAL.

Name: CHARIS
Meaning: Feminine form of CHARES. It came into use as an English given name in the 17th century.

Name: CHARISMA
Meaning: From the English word meaning "personal magnetism", ultimately derived from Greek χάρις (charis) meaning "grace, kindness".

Name: CHARISSA
Meaning: Elaborated form of CHARIS. Edmund Spencer used it in his epic poem The Faerie Queene (1590).

Name: CHARISSE
Meaning: From a French surname of unknown meaning. It was used as a given name in honour of American actress and dancer Cyd Charisse (1921-2008).

Name: CHARITY
Meaning: From the English word charity, ultimately derived from Late Latin caritas meaning "generous love", from Latin carus "dear, beloved". Caritas was in use as a Roman Christian name. The English name Charity came into use among the Puritans after the Protestant Reformation.

Name: CHARLA
Meaning: Feminine form of CHARLES.

Name: CHARLEE
Meaning: Feminine form of CHARLES.

Name: CHARLEEN
Meaning: Variant of CHARLENE.

Name: CHARLEIGH
Meaning: Feminine form of CHARLES.

Name: CHARLENE
Meaning: Feminine diminutive of CHARLES.

Name: CHARLES
Meaning: From the Germanic name Karl, which was derived from a Germanic word meaning "man". However, an alternative theory states that it is derived from the common Germanic name element hari meaning "army, warrior".... [more]

Name: CHARLEY
Meaning: Diminutive or feminine form of CHARLES.

Name: CHARLI
Meaning: Strictly feminine form of CHARLIE.

Name: CHARLIE
Meaning: Diminutive or feminine form of CHARLES. A famous bearer was the British comic actor Charlie Chaplin (1889-1977). It is also borne by Charlie Brown, the main character in the comic strip Peanuts by Charles Schulz.

Name: CHARLOTTE
Usage: French, English, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch
Meaning: French feminine diminutive of CHARLES. It was introduced to Britain in the 17th century. It was the name of a German-born 18th-century queen consort of Great Britain and Ireland. Another notable bearer was Charlotte Brontë (1816-1855), the eldest of the three Brontë sisters and the author of Jane Eyre and Villette.... [more]

Name: CHARLTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from a place name meaning "settlement of free men" in Old English.

Name: CHARMAINE
Meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps a combination of CHARMIAN or the English word charm with the aine suffix from LORRAINE. It was (first?) used for a character in the play What Price Glory (1924), which was made into a popular movie in 1926.

Name: CHARMIAN
Meaning: Form of CHARMION used by Shakespeare in his play Antony and Cleopatra (1606).

Name: CHARNETTE
Meaning: Probably an invented name.

Name: CHAS
Meaning: Diminutive of CHARLES.

Name: CHASE
Meaning: From a surname meaning "chase, hunt" in Middle English, originally a nickname for a huntsman.

Name: CHASITY
Meaning: Variant of CHASTITY.

Name: CHASTITY
Meaning: From the English word chastity, which is ultimately from Latin castus "pure". It was borne by the daughter of Sonny Bono and Cher, which probably led to the name's increase in popularity during the 1970s.

Name: CHAUNCEY
Meaning: From a Norman surname of unknown meaning. It was used as a given name in American in honour of Harvard president Charles Chauncey (1592-1672).

Name: CHAZ
Meaning: Diminutive of CHARLES.

Name: CHELLE
Meaning: Diminutive of MICHELLE.

Name: CHELSEA
Meaning: From the name of a district in London, originally derived from Old English and meaning "landing place for chalk or limestone". It has been in general use as an English given name since the 1970s.

Name: CHELSEY
Meaning: Variant of CHELSEA.

Name: CHELSIE
Meaning: Variant of CHELSEA.

Name: CHER
Meaning: Short form of CHERYL. In the case of the American musician Cher (1946-), it is short for her real name CHERILYN.

Name: CHERETTE
Meaning: Diminutive of CHERIE.

Name: CHERI
Meaning: Variant of CHERIE.

Name: CHERICE
Meaning: Variant of CHARISSE.

Name: CHERIE
Meaning: Derived from French chérie meaning "darling". In America, Cherie came into use shortly after the variant Sherry, and has not been as common.

Name: CHERILYN
Meaning: Combination of CHERYL and the popular name suffix lyn.

Name: CHERISE
Meaning: Variant of CHARISSE.

Name: CHERISH
Meaning: From the English word meaning "to treasure".

Name: CHEROKEE
Meaning: Probably derived from the Creek word tciloki meaning "people of a different speech". This is the name of a Native American people who live in the east of North America.

Name: CHERRY
Meaning: Simply means "cherry" from the name of the fruit. It can also be a diminutive of CHARITY. It has been in use since the late 19th century.

Name: CHERRYL
Meaning: Variant of CHERYL.

Name: CHERYL
Meaning: Elaboration of CHERIE, perhaps influenced by BERYL. This name was not used before the 20th century.

Name: CHESLEY
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from a place name meaning "camp meadow" in Old English.

Name: CHESTER
Meaning: From a surname that originally belonged to a person who came from Chester, an old Roman settlement in Britain. The name of the settlement came from Latin castrum "camp, fortress".

Name: CHET
Meaning: Short form of CHESTER.

Name: CHEYANNE
Meaning: Variant of CHEYENNE probably influenced by the name ANNE (1).

Name: CHEYENNE
Meaning: Derived from the Dakota word shahiyena meaning "red speakers". This is the name of a Native American people of the Great Plains. The name was supposedly given to the Cheyenne by the Dakota because their language was unrelated to their own. As a given name, it has been in use since the 1950s.

Name: CHILE
Meaning: Variant of KYLE.

Name: CHINA
Meaning: From the name of the Asian country, ultimately derived from Qin, the name of a dynasty that ruled there in the 3rd century BC.

Name: CHIP
Meaning: Diminutive of CHARLES or CHRISTOPHER. It can also be from a nickname given in reference to the phrase a chip off the old block, used of a son who is similar to his father.

Name: CHLOE
Usage: English, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek, Ancient Greek, Greek Mythology
Meaning: Means "green shoot" in Greek, referring to new plant growth in the spring. This was an epithet of the Greek goddess Demeter. The name is also mentioned by Paul in one of his epistles in the New Testament. As an English name, Chloe has been in use since the Protestant Reformation.

Name: CHLOË
Meaning: Dutch form and English variant of CHLOE.

Name: CHRIS
Meaning: Short form of CHRISTOPHER, CHRISTIAN, CHRISTINE, and other names that begin with Chris.

Name: CHRISSIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CHRISTINE or CHRISTINA.

Name: CHRISSY
Meaning: Diminutive of CHRISTINE or CHRISTINA.

Name: CHRISTA
Meaning: Short form of CHRISTINA.

Name: CHRISTABEL
Meaning: Combination of CHRISTINA and the name suffix bel. This name occurs in medieval literature, and was later used in 1800 by Samuel Coleridge in his poem Christabel.

Name: CHRISTABELLA
Meaning: Latinate form of CHRISTABEL.

Name: CHRISTABELLE
Meaning: Variant of CHRISTABEL.

Name: CHRISTAL
Meaning: Variant of CRYSTAL.

Name: CHRISTEN (2)
Meaning: Variant of KRISTIN.

Name: CHRISTI
Meaning: Diminutive of CHRISTINE or CHRISTINA.

Name: CHRISTIAN
Usage: English, French, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish
Meaning: From the medieval Latin name Christianus meaning "a Christian" (see CHRISTOS (1)). In England it has been in use since the Middle Ages, during which time it was used by both males and females, but it did not become common until the 17th century. In Denmark the name has been borne by ten kings since the 15th century. A famous bearer was Hans Christian Andersen (1805-1875), the Danish author of such fairy tales as The Ugly Duckling and The Emperor's New Clothes.

Name: CHRISTIANA
Meaning: Latin feminine form of CHRISTIAN.

Name: CHRISTIANNE
Meaning: Feminine form of CHRISTIAN.

Name: CHRISTIE (1)
Meaning: Diminutive of CHRISTINE or CHRISTINA.

Name: CHRISTINA
Usage: English, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch, Greek
Meaning: From Christiana, the Latin feminine form of CHRISTIAN. This was the name of an early, possibly legendary, saint who was tormented by her pagan father. It was also borne by a 17th-century Swedish queen and patron the arts who gave up her crown in order to become a Roman Catholic.

Name: CHRISTINE
Usage: French, English, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch
Meaning: French form of CHRISTINA, as well as a variant in other languages.

Name: CHRISTMAS
Meaning: From the name of the holiday, which means "Christ festival".

Name: CHRISTOBEL
Meaning: Variant of CHRISTABEL.

Name: CHRISTOPHER
Meaning: From the Late Greek name Χριστόφορος (Christophoros) meaning "bearing CHRIST", derived from Χριστός (Christos) combined with φέρω (phero) meaning "to bear, to carry". Early Christians used it as a metaphorical name, expressing that they carried Christ in their hearts. In the Middle Ages, literal interpretations of the name's etymology led to legends about a Saint Christopher who carried the young Jesus across a river. He has come to be regarded as the patron saint of travellers.... [more]

Name: CHRISTY (1)
Meaning: Diminutive of CHRISTINE or CHRISTINA.

Name: CHRYSANTA
Meaning: Shortened form of the word chrysanthemum, the name of a flowering plant, which means "golden flower" in Greek.

Name: CHRYSTAL
Meaning: Variant of CRYSTAL.

Name: CHUCK
Meaning: Diminutive of CHARLES. It originated in America in the early 20th century. Two famous bearers of this name were pilot Chuck Yeager (1923-), the first man to travel faster than the speed of sound, and the musician Chuck Berry (1926-2017), one of the pioneers of rock music.

Name: CHUCKIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CHUCK.

Name: CHUCKY
Meaning: Diminutive of CHUCK.

Name: CHYNA
Meaning: Variant of CHINA.

Name: CIARA (2)
Meaning: Variant of SIERRA. Use of the name has perhaps been influenced by the brand of perfume called Ciara, which was introduced by Revlon in 1973.

Name: CICELY
Meaning: Medieval variant of CECILY.

Name: CIERA
Meaning: Variant of SIERRA.

Name: CIERRA
Meaning: Variant of SIERRA.

Name: CINDI
Meaning: Diminutive of CYNTHIA.

Name: CINDRA
Meaning: Combination of CINDY and SANDRA.

Name: CINDY
Meaning: Diminutive of CYNTHIA or LUCINDA. Like Cynthia, it peaked in popularity in the United States in 1957.

Name: CISSY
Meaning: Variant of SISSY.

Name: CLAIR
Meaning: French form of Clarus (see CLARA).

Name: CLAIRE
Meaning: French form of CLARA.

Name: CLANCY
Meaning: From the Irish surname Mac Fhlannchaidh, which means "son of Flannchadh". The Irish name Flannchadh means "red warrior".

Name: CLARA
Usage: German, Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, French, Catalan, Romanian, English, Swedish, Danish, Late Roman
Meaning: Feminine form of the Late Latin name Clarus, which meant "clear, bright, famous". The name Clarus was borne by a few early saints. The feminine form was popularized by the 13th-century Saint Clare of Assisi (called Chiara in Italian), a friend and follower of Saint Francis, who left her wealthy family to found the order of nuns known as the Poor Clares. As an English name it has been in use since the Middle Ages, originally in the form Clare, though the Latinate spelling Clara became more popular in the 19th century.

Name: CLARE
Meaning: Medieval English form of CLARA. This is also the name of an Irish county, which was itself probably derived from Irish clár meaning "plank, level surface".

Name: CLARENCE
Meaning: From the Latin title Clarensis, which belonged to members of the British royal family. The title ultimately derives from the name of the town of Clare in Suffolk. As a given name it has been in use since the 19th century.

Name: CLARETTE
Meaning: Diminutive of CLARA.

Name: CLARIBEL
Meaning: Combination of CLARA and the popular name suffix bel. This name was used by Edmund Spenser in his poem The Faerie Queene (in the form Claribell) and by Shakespeare in his play The Tempest (1611). Alfred Lord Tennyson also wrote a poem entitled Claribel (1830).

Name: CLARICE
Meaning: Medieval vernacular form of the Late Latin name Claritia, which was a derivative of CLARA.

Name: CLARINDA
Meaning: Combination of CLARA and the popular name suffix inda. It was first used by Edmund Spenser in his epic poem The Faerie Queene (1590).

Name: CLARISSA
Meaning: Latinate form of CLARICE. This was the name of the title character in a 1748 novel by Samuel Richardson. In the novel Clarissa is a virtuous woman who is tragically exploited by her family and her lover.

Name: CLARITY
Meaning: Simply means "clarity, lucidity" from the English word, ultimately from Latin clarus "clear".

Name: CLARK
Meaning: From an English surname meaning "cleric" or "scribe", from Old English clerec originally meaning "priest". A famous bearer of the surname was William Clark (1770-1838), an explorer of the west of North America. It was also borne by the American actor Clark Gable (1901-1960).

Name: CLAUD
Meaning: Variant of CLAUDE.

Name: CLAUDE
Meaning: French masculine and feminine form of CLAUDIUS. In France the masculine name has been common since the Middle Ages due to the 7th-century Saint Claude of Besançon. It was imported to Britain in the 16th century by the aristocratic Hamilton family, who had French connections. A famous bearer of this name was the French impressionist painter Claude Monet (1840-1926).

Name: CLAUDIA
Usage: English, German, Dutch, Swedish, Italian, Spanish, Romanian, Biblical, Ancient Roman
Meaning: Feminine form of CLAUDIUS. It is mentioned briefly in the New Testament. As a Christian name it was very rare until the 16th century.

Name: CLAY
Meaning: From an English surname that originally referred to a person who lived near or worked with clay. This name can also be a short form of CLAYTON.

Name: CLAYTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from various English place names, all meaning "clay settlement" in Old English.

Name: CLEM
Meaning: Short form of CLEMENT.

Name: CLEMATIS
Meaning: From the English word for a type of flowering vine, ultimately derived from Greek κλήμα (klema) meaning "twig, branch".

Name: CLEMENCE
Meaning: Feminine form of Clementius (see CLEMENT). It has been in use since the Middle Ages, though it became rare after the 17th century.

Name: CLEMENCY
Meaning: Medieval variant of CLEMENCE. It can also simply mean "clemency, mercy" from the English word, ultimately from Latin clemens "merciful".

Name: CLEMENT
Meaning: English form of the Late Latin name Clemens (or sometimes of its derivative Clementius), which meant "merciful, gentle". This was the name of 14 popes, including Saint Clement I, the third pope, one of the Apostolic Fathers. Another saint by this name was Clement of Alexandria, a 3rd-century theologian and church father who attempted to reconcile Christian and Platonic philosophies. It has been in general as a given name in Christian Europe (in various spellings) since early times. In England it became rare after the Protestant Reformation, though it was revived in the 19th century.

Name: CLEMENTINE
Meaning: English form of CLÉMENTINE.

Name: CLEO
Meaning: Short form of CLEOPATRA, CLEON or CLEOPAS.

Name: CLETIS
Meaning: Variant of CLETUS.

Name: CLETUS
Meaning: Short form of ANACLETUS. This name is sometimes used to refer to the third pope, Saint Anacletus. It can also function as an Anglicized form of KLEITOS.

Name: CLEVE
Meaning: Short form of CLEVELAND.

Name: CLEVELAND
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from an Old English place name meaning "hilly land". This was the surname of American president Grover Cleveland (1837-1908). It is also the name of an American city, which was founded by surveyor Moses Cleaveland (1754-1806).

Name: CLIFF
Meaning: Short form of CLIFFORD or CLIFTON.

Name: CLIFFORD
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from a place name meaning "ford by a cliff" in Old English.

Name: CLIFTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a place name meaning "settlement by a cliff" in Old English.

Name: CLINT
Meaning: Short form of CLINTON. A notable bearer is American actor Clint Eastwood (1930-), who became famous early in his career for his western movies.

Name: CLINTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from an Old English place name meaning "settlement on the River Glyme". A famous bearer of the surname is former American president Bill Clinton (1946-).

Name: CLIVE
Meaning: From a surname meaning "cliff" in Old English, originally belonging to a person who lived near a cliff.

Name: CLOTILDA
Meaning: English form of CLOTILDE.

Name: CLOVER
Meaning: From the English word for the wild flower, ultimately deriving from Old English clafre.

Name: CLYDE
Meaning: From the name of the River Clyde in Scotland, from Cumbric Clud, which is of uncertain origin. It became a common given name in America in the middle of the 19th century, perhaps in honour of Sir Colin Campbell (1792-1863) who was given the title Baron Clyde in 1858.

Name: COBY
Meaning: Masculine or feminine diminutive of JACOB.

Name: CODIE
Meaning: Variant or feminine form of CODY.

Name: CODY
Meaning: From the Irish surname Ó Cuidighthigh, which means "descendant of CUIDIGHTHEACH". A famous bearer of the surname was the American frontiersman and showman Buffalo Bill Cody (1846-1917).

Name: COHEN
Meaning: From a common Jewish surname that was derived from Hebrew כֹּהֵן (kohen) meaning "priest". This surname was traditionally associated with the hereditary priests who claimed descent from the biblical Aaron.

Name: COLBERT
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from a Norman form of the Germanic name COLOBERT.

Name: COLBY
Meaning: From a surname, originally from various English place names, derived from the Old Norse nickname Koli (meaning "coal, dark") and býr "town".

Name: COLE
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from the Old English byname COLA.

Name: COLEEN
Meaning: Variant of COLLEEN.

Name: COLEMAN
Meaning: Variant of COLMÁN.

Name: COLENE
Meaning: Variant of COLLEEN.

Name: COLIN (1)
Meaning: Anglicized form of CAILEAN or COILEAN.

Name: COLIN (2)
Meaning: Medieval diminutive of Col, a short form of NICHOLAS. It is now regarded as an independent name.

Name: COLLEEN
Meaning: Derived from the Irish word cailín meaning "girl". It is not commonly used in Ireland itself, but has been used in America since the early 20th century.

Name: COLLIN
Meaning: Variant of COLIN (2).

Name: COLLYN
Meaning: Variant of COLLEEN or COLIN (2).

Name: COLT
Meaning: From the English word for a young male horse or from the surname of the same origin. It may be given in honour of the American industrialist Samuel Colt (1814-1862) or the firearms company that bears his name.

Name: COLTEN
Meaning: Variant of COLTON.

Name: COLTON
Meaning: From an English surname that was originally from a place name meaning "COLA's town".

Name: COLUMBINE
Meaning: From the name of a variety of flower. It is also an English form of COLOMBINA, the pantomime character.

Name: COMFORT
Meaning: From the English word comfort, ultimately from Latin confortare "to strengthen greatly", a derivative of fortis "strong". It was used as a given name after the Protestant Reformation.

Name: CONNELL
Meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Conaill meaning "descendant of CONALL".

Name: CONNER
Meaning: Variant of CONOR.

Name: CONNIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CONSTANCE and other names beginning with Con. It is occasionally a masculine name, a diminutive of CORNELIUS or CONRAD.

Name: CONNOR
Meaning: Variant of CONOR.

Name: CONOR
Meaning: Anglicized form of the Irish name Conchobar, derived from Old Irish con "hound, dog, wolf" and cobar "desiring". It has been in use in Ireland for centuries and was the name of several Irish kings. It was also borne by the legendary Ulster king Conchobar mac Nessa, known for his tragic desire for Deirdre.

Name: CONRAD
Meaning: Means "brave counsel", derived from the Germanic elements kuoni "brave" and rad "counsel". This was the name of a 10th-century saint and bishop of Konstanz, in southern Germany. It was also borne by several medieval German kings and dukes. In England it was occasionally used during the Middle Ages, but has only been common since the 19th century when it was reintroduced from Germany.

Name: CONSTANCE
Meaning: Medieval form of CONSTANTIA. The Normans introduced this name to England (it was the name of a daughter of William the Conqueror).

Name: CONSTANT
Meaning: From the Late Latin name CONSTANS. It was also used by the Puritans as a vocabulary name, from the English word constant.

Name: CONWAY
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the name of the River Conwy, which possibly means "holy water" in Welsh.

Name: COOPER
Meaning: From a surname meaning "barrel maker", from Middle English couper.

Name: CORA
Meaning: Latinized form of KORE. It was not used as a given name in the English-speaking world until after it was employed by James Fenimore Cooper for a character in his novel The Last of the Mohicans (1826). In some cases it may be a short form of CORDULA, CORINNA or other names beginning with a similar sound.

Name: CORAL
Meaning: From the English and Spanish word coral for the underwater skeletal deposits that can form reefs. It is ultimately derived (via Old French and Latin) from Greek κοράλλιον (korallion).

Name: CORBIN
Meaning: From a French surname that was derived from corbeau "raven", originally denoting a person who had dark hair. The name was probably popularized in America by actor Corbin Bernsen (1954-).

Name: CORDELIA
Meaning: From Cordeilla, possibly a Celtic name of unknown meaning. According to Geoffrey of Monmouth, Cordeilla was the youngest of the three daughters of King Lear and the only one to remain loyal to her father. When adapting the character for his play King Lear (1606), Shakespeare altered the spelling to Cordelia.

Name: CORDELL
Meaning: From a surname meaning "maker of cord" or "seller of cord" in Middle English.

Name: COREEN
Meaning: Variant of CORINNE.

Name: CORETTA
Meaning: Diminutive of CORA. It was borne by Coretta Scott King (1927-2006), the wife of Martin Luther King.

Name: COREY
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the Old Norse given name Kóri, of unknown meaning. This name became popular in the 1960s due to the character Corey Baker on the television series Julia.

Name: CORI
Meaning: Feminine form of COREY.

Name: CORIANDER
Meaning: From the name of the spice, also called cilantro, which may ultimately be of Phoenician origin (via Latin and Greek).

Name: CORIE
Meaning: Variant of CORRIE.

Name: CORINA
Meaning: Variant of CORINNA.

Name: CORINE
Meaning: Variant of CORINNE.

Name: CORINNA
Meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Κορίννα (Korinna), which was derived from κόρη (kore) meaning "maiden". This was the name of a Greek lyric poet of the 5th century BC. The Roman poet Ovid used it for the main female character in his book Amores. In the modern era it has been in use since the 17th century, when Robert Herrick used it in his poem Corinna's going a-Maying.

Name: CORINNE
Meaning: French form of CORINNA. The French-Swiss author Madame de Staël used it for her novel Corinne (1807).

Name: CORNELIA
Usage: German, Romanian, Italian, Dutch, English, Ancient Roman
Meaning: Feminine form of CORNELIUS. In the 2nd century BC it was borne by Cornelia Scipionis Africana (the daughter of the military hero Scipio Africanus), the mother of the two reformers known as the Gracchi. After her death she was regarded as an example of the ideal Roman woman. The name was revived in the 18th century.

Name: CORNELIUS
Usage: Ancient Roman, English, Dutch, German, Biblical
Meaning: Roman family name that possibly derives from the Latin element cornu meaning "horn". In Acts in the New Testament Cornelius is a centurion who is directed by an angel to seek Peter. After speaking with Peter he converts to Christianity, and he is traditionally deemed the first gentile convert. The name was also borne by a few early saints, including a 3rd-century pope. In England it came into use in the 16th century, partly due to Dutch influence.

Name: CORNELL
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the given name CORNELIUS.

Name: CORRIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CORINNA, CORA, CORNELIA and other names starting with Cor. Since the 1970s it has also been used as a feminine form of COREY.

Name: CORRINA
Meaning: Variant of CORINNA.

Name: CORRINE
Meaning: Variant of CORINNE.

Name: CORTNEY
Meaning: Variant of COURTNEY.

Name: CORWIN
Meaning: From an English surname, derived from Old French cordoan "leather", ultimately from the name of the Spanish city of Cordova.

Name: CORY
Meaning: Variant of COREY.

Name: CORYNN
Meaning: Variant of CORINNE.

Name: COSMO
Meaning: Italian variant of COSIMO. It was introduced to Britain in the 18th century by the second Scottish Duke of Gordon, who named his son and successor after his friend Cosimo III de' Medici.

Name: COTY
Meaning: Variant of CODY.

Name: COURTNEY
Meaning: From an aristocratic English surname that was derived either from the French place name Courtenay (originally a derivative of the personal name Curtenus, itself derived from Latin curtus "short") or else from a Norman nickname meaning "short nose". As a feminine name in America, it first became popular during the 1970s.

Name: COY
Meaning: From a surname that meant "quiet, shy, coy" from Middle English coi.

Name: CRAIG
Meaning: From a Scottish surname that was derived from Gaelic creag meaning "crag" or "rocks", originally indicating a person who lived near a crag.

Name: CRAWFORD
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "crow ford" in Old English.

Name: CREE
Meaning: From the name of a Native American tribe of central Canada. Their name derives via French from the Cree word kiristino.

Name: CREIGHTON
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name, originally from Gaelic crioch "border" combined with Old English tun "town".

Name: CREW
Meaning: Either from a surname that was derived from the English town of Crewe (from Old Welsh criu meaning "weir"), or from the English vocabulary word for a group of people.

Name: CRISPIAN
Meaning: Medieval variant of CRISPIN.

Name: CRISPIN
Meaning: From the Roman cognomen Crispinus, which was derived from the name CRISPUS. Saint Crispin was a 3rd-century Roman who was martyred with his twin brother Crispinian in Gaul. They are the patrons of shoemakers. They were popular saints in England during the Middle Ages, and the name has occasionally been used since that time.

Name: CRISTAL
Meaning: Variant of CRYSTAL.

Name: CRISTEN
Meaning: Variant of KRISTIN.

Name: CROFTON
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "town with a small enclosed field" in Old English.

Name: CRYSTAL
Meaning: From the English word crystal for the clear, colourless glass, sometimes cut into the shape of a gemstone. The English word derives ultimately from Greek κρύσταλλος (krystallos) meaning "ice". It has been in use as a given name since the 19th century.

Name: CULLEN
Meaning: From a surname, either CULLEN (1) or CULLEN (2).

Name: CURT
Meaning: Either a variant of KURT or short form of CURTIS.

Name: CURTIS
Meaning: From an English surname that originally meant "courteous" in Old French.

Name: CUTHBERT
Meaning: Derived from the Old English elements cuþ "famous" and beorht "bright". Saint Cuthbert was a 6th-century hermit who became the bishop of Lindisfarne, an island off the coast of England. He was known as performer of healing miracles. Because of the saint, this name remained in use in England even after the Norman Conquest. It became rare after the Protestant Reformation, but it was (briefly) revived in the 19th century.

Name: CY
Meaning: Short form of CYRUS or CYRIL.

Name: CYAN
Meaning: From the English word meaning "greenish blue", ultimately derived from Greek κύανος (kyanos).

Name: CYBILL
Meaning: Variant of SIBYL. This name was borne by actress Cybill Shepherd (1950-), who was named after her grandfather Cy and her father Bill.

Name: CYDNEY
Meaning: Variant of SYDNEY.

Name: CYMONE
Meaning: Variant of SIMONE (1).

Name: CYNDI
Meaning: Short form of CYNTHIA.

Name: CYNTHIA
Meaning: Latinized form of Greek Κυνθία (Kynthia), which means "woman from Kynthos". This was an epithet of the Greek moon goddess Artemis, given because Kynthos was the mountain on Delos on which she and her twin brother Apollo were born. It was not used as a given name until the Renaissance, and it did not become common in the English-speaking world until the 19th century. It reached a peak of popularity in the United States in 1957 and has declined steadily since then.

Name: CYPRIAN
Meaning: From the Roman family name Cyprianus, which meant "from Cyprus". Saint Cyprian was a 3rd-century bishop of Carthage and a martyr under the emperor Valerian.

Name: CYRIL
Meaning: From the Greek name Κύριλλος (Kyrillos), which was derived from Greek κύριος (kyrios) meaning "lord", a word used frequently in the Greek Bible to refer to God or Jesus.... [more]

Name: CYRILLA
Meaning: Feminine form of CYRIL.

Name: CYRUS
Usage: English, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Ancient Greek (Latinized)
Meaning: From Κῦρος (Kyros), the Greek form of the Persian name Kūrush, which may mean "far sighted" or "young". The name is sometimes associated with Greek κύριος (kyrios) meaning "lord". It was borne by several kings of Persia, including Cyrus the Great, who conquered Babylon. He is famous in the Old Testament for freeing the captive Jews and allowing them to return to Israel. As an English name, it first came into use among the Puritans after the Protestant Reformation.

Name: DACRE
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a place name in Cumbria, of Brythonic origin meaning "trickling stream".

Name: DAFFODIL
Meaning: From the name of the flower, ultimately derived from Dutch de affodil meaning "the asphodel".

Name: DAHLIA
Meaning: From the name of the flower, which was named for the Swedish botanist Anders Dahl.

Name: DAISY
Meaning: Simply from the English word for the white flower, ultimately derived from Old English dægeseage meaning "day eye". It was first used as a given name in the 19th century, at the same time many other plant and flower names were coined.

Name: DAKOTA
Meaning: From the name of the Native American people of the northern Mississippi valley, or from the two American states that were named for them: North and South Dakota (until 1889 unified as the Dakota Territory). The tribal name means "allies, friends" in the Dakota language.

Name: DALE
Meaning: From an English surname that originally belonged to a person who lived near a dale or valley.

Name: DALEY
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from Ó Dálaigh meaning "descendant of Dálach". The name Dálach means "assembly" in Gaelic.

Name: DALLAS
Meaning: From a surname that could either be of Old English origin meaning "valley house" or of Scottish Gaelic origin meaning "meadow dwelling". A city in Texas bears this name, probably in honour of American Vice President George M. Dallas (1792-1864).

Name: DALTON
Meaning: From an English surname that was originally derived from a place name meaning "valley town" in Old English. A notable bearer of the surname was John Dalton (1766-1844), the English chemist and physicist who theorized about the existence of atoms.

Name: DALY
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of DALEY.

Name: DAMIAN
Meaning: From the Greek name Δαμιανός (Damianos), which was derived from Greek δαμάζω (damazo) meaning "to tame". Saint Damian was martyred with his twin brother Cosmas in Syria early in the 4th century. They are the patron saints of physicians. Due to his renown, the name came into general use in Christian Europe. Another saint by this name was Peter Damian, an 11th-century cardinal and theologian from Italy.

Name: DAMION
Meaning: Variant of DAMIAN.

Name: DAMON
Meaning: Derived from Greek δαμάζω (damazo) meaning "to tame". According to Greek legend, Damon and Pythias were friends who lived on Syracuse in the 4th century BC. When Pythias was sentenced to death, he was allowed to temporarily go free on the condition that Damon take his place in prison. Pythias returned just before Damon was to be executed in his place, and the king was so impressed with their loyalty to one another that he pardoned Pythias. As an English given name, it has only been regularly used since the 20th century.

Name: DAN (2)
Usage: English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Romanian, Czech, German, Swedish, Danish, Norwegian
Meaning: Short form of DANIEL.

Name: DANA (2)
Meaning: From a surname that originally belonged to a person who was Danish. It was originally given in honour of American lawyer Richard Henry Dana (1815-1882), the author of Two Years Before the Mast.

Name: DANE
Meaning: From an English surname that was either a variant of the surname DEAN or else an ethnic name referring to a person from Denmark.

Name: DANETTE
Meaning: Feminine diminutive of DANIEL.

Name: DANI (1)
Meaning: Diminutive of DANIELLE.

Name: DANICA
Usage: Serbian, Croatian, Slovene, Slovak, Macedonian, English
Meaning: From a Slavic word meaning "morning star, Venus". This name occurs in Slavic folklore as a personification of the morning star. It has sometimes been used in the English-speaking world since the 1970s.

Name: DANIEL
Usage: English, Hebrew, French, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Polish, Czech, Slovak, Spanish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovene, Bulgarian, Macedonian, Croatian, Armenian, Georgian, Biblical, Biblical Greek
Meaning: From the Hebrew name דָּנִיֵּאל (Daniyyel) meaning "God is my judge", from the roots דִּין (din) meaning "to judge" and אֵל ('el) meaning "God". Daniel was a Hebrew prophet whose story is told in the Book of Daniel in the Old Testament. He lived during the Jewish captivity in Babylon, where he served in the court of the king, rising to prominence by interpreting the king's dreams. The book also presents Daniel's four visions of the end of the world.... [more]

Name: DANIELA
Usage: Italian, German, Polish, Czech, Slovak, Romanian, Portuguese, Spanish, Bulgarian, Macedonian, Hebrew, English
Meaning: Feminine form of DANIEL.

Name: DANIELLA
Meaning: Feminine form of DANIEL.

Name: DANIELLE
Meaning: French feminine form of DANIEL. It has been commonly used in the English-speaking world only since the 20th century.

Name: DANIKA
Meaning: Variant of DANICA.

Name: DANITA
Meaning: Feminine diminutive of DANIEL.

Name: DANNA
Meaning: Feminine form of DANIEL or DAN (1).

Name: DANNI
Meaning: Diminutive of DANIELLE (English) or DANIEL (Danish).

Name: DANNIE
Meaning: Diminutive of DANIEL or DANIELLE.

Name: DANNY
Meaning: Diminutive of DANIEL.

Name: DAPHNE
Meaning: Means "laurel" in Greek. In Greek mythology she was a nymph turned into a laurel tree by her father in order that she might escape the pursuit of Apollo. It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since the end of the 19th century.

Name: DARBY
Meaning: From an English surname, which was derived from the name of the town of Derby, meaning "deer town" in Old Norse.

Name: DARCEY
Meaning: Feminine variant of DARCY.

Name: DARCIE
Meaning: Feminine variant of DARCY.

Name: DARCY
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from Norman French d'Arcy, originally denoting one who came from Arcy in France. This was the surname of a character in Jane Austen's novel Pride and Prejudice (1813).

Name: DARDEN
Meaning: From an English surname of unknown meaning, possibly from a place name.

Name: DARELL
Meaning: Variant of DARRELL.

Name: DAREN
Meaning: Variant of DARREN.

Name: DARIA
Usage: Italian, Polish, Romanian, English, Croatian, Russian, Late Greek (Latinized)
Meaning: Feminine form of DARIUS. Saint Daria was a 3rd-century Greek woman who was martyred with her husband Chrysanthus under the Roman emperor Numerian. It has never been a particularly common English given name. As a Russian name, it is more commonly transcribed Darya.

Name: DARIAN
Meaning: Probably an elaborated form of DARREN.

Name: DARIEN
Meaning: Variant of DARIAN.

Name: DARIN
Meaning: Variant of DARREN. This was the adopted surname of the singer Bobby Darin (1936-1973), who was born Robert Cassotto and chose his stage name from a street sign.

Name: DARION
Meaning: Variant of DARIAN.

Name: DARIUS
Usage: English, Lithuanian, Romanian, Biblical, Biblical Latin
Meaning: Roman form of Δαρεῖος (Dareios), which was the Greek form of the Persian name Dārayavahush meaning "possessing goodness", composed of the elements dâraya "to possess" and vahu "good". Three ancient kings of Persia bore this name, including Darius the Great who expanded the Achaemenid Empire to its greatest extent. His forces invaded Greece but were defeated in the Battle of Marathon.... [more]

Name: DARLA
Meaning: Short form of DARLENE.

Name: DARLEEN
Meaning: Variant of DARLENE.

Name: DARLENE
Meaning: From the English word darling combined with the popular name suffix lene. This name has been in use since the beginning of the 20th century.

Name: DARNELL
Meaning: From a surname, possibly derived from Old French darnel, a type of grass. Alternatively it may be derived from Old English derne "hidden" and halh "nook".

Name: DARREL
Meaning: Variant of DARRELL.

Name: DARRELL
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from Norman French d'Airelle, originally denoting one who came from Airelle in France.

Name: DARREN
Meaning: The meaning of this name is not known for certain. It could be from a rare Irish surname or it could be an altered form of DARRELL. It was first brought to public attention in the late 1950s by the American actor Darren McGavin (1922-2006). It was further popularized in the 1960s by the character Darrin Stephens from the television show Bewitched.

Name: DARRIN
Meaning: Variant of DARREN.

Name: DARRYL
Meaning: Variant of DARRELL.

Name: DARWIN
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the Old English given name DEORWINE. The surname was borne by the English naturalist Charles Darwin (1809-1882), the man who first proposed the theory of natural selection and subsequently revolutionized biology.

Name: DARYL
Meaning: Variant of DARRELL.

Name: DASHIELL
Meaning: In the case of American author Dashiell Hammett (1894-1961) it was from his mother's surname, which was possibly an Anglicized form of French de Chiel, of unknown meaning.

Name: DAVE
Meaning: Short form of DAVID.

Name: DAVENA
Meaning: Variant of DAVINA.

Name: DAVEY
Meaning: Diminutive of DAVID.

Name: DAVID
Usage: English, Hebrew, French, Scottish, Spanish, Portuguese, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch, Czech, Slovene, Russian, Croatian, Serbian, Macedonian, Romanian, Biblical, Biblical Latin
Meaning: From the Hebrew name דָּוִד (Dawid), which was derived from Hebrew דּוֹד (dod) meaning "beloved" or "uncle". David was the second and greatest of the kings of Israel, ruling in the 10th century BC. Several stories about him are told in the Old Testament, including his defeat of Goliath, a giant Philistine. According to the New Testament, Jesus was descended from him.... [more]

Name: DAVIDA
Meaning: Feminine form of DAVID.

Name: DAVIE
Meaning: Diminutive of DAVID.

Name: DAVIN
Meaning: Possibly a variant of DEVIN influenced by DAVID.

Name: DAVINA
Meaning: Feminine form of DAVID. It originated in Scotland.

Name: DAVINIA
Meaning: Variant of DAVINA.

Name: DAVIS
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the given name DAVID. A famous bearer of the surname was Jefferson Davis (1808-1889), the only president of the Confederate States of America.

Name: DAVY
Meaning: Diminutive of DAVID.

Name: DAWN
Meaning: From the English word dawn, ultimately derived from Old English dagung.

Name: DAWSON
Meaning: From a surname meaning "son of DAVID". This name was popularized in the late 1990s by the television drama Dawson's Creek.

Name: DAX
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived either from the town of Dax in France or else from the Old English given name Dæcca (of unknown meaning).

Name: DAXTON
Meaning: Elaboration of DAX influenced by names such as Paxton and Braxton.

Name: DAYNA
Meaning: Feminine variant of DANA (2).

Name: DAYTON
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from a place name, which possibly meant either "dairy town" or "ditch town" in Old English.

Name: DEACON
Meaning: Either from the occupational surname Deacon or directly from the vocabulary word deacon, which refers to a cleric in the Christian church (ultimately from Greek διάκονος (diakonos) meaning "servant").

Name: DEAN
Meaning: From a surname, see DEAN (1) and DEAN (2). The actor James Dean (1931-1955) was a famous bearer of the surname.

Name: DEANA
Meaning: Variant of DEANNA.

Name: DEANNA
Meaning: Either a variant of DIANA or a feminine form of DEAN. This name was popularized by the Canadian actress and singer Deanna Durbin (1921-), whose birth name was Edna. Her stage name was a rearrangement of the letters of her real name.

Name: DEANNE
Meaning: Variant of DEANNA.

Name: DEB
Meaning: Short form of DEBORAH.

Name: DEBBI
Meaning: Diminutive of DEBORAH.

Name: DEBBIE
Meaning: Diminutive of DEBORAH.

Name: DEBBY
Meaning: Diminutive of DEBORAH.

Name: DEBI
Meaning: Diminutive of DEBORAH.

Name: DEBORAH
Meaning: From the Hebrew name דְּבוֹרָה (Devorah) meaning "bee". In the Old Testament Book of Judges, Deborah is a heroine and prophetess who leads the Israelites when they are threatened by the Canaanites. She forms an army under the command of Barak, and together they destroy the army of the Canaanite commander Sisera. Also in the Old Testament, this is the name of the nurse of Rebecca.... [more]

Name: DEBRA
Meaning: Variant of DEBORAH.

Name: DEDERICK
Meaning: Older form of DEREK.

Name: DEE
Meaning: Short form of names beginning with D. It may also be given in reference to the Dee River in Scotland.

Name: DEEANN
Meaning: Variant of DEANNA.

Name: DEEMER
Meaning: From an English and Scottish surname meaning "judge", from Old English demere.

Name: DEENA
Meaning: Variant of DEANNA.

Name: DEFOREST
Meaning: From a French surname meaning "from the forest". It was originally given in honour of American author John Deforest (1826-1906).

Name: DEFORREST
Meaning: Variant of DEFOREST.

Name: DEIDRA
Meaning: Variant of DEIRDRE.

Name: DEIDRE
Meaning: Variant of DEIRDRE.

Name: DEIRDRE
Meaning: From the older Gaelic form Derdriu, meaning unknown, possibly derived from Old Irish der meaning "daughter". This was the name of a tragic character in Irish legend who died of a broken heart after Conchobhar, the king of Ulster, forced her to be his bride and killed her lover Naoise.... [more]

Name: DEITRA
Meaning: Variant of DEIRDRE.

Name: DELANEY
Meaning: From a surname: either the English surname DELANEY (1) or the Irish surname DELANEY (2).

Name: DELANO
Meaning: From a surname, recorded as de la Noye in French, indicating that the bearer was from a place called La Noue (ultimately Gaulish meaning "wetland, swamp"). It has been used in honour of American president Franklin Delano Roosevelt (1882-1945), whose middle name came from his mother's maiden name.

Name: DELBERT
Meaning: Short form of ADELBERT. As an American name it was first used in the New York area by people of Dutch ancestry.

Name: DELIA (1)
Usage: English, Italian, Spanish, Romanian, Greek Mythology
Meaning: Means "of Delos" in Greek. This was an epithet of the Greek goddess Artemis, given because she and her twin brother Apollo were born on the island of Delos. The name appeared in several poems of the 16th and 17th centuries, and it has occasionally been used as a given name since that time.

Name: DELIA (2)
Meaning: Short form of ADELIA or BEDELIA.

Name: DELICE
Meaning: Variant of DELICIA.

Name: DELICIA
Meaning: Either from Latin deliciae "delight, pleasure" or a variant of the English word delicious. It has only been used since the 20th century (rarely).

Name: DELIGHT
Meaning: Means simply "delight, happiness" from the English word.

Name: DELILAH
Meaning: Means "delicate, weak, languishing" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament she is the lover of Samson, whom she betrays to the Philistines by cutting his hair, which is the source of his power. Despite her character flaws, the name began to be used by the Puritans in the 17th century. It has been used occasionally in the English-speaking world since that time.

Name: DELL
Meaning: From an English surname that originally denoted a person who lived in a dell or valley.

Name: DELLA
Meaning: Diminutive of ADELA or ADELAIDE. A famous bearer is American actress and singer Della Reese (1931-).

Name: DELMA
Meaning: Short form of FIDELMA.

Name: DELMAR
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from Norman French de la mare meaning "from the pond".

Name: DELORA
Meaning: Altered form of DOLORES.

Name: DELORES
Meaning: Variant of DOLORES.

Name: DELORIS
Meaning: Variant of DOLORES.

Name: DELPHIA
Meaning: Possibly from the name of the Greek city of Delphi, the site of an oracle of Apollo, which is possibly related to Greek δελφύς (delphys) meaning "womb". It was used in the play The Prophetess (1647), in which it belongs to the title prophetess.

Name: DELROY
Meaning: Possibly an alteration of LEROY.

Name: DELTA
Meaning: From the name of the fourth letter in the Greek alphabet, Δ. It is also the name for an island formed at the mouth of a river.

Name: DEMELZA
Meaning: From a Cornish place name meaning "fort of Maeldaf". It has been used as a given name since the middle of the 20th century. It was popularized in the 1970s by a character from the British television series Poldark, which was set in Cornwall.

Name: DEMETRIA
Meaning: Feminine form of DEMETRIUS.

Name: DEN
Meaning: Short form of DENNIS.

Name: DENA
Meaning: Possibly a short form of names ending with dena. It has also been used as a variant of DEANNA.

Name: DENE
Meaning: Possibly a variant of DEAN or DENA.

Name: DENHOLM
Meaning: From a surname that was originally taken from a place name meaning "valley island" in Old English.

Name: DENICE
Meaning: Variant of DENISE.

Name: DENIECE
Meaning: Variant of DENISE.

Name: DENIS
Usage: French, Russian, English, German, Czech, Slovak, Slovene, Romanian, Croatian
Meaning: From Denys or Denis, the medieval French forms of DIONYSIUS. Saint Denis was a 3rd-century missionary to Gaul and the first bishop of Paris. He was martyred by decapitation, after which legend says he picked up his own severed head and walked for a distance while preaching a sermon. He is credited with converting the Gauls to Christianity and is considered the patron saint of France.... [more]

Name: DENISE
Meaning: French feminine form of DENIS.

Name: DENNIS
Meaning: Usual English, German and Dutch form of DENIS.

Name: DENNY
Meaning: Diminutive of DENNIS.

Name: DENTON
Meaning: From a surname, originally from a place name, which meant "valley town" in Old English.

Name: DENVER
Meaning: From an English surname that was from a place name meaning "Dane ford" in Old English. This is the name of the capital city of Colorado, which was named for the politician James W. Denver (1817-1892).

Name: DENZEL
Meaning: Possibly a variant of DENZIL. This spelling of the name was popularized by American actor Denzel Washington (1954-), who was named after his father.

Name: DENZIL
Meaning: From a surname that originally denoted a person from the manor of Denzell in Cornwall. This given name was borne by several members of the noble Holles family starting in the 16th century, notably the statesman Denzil Holles (1599-1680). They were named for John Denzel, an ancestor whose home was Denzell.

Name: DEON
Meaning: Variant of DION.

Name: DEONNE
Meaning: Variant of DIONNE.

Name: DERBY
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of DARBY.

Name: DEREK
Meaning: From the older English name Dederick, which was in origin a Low German form of THEODORIC. It was imported to England from the Low Countries in the 15th century.

Name: DERICK
Meaning: Variant of DEREK.

Name: DERREN
Meaning: Variant of DARREN.

Name: DERRICK
Meaning: Variant of DEREK.

Name: DERRYL
Meaning: Variant of DARRELL.

Name: DERYCK
Meaning: Variant of DEREK.

Name: DES
Meaning: Short form of DESMOND.

Name: DESIRAE
Meaning: Variant of DESIREE.

Name: DESIREE
Meaning: English form of DÉSIRÉE. It was popularized in the English-speaking world by the movie Désirée (1954).

Name: DESMOND
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from Deasmhumhain meaning "South Munster", originally indicating a person who came from that region in Ireland.

Name: DESTINEE
Meaning: Variant of DESTINY.

Name: DESTINY
Meaning: Means simply "destiny, fate" from the English word, ultimately from Latin destinare "to determine", a derivative of stare "to stand". It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world only since the last half of the 20th century.

Name: DETTA
Meaning: Short form of names that end in detta.

Name: DEVAN
Meaning: Variant of DEVIN.

Name: DEVEN
Meaning: Variant of DEVIN.

Name: DEVEREUX
Meaning: From an English surname, of Norman French origin, meaning "from Evreux". Evreux is a town in France.

Name: DEVIN
Meaning: From a surname, either the Irish surname DEVIN (1) or the English surname DEVIN (2).

Name: DEVON
Meaning: Variant of DEVIN. It may also be partly inspired by the name of the county of Devon in England, which got its name from the Dumnonii, a Celtic tribe.

Name: DEVYN
Meaning: Variant of DEVIN.

Name: DEWAYNE
Meaning: Variant of DUANE.

Name: DEWEY
Meaning: Probably a variant of DEWI (1).

Name: DEX
Meaning: Short form of DEXTER.

Name: DEXTER
Meaning: From an occupational surname meaning "one who dyes" in Old English. It also coincides with the Latin word dexter meaning "right-handed, skilled".

Name: DEZI
Meaning: Diminutive of DESMOND and other names beginning with a similar sound.

Name: DEZIREE
Meaning: Variant of DÉSIRÉE.

Name: DI
Meaning: Short form of DIANA.

Name: DIAMOND
Meaning: From the English word diamond for the clear colourless precious stone, the birthstone of April. It is derived from Late Latin diamas, from Latin adamas, which is of Greek origin meaning "invincible, untamed".

Name: DIANA
Usage: English, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, Romanian, Catalan, German, Dutch, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Russian, Ukrainian, Bulgarian, Estonian, Lithuanian, Polish, Czech, Slovak, Roman Mythology
Meaning: Probably derived from an old Indo-European root meaning "heavenly, divine", related to dyeus (see ZEUS). Diana was a Roman goddess of the moon, hunting, forests, and childbirth, often identified with the Greek goddess Artemis.... [more]

Name: DIANE
Meaning: French form of DIANA, also regularly used in the English-speaking world.

Name: DIANN
Meaning: Variant of DIANE.

Name: DIANNA
Meaning: Variant of DIANA.

Name: DIANNE
Meaning: Variant of DIANE.

Name: DIANTHA
Meaning: From dianthus, the name of a type of flower (ultimately from Greek meaning "heavenly flower").

Name: DICK (1)
Meaning: Medieval diminutive of RICHARD. The change in the initial consonant is said to have been caused by the way the trilled Norman R was pronounced by the English.

Name: DIGBY
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the name of an English town, itself derived from a combination of Old English dic "dyke, ditch" and Old Norse byr "farm, town".

Name: DIGGORY
Meaning: Probably an Anglicized form of Degaré. Sir Degaré was the subject of a medieval poem set in Brittany. The name may mean "lost one" from French égaré.

Name: DILLAN
Meaning: Variant of DYLAN.

Name: DILLON
Meaning: Variant of DYLAN based on the spelling of the surname Dillon, which has an unrelated origin.

Name: DINA (2)
Meaning: Short form of names ending in dina, such as BERNARDINA or ONDINA. As an English name, this can also be a variant of DEANNA.

Name: DINAH
Meaning: Means "judged" in Hebrew. She is the daughter of Jacob and Leah in the Old Testament. It has been used as an English given name since after the Protestant Reformation.

Name: DION
Meaning: Short form of DIONYSIOS and other Greek names beginning with the Greek element Διός (Dios) meaning "of ZEUS". This was the name of a 4th-century BC tyrant of Syracuse. It has been used as an American given name since the middle of the 20th century.

Name: DIONE (2)
Meaning: Feminine form of DION.

Name: DIONNE
Meaning: Feminine form of DION.

Name: DIRK
Meaning: Short form of DIEDERIK. The name was popularized in the English-speaking world by actor Dirk Bogarde (1921-1999), who had some Dutch ancestry. This is also the Scots word for a type of dagger.

Name: DIVINA
Meaning: From an elaboration of the English word divine meaning "divine, godlike".

Name: DIXIE
Meaning: From the term that refers to the southern United States, used by Daniel D. Emmett in his song Dixie in 1859. The term may be derived from French dix "ten", which was printed on ten-dollar bills issued from a New Orleans bank.

Name: DIXON
Meaning: From an English surname meaning "DICK (1)'s son".

Name: DOCIA
Meaning: Possibly a diminutive of THEODOSIA.

Name: DODIE
Meaning: Diminutive of DOROTHY.

Name: DOLLIE
Meaning: Variant of DOLLY.

Name: DOLLY
Meaning: Diminutive of DOROTHY. Doll and Dolly were used from the 16th century, and the common English word doll (for the plaything) is derived from them. In modern times this name is also sometimes used as a diminutive of DOLORES.

Name: DOLORES
Meaning: Means "sorrows", taken from the Spanish title of the Virgin Mary María de los Dolores, meaning "Mary of Sorrows". It has been used in the English-speaking world since the 19th century, becoming especially popular in America during the 1920s and 30s.

Name: DOLPH
Meaning: Short form of ADOLPH.

Name: DOM
Meaning: Short form of DOMINIC.

Name: DOMENIC
Meaning: Variant of DOMINIC.

Name: DOMINIC
Meaning: From the Late Latin name Dominicus meaning "of the Lord". This name was traditionally given to a child born on Sunday. Several saints have borne this name, including the 13th-century founder of the Dominican order of friars. It was in this saint's honour that the name was first used in England, starting around the 13th century. It is primarily used by Catholics.

Name: DOMINICA
Meaning: Feminine form of DOMINIC.

Name: DOMINICK
Meaning: Variant of DOMINIC.

Name: DON
Meaning: Short form of DONALD.

Name: DONA
Meaning: Variant of DONNA.

Name: DONALD
Meaning: From the Gaelic name Domhnall meaning "ruler of the world", composed of the old Celtic elements dumno "world" and val "rule". This was the name of two 9th-century kings of the Scots and Picts. It has traditionally been very popular in Scotland, and during the 20th century it became common in the rest of the English-speaking world. This is the name of one of Walt Disney's most popular cartoon characters, Donald Duck. It was also borne by Australian cricket player Donald Bradman (1908-2001).

Name: DONELLE
Meaning: Feminine form of DON.

Name: DONNA
Meaning: From Italian donna meaning "lady". It is also used as a feminine form of DONALD.

Name: DONNIE
Meaning: Diminutive of DONALD.

Name: DONNY
Meaning: Diminutive of DONALD.

Name: DONOVAN
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from Ó Donndubháin meaning "descendant of DONNDUBHÁN".

Name: DORA
Usage: English, Italian, Spanish, Greek, Croatian, Serbian, Dutch
Meaning: Short form of DOROTHY, THEODORA or ISIDORA.

Name: DOREAN
Meaning: Variant of DOREEN.

Name: DOREEN
Meaning: Combination of DORA and the name suffix een. The name was (first?) used by novelist Edna Lyall in her novel Doreen (1894).

Name: DORETTA
Meaning: Diminutive of DORA.

Name: DORIA
Meaning: Possibly a feminine form of DORIAN or an elaboration of DORA.

Name: DORIAN
Meaning: The name was first used by Oscar Wilde in his novel The Picture of Dorian Gray (1891), which tells the story of a man whose portrait ages while he stays young. Wilde may have taken it from the name of the ancient Greek tribe the Dorians.

Name: DORINDA
Meaning: Combination of DORA and the name suffix inda. It was apparently coined by the English writers John Dryden and William D'Avenant for their play The Enchanted Island (1667). In the play, a loose adaptation of Shakespeare's The Tempest, Dorinda is the sister of Miranda.

Name: DORINE
Meaning: Variant of DOREEN.

Name: DORIS
Usage: English, German, Croatian, Ancient Greek, Greek Mythology
Meaning: From the Greek name Δωρίς (Doris), which meant "Dorian woman". The Dorians were a Greek tribe who occupied the Peloponnese starting in the 12th century BC. In Greek mythology Doris was a sea nymph, one of the many children of Oceanus and Tethys. It began to be used as an English name in the 19th century. A famous bearer is the American actress Doris Day (1924-2019).

Name: DOROTHEA
Usage: German, Dutch, Danish, Norwegian, English, Late Greek
Meaning: Feminine form of the Late Greek name Δωρόθεος (Dorotheos), which meant "gift of God" from Greek δῶρον (doron) meaning "gift" and θεός (theos) meaning "god". The name Theodore is composed of the same elements in reverse order. Dorothea was the name of two early saints, notably the 4th-century martyr Dorothea of Caesarea. It was also borne by the 14th-century Saint Dorothea of Montau, who was the patron saint of Prussia.

Name: DOROTHY
Meaning: Usual English form of DOROTHEA. It has been in use since the 16th century. The author L. Frank Baum used it for the central character in his fantasy novel The Wonderful Wizard of Oz (1900) and several of its sequels.

Name: DORRIS
Meaning: Variant of DORIS.

Name: DORTHA
Meaning: Variant of DOROTHY.

Name: DORTHY
Meaning: Variant of DOROTHY.

Name: DORY
Meaning: Diminutive of DOROTHY or DORIS. This is the name of a fish in the animated film Finding Nemo (2003).

Name: DOT
Meaning: Diminutive of DOROTHY.

Name: DOTTIE
Meaning: Diminutive of DOROTHY.

Name: DOTTY
Meaning: Diminutive of DOROTHY.

Name: DOUG
Meaning: Short form of DOUGLAS.

Name: DOUGLAS
Meaning: Anglicized form of the Scottish surname Dubhghlas, meaning "dark river" from Gaelic dubh "dark" and glais "water, river" (an archaic word related to glas "grey, green"). Douglas was originally a place name (for example, a tributary of the River Clyde), which then became a Scottish clan name borne by a powerful line of earls. It has been used as a given name since the 16th century.

Name: DOVE
Meaning: From the English word for the variety of bird, seen as a symbol of peace.

Name: DRAKE
Meaning: From an English surname derived from the Old Norse byname Draki or the Old English byname Draca both meaning "dragon", both via Latin from Greek δράκων (drakon) meaning "dragon, serpent". This name coincides with the unrelated English word drake meaning "male duck".

Name: DRE
Meaning: Short form of ANDRE.

Name: DREA
Meaning: Short form of ANDREA (2).

Name: DREAM
Meaning: From the English word dream referring to imaginary events seen in the mind while sleeping or a hope or wish.

Name: DREDA
Meaning: Short form of ETHELDREDA.

Name: DREW
Meaning: Short form of ANDREW.

Name: DRINA
Meaning: Diminutive of ADRIANA or ALEXANDRINA.

Name: DRISCOLL
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was an Anglicized form of Ó Eidirsceóil meaning "descendant of the messenger".

Name: DRISKOLL
Meaning: Variant of DRISCOLL.

Name: DROGO
Meaning: Norman name, possibly derived from Gothic dragen meaning "to carry" or Saxon drog meaning "ghost". Alternatively, it could be from the Slavic element dragu meaning "precious, dear". The Normans introduced this name to England.

Name: DRUMMOND
Meaning: From a Scottish surname that was derived from various place names, themselves derived from Gaelic druim meaning "ridge".

Name: DUANA
Meaning: Feminine form of DUANE.

Name: DUANE
Meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of the Gaelic surname Ó Dubhán meaning "descendant of DUBHÁN".

Name: DUDLEY
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from a place name meaning "Dudda's clearing" in Old English. The surname was borne by a British noble family.

Name: DUKE
Meaning: From the noble title duke, which was originally derived from Latin dux "leader".

Name: DULCIBELLA
Meaning: From Latin dulcis "sweet" and bella "beautiful". The usual medieval spelling of this name was Dowsabel, and the Latinized form Dulcibella was revived in the 18th century.

Name: DULCIE
Meaning: From Latin dulcis meaning "sweet". It was used in the Middle Ages in the spellings Dowse and Duce, and was recoined in the 19th century.

Name: DUNCAN
Meaning: Anglicized form of the Gaelic name Donnchadh, derived from Gaelic donn "brown" and cath "battle". This was the name of two kings of Scotland, including the one who was featured in Shakespeare's play Macbeth (1606).

Name: DUNSTAN
