Meaning: Variant or feminine form of LAURENCE (1). Originally a masculine name, it was first popularized as a feminine name by actress Betty Jean Perske (1924-), who used Lauren Bacall as her stage name.

Name: LAURENA
Meaning: Elaboration of LAUREN.

Name: LAURENCE (1)
Meaning: From the Roman cognomen Laurentius, which meant "from Laurentum". Laurentum was a city in ancient Italy, its name probably deriving from Latin laurus "laurel". Saint Laurence was a 3rd-century deacon and martyr from Rome. According to tradition he was roasted alive on a gridiron because, when ordered to hand over the church's treasures, he presented the sick and poor. Due to the saint's popularity, the name came into general use in the Christian world (in various spellings).... [more]

Name: LAURENCIA
Meaning: Feminine form of LAURENCE (1).

Name: LAURENE
Meaning: Diminutive of LAURA.

Name: LAURESSA
Meaning: Diminutive of LAURA.

Name: LAURIE
Meaning: Diminutive of LAURA or LAURENCE (1).

Name: LAURINDA
Meaning: Variant of LORINDA.

Name: LAURISSA
Meaning: Diminutive of LAURA.

Name: LAURYN
Meaning: Variant of LAUREN.

Name: LAVENA
Meaning: Variant of LAVINIA.

Name: LAVENDER
Meaning: From the English word for the aromatic flower or the pale purple colour.

Name: LAVERN
Meaning: Variant of LAVERNE.

Name: LAVERNE
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a French place name, ultimately derived from the Gaulish word vern meaning "alder". It is sometimes associated with the Roman goddess Laverna or the Latin word vernus "of spring".

Name: LAVINA
Meaning: Variant of LAVINIA.

Name: LAVONE
Meaning: Variant of LAVONNE.

Name: LAVONNE
Meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name YVONNE.

Name: LAWRENCE
Meaning: Variant of LAURENCE (1). This spelling of the name is now more common than Laurence in the English-speaking world, probably because Lawrence is the usual spelling of the surname. The surname was borne by the author and poet D. H. Lawrence (1885-1930), as well as the revolutionary T. E. Lawrence (1888-1935), who was known as Lawrence of Arabia.

Name: LAWRIE
Meaning: Diminutive of LAWRENCE.

Name: LAWSON
Meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of LAURENCE (1)".

Name: LAYLA
Meaning: Means "night" in Arabic. Layla was the love interest of the poet Qays (called Majnun) in an old Arab tale, notably retold by the 12th-century Persian poet Nizami Ganjavi in his poem Layla and Majnun. This story was a popular romance in medieval Arabia and Persia. The name became used in the English-speaking world after the 1970 release of the song Layla by Derek and the Dominos, the title of which was inspired by the medieval story.

Name: LAYNE
Meaning: Variant of LANE.

Name: LAYTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from the name of English towns meaning "town with a leek garden" in Old English.

Name: LAZ
Meaning: Diminutive of LARRY.

Name: LEAH
Meaning: From the Hebrew name לֵאָה (Le'ah), which was probably derived from the Hebrew word לְאָה (le'ah) meaning "weary". Alternatively it might be related to Akkadian littu meaning "cow". In the Old Testament Leah is the first wife of Jacob and the mother of seven of his children. Jacob's other wife was Leah's younger sister Rachel, who he preferred. Leah later offered Jacob her handmaid Zilpah in order for him to conceive more children.... [more]

Name: LEANN
Meaning: Combination of LEE and ANN.

Name: LEANNA
Meaning: Probably this was originally a variant of LIANA. It is now often considered a combination of LEE and ANNA.

Name: LEANNE
Meaning: Combination of LEE and ANNE (1).

Name: LEANORA
Meaning: Short form of ELEANORA.

Name: LEATRICE
Meaning: Possibly a combination of LEAH and BEATRICE. This name was first brought to public attention by the American actress Leatrice Joy (1893-1985).

Name: LECIA
Meaning: Short form of ALICIA, FELICIA or LETITIA.

Name: LEE
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from Old English leah meaning "clearing". The surname belonged to Robert E. Lee (1807-1870), commander of the Confederate forces during the American Civil War. In his honour, it has been commonly used as a given name in the American South.

Name: LEEANN
Meaning: Combination of LEE and ANN.

Name: LEESA
Meaning: Variant of LISA.

Name: LEGEND
Meaning: From the English word, referring to a story about the past (or by extension, a heroic character in such a story), ultimately from Latin legere "to read".

Name: LEIGH
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of LEE.

Name: LEIGHTON
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of LAYTON.

Name: LEILA
Meaning: Variant of LAYLA, and the usual Persian transcription.... [more]

Name: LEILAH
Meaning: Variant of LEILA.

Name: LEITH
Meaning: From a surname, originally from the name of a Scottish town (now a district of Edinburgh), which is derived from Gaelic lìte "wet, damp". It is also the name of the river that flows though Edinburgh.

Name: LELA (2)
Meaning: Variant of LEILA.

Name: LELAND
Meaning: From a surname, originally from an English place name, which meant "fallow land" in Old English. A famous bearer was the politician, businessman and Stanford University founder Leland Stanford (1824-1893).

Name: LEMOINE
Meaning: From a French surname meaning "the monk" in French.

Name: LEN
Meaning: Short form of LEONARD.

Name: LENA
Usage: Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, German, Polish, Russian, English, Italian, Portuguese, Greek
Meaning: Short form of names ending in lena, such as HELENA, MAGDALENA or YELENA.

Name: LENARD
Meaning: Variant of LEONARD.

Name: LENNIE
Meaning: Diminutive of LEONARD, sometimes a feminine form.

Name: LENNON
Meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Leannáin, which means "descendant of Leannán". The name Leannán means "lover" in Irish. This surname was borne by musician John Lennon (1940-1980), a member of the Beatles.

Name: LENNOX
Meaning: From a Scottish surname that was derived from the name of a district in Scotland. The district, called Leamhnachd in Gaelic, possibly means "place of elms".

Name: LENNY
Meaning: Diminutive of LEONARD.

Name: LENORA
Meaning: Short form of ELENORA.

Name: LENORE
Meaning: Short form of ELEANOR. This was the name of the departed love of the narrator in Edgar Allan Poe's poem The Raven (1845).

Name: LENOX
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of LENNOX.

Name: LEO
Usage: German, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish, English, Croatian, Late Roman
Meaning: Derived from Latin leo meaning "lion", a cognate of LEON. It was popular among early Christians and was the name of 13 popes, including Saint Leo the Great who asserted the dominance of the Roman bishops (the popes) over all others in the 5th century. It was also borne by six Byzantine emperors and five Armenian kings. Another famous bearer was Leo Tolstoy (1828-1910), a Russian novelist whose works include War and Peace and Anna Karenina. Leo is also the name of a constellation and the fifth sign of the zodiac.

Name: LEOLA
Meaning: Feminine form of LEO.

Name: LEON
Usage: English, German, Polish, Slovene, Croatian, Dutch, Ancient Greek
Meaning: Derived from Greek λέων (leon) meaning "lion". During the Christian era this Greek name was merged with the Latin cognate Leo, with the result that the two forms are used somewhat interchangeably across European languages. In England during the Middle Ages this was a common name among Jews. A famous bearer was Leon Trotsky (1879-1940), a Russian Communist revolutionary.

Name: LEONA
Meaning: Feminine form of LEON.

Name: LEONARD
Usage: English, Dutch, German, Polish, Romanian, Ancient Germanic
Meaning: Means "brave lion", derived from the Germanic elements lewo "lion" (of Latin origin) and hard "brave, hardy". This was the name of a 5th-century Frankish saint from Noblac who is the patron of prisoners and horses. The Normans brought this name to England, where it was used steadily through the Middle Ages, becoming even more common in the 20th century.

Name: LEONE (2)
Meaning: Variant of LEONA.

Name: LEONTYNE
Meaning: Variant of LÉONTINE. This name was borne by opera singer Leontyne Price (1927-).

Name: LEOPOLD
Usage: German, Dutch, English, Czech, Slovak, Slovene, Polish
Meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements leud "people" and bald "bold". The spelling was altered due to association with Latin leo "lion". This name was common among German royalty, first with the Babenbergs and then the Habsburgs. Saint Leopold was a 12th-century Babenberg margrave of Austria, who is now considered the patron of that country. It was also borne by two Habsburg Holy Roman emperors, as well as three kings of Belgium. Since the 19th century this name has been occasionally used in England, originally in honour of Queen Victoria's uncle, a king of Belgium, after whom she named one of her sons. It was later used by James Joyce for the main character, Leopold Bloom, in his novel Ulysses (1922).

Name: LEROI
Meaning: Variant of LEROY.

Name: LEROY
Meaning: From the French nickname le roi meaning "the king". It has been common as an English given name since the 19th century.

Name: LES
Meaning: Short form of LESLIE or LESTER.

Name: LESIA
Meaning: Short form of ALESIA.

Name: LESLEIGH
Meaning: Variant of LESLIE.

Name: LESLEY
Meaning: Variant of LESLIE.

Name: LESLIE
Meaning: From a Scottish surname that was derived from a Scottish place name, probably derived from Gaelic leas celyn meaning "garden of holly". It has been used as a given name since the 19th century. In America it was more common as a feminine name after the 1940s.

Name: LESLY
Meaning: Variant of LESLIE.

Name: LESSIE
Meaning: Diminutive of names containing the sound les, such as LESLIE.

Name: LESTER
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the name of the city of Leicester, originally denoting a person who was from that place. The city's name is derived from the river name Ligore combined with Latin castra "camp".

Name: LETA
Meaning: Possibly derived from Latin laetus meaning "glad". Otherwise, it could be a short form of names ending in leta.

Name: LETHA
Meaning: Possibly a short form of ALETHA.

Name: LETITIA
Meaning: From the Late Latin name Laetitia meaning "joy, happiness". This was the name of an obscure saint, who is revered mainly in Spain. It was in use in England during the Middle Ages, usually in the spelling Lettice, and it was revived in the 18th century.

Name: LETTICE
Meaning: Medieval form of LETITIA.

Name: LETTIE
Meaning: Diminutive of LETTICE.

Name: LETTY
Meaning: Diminutive of LETTICE.

Name: LEVI
Usage: Hebrew, English, Dutch, German, Biblical, Biblical Latin
Meaning: Possibly means "joined, attached" in Hebrew. As told in the Old Testament, Levi was the third son of Jacob and Leah, and the ancestor of one of the twelve tribes of the Israelites, known as the Levites. This was the tribe that formed the priestly class of the Israelites. The brothers Moses and Aaron were members. This name also occurs in the New Testament, where it is another name for the apostle Matthew.... [more]

Name: LEW (1)
Meaning: Short form of LEWIS.

Name: LEWIN
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from the given name LEOFWINE.

Name: LEWIS
Meaning: Medieval English form of LOUIS. A famous bearer was Lewis Carroll (1832-1898), the author of Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. This was also the surname of C. S. Lewis (1898-1963), the author of the Chronicles of Narnia.

Name: LEX
Meaning: Short form of ALEXANDER.

Name: LEXA
Meaning: Short form of ALEXANDRA or ALEXA.

Name: LEXI
Meaning: Diminutive of ALEXANDRA or ALEXIS.

Name: LEXIA
Meaning: Short form of ALEXIA.

Name: LEXIE
Meaning: Diminutive of ALEXANDRA or ALEXIS.

Name: LEXINE
Meaning: Diminutive of ALEXANDRA.

Name: LEXUS
Meaning: Short form of ALEXUS. Its use has been influenced by the Lexus brand name (a line of luxury automobiles made by Toyota).

Name: LEXY
Meaning: Diminutive of ALEXANDRA or ALEXIS.

Name: LEYLA
Usage: Turkish, Azerbaijani, Kurdish, Persian, Arabic, English (Modern)
Meaning: Variant of LEILA, and the usual Turkish, Azerbaijani and Kurdish form.

Name: LEYTON
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of LAYTON.

Name: LIAM
Usage: Irish, English, French (Modern), Dutch (Modern), German (Modern), Swedish (Modern)
Meaning: Irish short form of WILLIAM. It became popular in the United Kingdom in the 1980s, and elsewhere in Europe and the Americas after that. It was the top ranked name for boys in the United States beginning in 2017.

Name: LIANA
Meaning: Short form of JULIANA, LILIANA, and other names that end in liana. This is also the word for a type of vine that grows in jungles.

Name: LIANNE
Meaning: Variant of LEANNE.

Name: LIBBIE
Meaning: Variant of LIBBY.

Name: LIBBY
Meaning: Originally a medieval diminutive of Ibb, itself a diminutive of ISABEL. It is also used as a diminutive of ELIZABETH.

Name: LIBERTY
Meaning: Simply from the English word liberty, derived from Latin libertas, a derivative of liber "free". Interestingly, since 1880 this name has charted on the American popularity lists in three different periods: in 1918 (at the end of World War I), in 1976 (the American bicentennial), and after 2001 (during the War on Terrorism).

Name: LIDDY
Meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH or LYDIA.

Name: LILA (2)
Meaning: Variant of LEILA.

Name: LILAC
Meaning: From the English word for the shrub with purple or white flowers. It is derived via Arabic from Persian.

Name: LILAH
Meaning: Variant of LEILA.

Name: LILIAN
Meaning: English variant of LILLIAN, as well as a French masculine form.

Name: LILIANA
Usage: Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Romanian, Polish, English
Meaning: Latinate form of LILLIAN.

Name: LILIANNA
Meaning: Variant of LILIANA.

Name: LILIBET
Meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH.

Name: LILIBETH
Meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH.

Name: LILLIA
Meaning: Short form of LILLIAN or an elaborated form of LILY.

Name: LILLIAN
Meaning: Probably originally a diminutive of ELIZABETH. It may also be considered an elaborated form of LILY, from the Latin word for "lily" lilium. This name has been used in England since the 16th century.

Name: LILLIANA
Meaning: Variant of LILLIAN.

Name: LILLIE
Meaning: Variant of LILY, or a diminutive of LILLIAN or ELIZABETH.

Name: LILLY
Meaning: English variant of LILY. It is also used in Scandinavia, as a form of LILY or a diminutive of ELISABETH.

Name: LILY
Meaning: From the name of the flower, a symbol of purity. The word is ultimately derived from Latin lilium.

Name: LINA (2)
Usage: English, Italian, Spanish, German, French, Lithuanian, Swedish, Danish, Norwegian
Meaning: Short form of names ending in lina.

Name: LINCOLN
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from the name of a city in England, called Lindum Colonia by the Romans, derived from Brythonic lindo "lake, pool" and Latin colonia "colony". This name is usually given in honour of Abraham Lincoln (1809-1865), president of the United States during the American Civil War.

Name: LINDA
Usage: English, German, Dutch, Italian, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Icelandic, French, Latvian, Finnish, Estonian, Hungarian, Czech, Slovak, Ancient Germanic
Meaning: Originally a medieval short form of Germanic names containing the element lind meaning "flexible, soft, mild". It also coincides with the Spanish and Portuguese word linda meaning "beautiful". In the English-speaking world this name experienced a spike in popularity beginning in the 1930s, peaking in the late 1940s, and declining shortly after that. It was the most popular name for girls in the United States from 1947 to 1952.

Name: LINDEN
Meaning: From a German surname that was derived from Old High German linta meaning "linden tree".

Name: LINDON
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of LYNDON.

Name: LINDSAY
Meaning: From an English and Scottish surname that was originally derived from the name of the region Lindsey, which means "LINCOLN island" in Old English. As a given name it was typically masculine until the 1960s (in Britain) and 1970s (in America) when it became popular for girls, probably due to its similarity to Linda and because of American actress Lindsay Wagner (1949-).

Name: LINDSEY
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LINDSIE
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LINDY
Meaning: Originally this was a masculine name, coming into use in America in 1927 when the dance called the Lindy Hop became popular. The dance was probably named for aviator Charles Lindbergh. Later this name was used as a diminutive of LINDA.

Name: LINETTE
Meaning: Variant of LYNETTE.

Name: LINFORD
Meaning: From a surname that was originally taken from place names meaning either "flax ford" or "linden tree ford" in Old English.

Name: LINNAEA
Meaning: From the word for the type of flower, also called the twinflower (see LINNÉA).

Name: LINNET
Meaning: Either a variant of LYNETTE or else from the name of the small bird, a type of finch.

Name: LINNETTE
Meaning: Variant of LYNETTE.

Name: LINNIE
Meaning: Diminutive of LINDA and other names beginning with Lin.

Name: LINSAY
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LINSEY
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LINTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from place names meaning either "flax town" or "linden tree town" in Old English.

Name: LINWOOD
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from a place name meaning "stream forest" in Old English.

Name: LINZI
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LIONEL
Meaning: French diminutive of LÉON. A notable bearer is Argentine soccer star Lionel Messi (1987-).

Name: LISA
Usage: English, German, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Italian
Meaning: Short form of ELIZABETH and its cognates in other languages. This is the name of the subject of one of the world's most famous paintings, the Mona Lisa, the portrait of Lisa del Giocondo by Leonardo da Vinci.... [more]

Name: LISE
Meaning: Short form of ELISABETH or ELIZABETH.

Name: LISETTE
Meaning: Diminutive of ÉLISABETH.

Name: LISHA
Meaning: Short form of ALICIA, FELICIA, and other names ending with the same sound.

Name: LISSA
Meaning: Short form of MELISSA.

Name: LITA
Meaning: Short form of names ending in lita. This name was brought to the public eye in the 1920s due to Lita Grey (1908-1995), who was the second wife of Charlie Chaplin. Her birth name was Lillita Louise MacMurray.

Name: LIV (2)
Meaning: Short form of OLIVIA.

Name: LIVIA (2)
Meaning: Short form of OLIVIA.

Name: LIVVY
Meaning: Diminutive of OLIVIA.

Name: LIVY (2)
Meaning: Diminutive of OLIVIA.

Name: LIZ
Meaning: Short form of ELIZABETH. This is the familiar name of actress Elizabeth Taylor (1932-).

Name: LIZA
Meaning: Short form of ELIZABETH (English), YELIZAVETA (Russian) or ELISABED (Georgian).

Name: LIZBETH
Meaning: Short form of ELIZABETH.

Name: LIZETTE
Meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH.

Name: LIZZIE
Meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH.

Name: LIZZY
Meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH.

Name: LLOYD
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from Welsh llwyd meaning "grey". The composer Andrew Lloyd Webber (1948-) is a famous bearer of this name.

Name: LOGAN
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a Scottish place name meaning "little hollow" in Scottish Gaelic.

Name: LOIS (1)
Usage: English, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: Possibly derived from Greek λωίων (loion) meaning "more desirable" or "better". Lois is mentioned in the New Testament as the mother of Eunice and the grandmother of Timothy. As an English name, it came into use after the Protestant Reformation. In fiction, this is the name of the girlfriend of the comic book hero Superman.

Name: LOLA
Meaning: Diminutive of DOLORES.

Name: LOLICIA
Meaning: Elaborated form of LOLA.

Name: LON
Meaning: Short form of ALONZO and other names containing the same sound. Famous bearers were American actors Lon Chaney Sr. (1883-1930) and Lon Chaney Jr. (1906-1973). The elder's birth name was Leonidas.

Name: LONDON
Meaning: From the name of the capital city of the United Kingdom, the meaning of which is uncertain. As a surname it was borne by the American author Jack London (1876-1916).

Name: LONDYN
Meaning: Variant of LONDON.

Name: LONNIE
Meaning: Short form of ALONZO and other names containing the same sound.

Name: LONNY
Meaning: Short form of ALONZO and other names containing the same sound.

Name: LORA
Meaning: Variant of LAURA. It is also used as an Italian diminutive of ELEONORA or LOREDANA.

Name: LORAINE
Meaning: Variant of LORRAINE.

Name: LORAINNE
Meaning: Variant of LORRAINE.

Name: LORAYNE
Meaning: Variant of LORRAINE.

Name: LOREEN
Meaning: Elaboration of LORA.

Name: LORELLE
Meaning: Variant of LAUREL.

Name: LOREN
Meaning: Either a short form of LAURENCE (1) (masculine) or a variant of LAUREN (feminine).

Name: LORENA (2)
Meaning: Latinized form of LAUREN. This name was first brought to public attention in America by the song Lorena (1856), written by Joseph Webster, who was said to have created the name as an anagram of LENORE (from the character in Poe's poem The Raven).

Name: LORENE
Meaning: Elaboration of LORA.

Name: LORETTA
Meaning: Either an elaboration of LORA or a variant of LAURETTA. It is also sometimes used as a variant of LORETO.

Name: LORI
Meaning: Diminutive of LAURA or LORRAINE.

Name: LORIE
Meaning: Variant of LORI.

Name: LORIN
Meaning: Variant of LOREN.

Name: LORINDA
Meaning: Elaboration of LORA.

Name: LORN
Meaning: Variant of LORNE.

Name: LORNA
Meaning: Created by the author R. D. Blackmore for the title character in his novel Lorna Doone (1869), set in southern England, which describes the dangerous love between John Ridd and Lorna Doone. Blackmore may have based the name on the Scottish place name Lorne or on the title Marquis of Lorne (see LORNE).

Name: LORNE
Meaning: From the title Marquis of Lorne, which was based on the Scottish place name Lorne, itself possibly derived from the name of the legendary king of Dál Riata, Loarn mac Eirc. This was the title of the first Governor General of Canada, where it has since been most frequently used as a given name. A famous bearer was the Canadian actor Lorne Greene (1915-1987).

Name: LORRAINE
Meaning: From the name of a region in France, originally meaning "kingdom of LOTHAR". Lothar was a Frankish king, the great-grandson of Charlemagne, whose realm was in the part of France that is now called Lorraine, or in German Lothringen (from Latin Lothari regnum). As a given name, it has been used in the English-speaking world since the late 19th century, perhaps due to its similar sound with Laura. It became popular after World War I when the region was in the news, as it was contested between Germany and France.

Name: LORRI
Meaning: Variant of LORI.

Name: LORRIE
Meaning: Variant of LORI.

Name: LORRIN
Meaning: Variant of LOREN.

Name: LOTTIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CHARLOTTE or LISELOTTE.

Name: LOTUS
Meaning: From the name of the lotus flower (species Nelumbo nucifera) or the mythological lotus tree. They are ultimately derived from Greek λωτός (lotos). In Greek and Roman mythology the lotus tree was said to produce a fruit causing sleepiness and forgetfulness.

Name: LOU
Meaning: Short form of LOUISE or LOUIS. Famous bearers include the baseball player Lou Gehrig (1903-1941) and the musician Lou Reed (1942-2013).

Name: LOUELLA
Meaning: Combination of LOU and the popular name suffix ella.

Name: LOUIE
Meaning: Diminutive of LOUIS.

Name: LOUIS
Meaning: French form of Ludovicus, the Latinized form of LUDWIG. This was the name of 18 kings of France, starting with Louis I the son of Charlemagne. Others include Louis IX (Saint Louis) who led two crusades and Louis XIV (called the Sun King) who was the ruler of France during the height of its power, the builder of the Palace of Versailles, and the longest reigning monarch in the history of Europe. It was also borne by kings of Germany (as Ludwig), Hungary (as Lajos), and other places.... [more]

Name: LOUISA
Meaning: Latinate feminine form of LOUIS. A famous bearer was the American novelist Louisa May Alcott (1832-1888), the author of Little Women.

Name: LOUISE
Usage: French, English, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Dutch, German
Meaning: French feminine form of LOUIS.

Name: LOVE (2)
Meaning: Simply from the English word love, derived from Old English lufu.

Name: LOVEL
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of LOWELL.

Name: LOVELL
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of LOWELL.

Name: LOWELL
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from a Norman French nickname, from lou "wolf" and a diminutive suffix. The surname was borne by American poet and satirist James Russell Lowell (1819-1891).

Name: LOYD
Meaning: Variant of LLOYD.

Name: LUANA
Meaning: From the movie Bird of Paradise (1932), in which it was borne by the main character, a Polynesian girl. The movie was based on a 1912 play of the same name set in Hawaii.

Name: LUANN
Meaning: Either a combination of LOU and ANN or a variant of LUANA. It was popularized in the 1950s by the singer Lu Ann Simms (1933-2003).

Name: LUANNA
Meaning: Either a combination of LOU and ANNA or a variant of LUANA.

Name: LUANNE
Meaning: Variant of LUANN.

Name: LUCAS
Usage: English, Dutch, French, Portuguese, Spanish, Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, Biblical Latin
Meaning: Latin form of Greek Λουκᾶς (see LUKE), as well as the form used in several other languages.

Name: LUCIA
Usage: Italian, German, English, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Romanian, Slovak, Ancient Roman
Meaning: Feminine form of LUCIUS. Saint Lucia was a 4th-century martyr from Syracuse. She was said to have had her eyes gouged out, and thus she is the patron saint of the blind. She was widely revered in the Middle Ages, and her name has been used throughout Christian Europe (in various spellings). It has been used in the England since the 12th century, usually in the spellings Lucy or Luce.

Name: LUCIAN
Meaning: Romanian and English form of LUCIANUS. Lucian is the usual name of Lucianus of Samosata in English.

Name: LUCILE
Meaning: Variant of LUCILLE.

Name: LUCILLE
Meaning: French form of LUCILLA. A famous bearer was American comedienne Lucille Ball (1911-1989).

Name: LUCINDA
Meaning: An elaboration of LUCIA created by Cervantes for his novel Don Quixote (1605). It was subsequently used by Molière in his play The Doctor in Spite of Himself (1666).

Name: LUCIUS
Meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, which was derived from Latin lux "light". This was the most popular of the praenomina. Two Etruscan kings of early Rome had this name as well as several prominent later Romans, including Lucius Annaeus Seneca (known simply as Seneca), a statesman, philosopher, orator and tragedian. The name is mentioned briefly in the New Testament belonging to a Christian in Antioch. It was also borne by three popes, including the 3rd-century Saint Lucius. Despite this, the name was not regularly used in the Christian world until after the Renaissance.

Name: LUCKY
Meaning: From a nickname given to a lucky person. It is also sometimes used as a diminutive of LUKE.

Name: LUCY
Meaning: English form of LUCIA, in use since the Middle Ages.

Name: LUELLA
Meaning: Variant of LOUELLA.

Name: LUKE
Meaning: English form of Latin Lucas, from the Greek name Λουκᾶς (Loukas) meaning "from Lucania", Lucania being a region in southern Italy (of uncertain meaning). Luke was a doctor who travelled in the company of the apostle Paul. According to tradition, he was the author of the third gospel and Acts in the New Testament. He was probably of Greek ethnicity. He is considered a saint by many Christian denominations.... [more]

Name: LULA (1)
Meaning: Diminutive of LOUISE and names that begin with Lu.

Name: LUNA
Meaning: Means "the moon" in Latin. Luna was the Roman goddess of the moon, frequently depicted driving a white chariot through the sky.

Name: LUTHER
Meaning: From a German surname, itself from the Germanic given name LEUTHAR. The surname was borne by Martin Luther, a 16th-century monk and theologian, who started the Protestant Reformation by nailing his famous 95 theses to a church door. It has since been used as a given name in his honour, especially among Protestants. A notable bearer from the modern era was the American civil rights leader Martin Luther King (1929-1968).

Name: LUVENIA
Meaning: Possibly a form of LAVINIA. It has been used in America since the 19th century.

Name: LUVINIA
Meaning: Variant of LUVENIA.

Name: LYALL
Meaning: From a Scottish surname that was derived from the Old Norse given name Liulfr (which was derived in part from úlfr "wolf").

Name: LYANNA
Meaning: Variant of LÉANE or LIANA.

Name: LYDA
Meaning: Perhaps a variant of LYDIA.

Name: LYDIA
Usage: English, German, Dutch, Biblical, Old Church Slavic, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: Means "from Lydia" in Greek. Lydia was a region on the west coast of Asia Minor, said to be named for the legendary king LYDOS. In the New Testament this is the name of a woman converted to Christianity by Saint Paul. In the modern era the name has been in use since the Protestant Reformation.

Name: LYLA
Meaning: Variant of LEILA.

Name: LYLAH
Meaning: Variant of LEILA.

Name: LYLE
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from Norman French l'isle "island".

Name: LYN
Meaning: Variant of LYNN.

Name: LYNDA
Meaning: Variant of LINDA.

Name: LYNDI
Meaning: Variant of LINDY.

Name: LYNDON
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from a place name meaning "linden tree hill" in Old English. A famous bearer was American president Lyndon B. Johnson (1908-1973).

Name: LYNDSAY
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LYNDSEA
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LYNDSEY
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LYNETTE
Meaning: Form of LUNED used by Alfred Lord Tennyson in his 1872 poem Gareth and Lynette. In modern times it is also regarded as a diminutive of LYNN.

Name: LYNN
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from Welsh llyn meaning "lake". Before the start of the 20th century it was primarily used for boys, but it has since come to be more common for girls. In some cases it may be thought of as a short form of LINDA or names that end in lyn or line.

Name: LYNNA
Meaning: Elaborated form of LYNN.

Name: LYNNE
Meaning: Variant of LYNN.

Name: LYNNETTE
Meaning: Variant of LYNETTE.

Name: LYNSAY
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LYNSEY
Meaning: Variant of LINDSAY.

Name: LYNTON
Meaning: Variant of LINTON.

Name: LYNWOOD
Meaning: Variant of LINWOOD.

Name: LYRIC
Meaning: Means simply "lyric, songlike" from the English word, ultimately derived from Greek λυρικός (lyrikos).

Name: LYSETTE
Meaning: Variant of LISETTE.

Name: LYSSA (1)
Meaning: Short form of ALYSSA.

Name: MABEL
Meaning: Medieval feminine form of AMABILIS. This spelling and Amabel were common during the Middle Ages, though they became rare after the 15th century. It was revived in the 19th century after the publication of C. M. Yonge's 1854 novel The Heir of Redclyffe, which featured a character named Mabel (as well as one named Amabel).

Name: MABELLA
Meaning: Elaborated form of MABEL.

Name: MABELLE
Meaning: Variant of MABEL. It also coincides with the French phrase ma belle meaning "my beautiful".

Name: MABLE
Meaning: Variant of MABEL.

Name: MACAULAY
Meaning: From a surname, an Anglicized form of Gaelic Mac Amhalghaidh meaning "son of Amhalghadh", itself a given name of unknown meaning. A famous bearer of the surname was Thomas Babington Macaulay (1800-1861), a British Whig politician and noted historian. The given name is borne by the American former child actor Macaulay Culkin (1980-), who was named after the British politician.

Name: MACAULEY
Meaning: Variant of MACAULAY.

Name: MACEY
Meaning: Variant of MACY.

Name: MACI
Meaning: Variant of MACY.

Name: MACIE
Meaning: Variant of MACY.

Name: MACK (1)
Meaning: From a surname that was originally a shortened form of various Gaelic surnames beginning with Mac or Mc (from Gaelic mac meaning "son"). It is also used as a generic slang term for a man.

Name: MACKENZIE
Meaning: From the Gaelic surname Mac Coinnich, which means "son of COINNEACH". A famous bearer of the surname was William Lyon MacKenzie (1795-1861), a Canadian journalist and political rebel. As a feminine given name, it was popularized by the American actress Mackenzie Phillips (1959-). In the United Kingdom it is more common as a masculine name.

Name: MACY
Meaning: From an English surname that was from various towns named Massy in France. The towns themselves were originally named from a Gallo-Roman personal name that was Latinized as Maccius. This is the name of a chain of American department stores founded by Rowland Hussey Macy (1822-1877).

Name: MADALYN
Meaning: Variant of MADELINE.

Name: MADDIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MADELINE or MADISON.

Name: MADDISON
Meaning: Variant of MADISON.

Name: MADDOX
Meaning: From a Welsh surname meaning "son of MADOC". It was brought to public attention when the actress Angelina Jolie gave this name to her adopted son in 2002.

Name: MADDY
Meaning: Diminutive of MADELINE or MADISON.

Name: MADELAINE
Meaning: Variant of MADELINE.

Name: MADELEINE
Meaning: French form of MAGDALENE.

Name: MADELINA
Meaning: Latinate form of MADELINE.

Name: MADELINE
Meaning: English form of MAGDALENE. This is the name of the heroine in a series of children's books by Ludwig Bemelmans, first published 1939.

Name: MADELYN
Meaning: Variant of MADELINE.

Name: MADELYNN
Meaning: Variant of MADELINE.

Name: MADGE
Meaning: Diminutive of MARGARET.

Name: MADILYN
Meaning: Variant of MADELINE.

Name: MADILYNN
Meaning: Variant of MADELINE.

Name: MADISON
Meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of MAUD". It was not commonly used as a feminine name until after the movie Splash (1984), in which the main character adopted it as her name after seeing a street sign for Madison Avenue in New York City. It was ranked second for girls in the United States by 2001. This rise from obscurity to prominence in only 18 years represents an unprecedented 550,000 percent increase in usage.... [more]

Name: MADISYN
Meaning: Variant of MADISON.

Name: MADLYN
Meaning: Variant of MADELINE.

Name: MADOLINE
Meaning: Variant of MADELINE.

Name: MADONNA
Meaning: From a title of the Virgin Mary meaning "my lady" in Italian. A famous bearer of the name is American singer Madonna Ciccone (1958-), known simply as Madonna.

Name: MADYSON
Meaning: Variant of MADISON.

Name: MAE
Meaning: Variant of MAY. A famous bearer was the American actress Mae West (1893-1980), whose birth name was Mary.

Name: MAEGAN
Meaning: Variant of MEGAN.

Name: MAEGHAN
Meaning: Variant of MEGAN.

Name: MAGDALEN
Meaning: Variant of MAGDALENE.

Name: MAGDALENA
Usage: Polish, German, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Spanish, Catalan, Occitan, Slovene, Czech, Bulgarian, Macedonian, Croatian, Serbian, Romanian, English
Meaning: Latinate form of MAGDALENE.

Name: MAGDALENE
Usage: German, English, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: From a title meaning "of Magdala". Mary Magdalene, a character in the New Testament, was named thus because she was from Magdala - a village on the Sea of Galilee whose name meant "tower" in Hebrew. She was cleaned of evil spirits by Jesus and then remained with him during his ministry, witnessing the crucifixion and the resurrection. She was a popular saint in the Middle Ages, and the name became common then. In England it is traditionally rendered Madeline, while Magdalene or Magdalen is the learned form.

Name: MAGGIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MARGARET.

Name: MAGNOLIA
Meaning: From the English word magnolia for the flower, which was named for the French botanist Pierre Magnol.

Name: MAHALA
Meaning: Variant of MAHALAH or MAHALATH. It has occasionally been used as an English Christian name since the Protestant Reformation.

Name: MAHALIA
Meaning: Variant of MAHALA.

Name: MAISIE
Meaning: Scottish diminutive of MAIREAD.

Name: MAISY
Meaning: Variant of MAISIE.

Name: MAITLAND
Meaning: From an English surname that was from a Norman French place name possibly meaning "inhospitable".

Name: MAJOR
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from the given name Mauger, an Old French form of the Germanic name Malger meaning "council spear". The name can also be given in reference to the English word major.

Name: MAKAYLA
Meaning: Variant of MICHAELA.

Name: MAKENNA
Meaning: Variant of MCKENNA.

Name: MAKENZIE
Meaning: Variant of MACKENZIE.

Name: MALACHI
Meaning: From the Hebrew name מַלְאָכִי (Mal'akhi) meaning "my messenger" or "my angel". This is one of the twelve minor prophets of the Old Testament, the author of the Book of Malachi, which some claim foretells the coming of Christ. In England the name came into use after the Protestant Reformation.

Name: MALAKAI
Meaning: Variant of MALACHI.

Name: MALANDRA
Meaning: Invented name using the popular name suffix andra, from names such as SANDRA or ALEXANDRA.

Name: MALCOLM
Meaning: From Scottish Gaelic Máel Coluim, which means "disciple of Saint COLUMBA". This was the name of four kings of Scotland starting in the 10th century, including Malcolm III, who became king after killing Macbeth, the usurper who had murdered his father. The character Malcolm in Shakespeare's tragedy Macbeth (1606) is based on him. Another famous bearer was Malcolm X (1925-1965), an American civil rights leader.

Name: MALCOM
Meaning: Variant of MALCOLM.

Name: MALEAH
Meaning: Variant of MALIA.

Name: MALINDA
Meaning: Variant of MELINDA.

Name: MALLORY
Meaning: From an English surname that meant "unfortunate" in Norman French. It first became common in the 1980s due to the television comedy Family Ties, which featured a character by this name.

Name: MALONE
Meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Maoil Eoin meaning "descendant of a disciple of Saint JOHN".

Name: MALVINA
Meaning: Created by the poet James MacPherson in the 18th century for a character in his Ossian poems. He probably intended it to mean "smooth brow" in Gaelic.

Name: MAMIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MARY or MARGARET.

Name: MANDI
Meaning: Diminutive of AMANDA.

Name: MANDY
Meaning: Diminutive of AMANDA.

Name: MANLEY
Meaning: From an English surname, originally a place name, meaning "common clearing" in Old English.

Name: MANNY
Meaning: Short form of EMMANUEL.

Name: MANSEL
Meaning: From an English surname that originally referred to a person who came from the French city of Le Mans.

Name: MAPLE
Meaning: From the English word for the tree, derived from Old English mapul. This is the name of a girl in Robert Frost's poem Maple (1923) who wonders about the origin of her unusual name.

Name: MARALYN
Meaning: Variant of MARILYN.

Name: MARCELYN
Meaning: Variant of MARCELINE.

Name: MARCI
Meaning: Diminutive of MARCIA.

Name: MARCIA
Meaning: Feminine form of MARCIUS. It was borne by a few very minor saints. It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since the 18th century.

Name: MARCIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MARCIA.

Name: MARCUS
Usage: Ancient Roman, Biblical Latin, English, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish
Meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, that was probably derived from the name of the Roman god MARS. This was among the most popular of the Roman praenomina. Famous bearers include Marcus Tullius Cicero (known simply as Cicero), a 1st-century BC statesman and orator, Marcus Antonius (known as Mark Antony), a 1st-century BC politician, and Marcus Aurelius, a notable 2nd-century emperor. This was also the name of a pope of the 4th century. This spelling has occasionally been used in the English-speaking world, though the traditional English form Mark has been more common.

Name: MARCY
Meaning: Diminutive of MARCIA.

Name: MAREE
Meaning: Variant of MARIE.

Name: MARGARET
Meaning: Derived from Latin Margarita, which was from Greek μαργαρίτης (margarites) meaning "pearl", a word that was probably ultimately a borrowing from an Indo-Iranian language. Saint Margaret, the patron of expectant mothers, was martyred at Antioch in the 4th century. Later legends told of her escape from a dragon, with which she was often depicted in medieval art. The saint was popular during the Middle Ages, and her name has been widely used in the Christian world.... [more]

Name: MARGARETTA
Meaning: Latinate form of MARGARET.

Name: MARGE
Meaning: Diminutive of MARGARET (English) or MARGAREETA (Estonian).

Name: MARGERY
Meaning: Medieval English form of MARGARET.

Name: MARGIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MARGARET.

Name: MARGO
Meaning: Variant of MARGOT.

Name: MARIA
Usage: Italian, Portuguese, Catalan, Occitan, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Faroese, Dutch, Frisian, Greek, Polish, Romanian, English, Finnish, Estonian, Corsican, Sardinian, Basque, Russian, Bulgarian, Ukrainian, Biblical Greek, Biblical Latin, Old Church Slavic
Meaning: Latin form of Greek Μαρία, from Hebrew מִרְיָם (see MARY). Maria is the usual form of the name in many European languages, as well as a secondary form in other languages such as English (where the common spelling is Mary). In some countries, for example Germany, Poland and Italy, Maria is occasionally used as a masculine middle name.... [more]

Name: MARIABELLA
Meaning: Combination of MARIA and BELLA.

Name: MARIAH
Meaning: Variant of MARIA. It is usually pronounced in a way that reflects an older English pronunciation of Maria. The name was popularized in the early 1990s by the American singer Mariah Carey (1970-).

Name: MARIAN (1)
Meaning: Variant of MARION (1). This name was borne in English legend by Maid Marian, Robin Hood's love. It is sometimes considered a combination of MARY and ANN.

Name: MARIANNA
Usage: Italian, English, Hungarian, Slovak, Polish, Finnish, Russian, Greek
Meaning: Combination of MARIA and ANNA. It has been confused with the Roman name MARIANA to the point that it is no longer easy to separate the two forms. It is sometimes also used as a Latinized form of MARIAMNE.

Name: MARIANNE
Usage: French, English, German, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish
Meaning: Originally a French diminutive of MARIE. It is also considered a combination of MARIE and ANNE (1). Shortly after the formation of the French Republic in 1792, a female figure by this name was adopted as the symbol of the state.

Name: MARIE
Usage: French, Czech, German, English, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch
Meaning: French and Czech form of MARIA. It has been very common in France since the 13th century. At the opening of the 20th century it was given to approximately 20 percent of French girls. This percentage has declined steadily over the course of the century, and it dropped from the top rank in 1958.... [more]

Name: MARIEL
Meaning: Diminutive of MARY influenced by MURIEL. In the case of actress Mariel Hemingway (1961-), the name is from the Cuban town of Mariel.

Name: MARIGOLD
Meaning: From the name of the flower, which comes from a combination of MARY and the English word gold.

Name: MARILOU
Meaning: Combination of MARIA and LOUISE.

Name: MARILYN
Meaning: Combination of MARY and lyn. It has been used since the start of the 20th century. A famous bearer was the American actress Marilyn Monroe (1926-1962).

Name: MARILYNN
Meaning: Variant of MARILYN.

Name: MARINA
Usage: Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Catalan, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch, English, Greek, Finnish, Estonian, Russian, Romanian, Czech, Bulgarian, Croatian, Serbian, Slovene, Macedonian, Latvian, Georgian, Ancient Roman
Meaning: Feminine form of MARINUS.

Name: MARINDA
Meaning: Either a diminutive of MARY or a variant of MIRANDA.

Name: MARION (1)
Meaning: Medieval French diminutive of MARIE.

Name: MARION (2)
Meaning: From a French surname that was derived from MARION (1). This was the real name of American actor John Wayne (1907-1979), who was born Marion Robert Morrison.

Name: MARIS
Meaning: Means "of the sea", taken from the Latin title of the Virgin Mary, Stella Maris, meaning "star of the sea".

Name: MARISA
Meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese combination of MARIA and LUISA.

Name: MARISSA
Meaning: Variant of MARISA.

Name: MARJE (1)
Meaning: Diminutive of MARJORIE.

Name: MARJORIE
Meaning: Medieval variant of MARGERY, influenced by the name of the herb marjoram. After the Middle Ages this name was rare, but it was revived at the end of the 19th century.

Name: MARJORY
Meaning: Variant of MARJORIE.

Name: MARK
Meaning: Form of Latin MARCUS used in several languages. Saint Mark was the author of the second gospel in the New Testament. Though the author's identity is not certain, some traditions hold him to be the same person as the John Mark who appears in the Book of Acts. He is the patron saint of Venice, where he is supposedly buried. Though in use during the Middle Ages, Mark was not common in the English-speaking world until the 19th century, when it began to be used alongside the classical form Marcus.... [more]

Name: MARLA
Meaning: Shortened form of MARLENE.

Name: MARLEE
Meaning: Variant of MARLEY.

Name: MARLEEN
Meaning: Dutch form and English variant of MARLENE.

Name: MARLENA
Meaning: Latinate form of MARLENE.

Name: MARLENE
Meaning: Blend of MARIA and MAGDALENE. It refers, therefore, to Mary Magdalene, a character in the New Testament. The name was popularized by the German actress and singer Marlene Dietrich (1901-1992), whose real name was Maria Magdalene Dietrich.

Name: MARLEY
Meaning: From a surname that was taken from a place name meaning either "pleasant wood", "boundary wood" or "marten wood" in Old English. A famous bearer of the surname was the Jamaican musician Bob Marley (1945-1981).

Name: MARLIN
Meaning: Possibly a variant of MERLIN.

Name: MARLON
Meaning: Meaning unknown. This name was popularized by the American actor Marlon Brando (1924-2004), who was named after his father.

Name: MARLOWE
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "remnants of a lake" in Old English. A famous bearer of the surname was the English playwright Christopher Marlowe (1564-1593).

Name: MARLY
Meaning: Variant of MARLEY.

Name: MARLYN
Meaning: Variant of MARILYN (feminine) or MARLIN (masculine).

Name: MARMADUKE
Meaning: Possibly derived from the Old Irish name MÁEL MÁEDÓC. This name has been traditionally used in the Yorkshire area of Britain.

Name: MARNI
Meaning: Variant of MARNIE.

Name: MARNIE
Meaning: Possibly a diminutive of MARINA. This name was brought to public attention by Alfred Hitchcock's movie Marnie (1964), itself based on a 1961 novel by Winston Graham.

Name: MARSHA
Meaning: Variant of MARCIA.

Name: MARSHAL
Meaning: Variant of MARSHALL.

Name: MARSHALL
Meaning: From a surname that originally denoted a person who was a marshal. The word marshal originally derives from Germanic marah "horse" and scalc "servant".

Name: MARTHA
Usage: English, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch, German, Greek, Biblical, Old Church Slavic, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: From Aramaic מַרְתָּא (marta') meaning "the lady, the mistress", feminine form of מַר (mar) meaning "master". In the New Testament this is the name of the sister of Lazarus and Mary of Bethany (who is sometimes identified with Mary Magdalene). She was a witness to Jesus restoring her dead brother to life.... [more]

Name: MARTIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MARTIN, MARTINA or MARTHA.

Name: MARTIN
Usage: English, French, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Estonian, Russian, Romanian, Czech, Slovak, Slovene, Croatian, Hungarian, Bulgarian, Macedonian, Finnish
Meaning: From the Roman name Martinus, which was derived from Martis, the genitive case of the name of the Roman god MARS. Saint Martin of Tours was a 4th-century bishop who is the patron saint of France. According to legend, he came across a cold beggar in the middle of winter so he ripped his cloak in two and gave half of it to the beggar. He was a favourite saint during the Middle Ages, and his name has become common throughout the Christian world.... [more]

Name: MARTINA
Usage: German, Italian, Spanish, Catalan, Czech, Slovak, Croatian, Slovene, Hungarian, English, Swedish, Dutch, Ancient Roman
Meaning: Feminine form of Martinus (see MARTIN). Saint Martina was a 3rd-century martyr who is one of the patron saints of Rome.

Name: MARTY
Meaning: Diminutive of MARTIN.

Name: MARVA
Meaning: Feminine form of MARVIN.

Name: MARVIN
Meaning: Probably from an English surname that was derived from the given name MERVYN. A famous bearer was the American musician Marvin Gaye (1939-1984).

Name: MARVYN
Meaning: Variant of MARVIN.

Name: MARY
Meaning: Usual English form of Maria, the Latin form of the New Testament Greek names Μαριάμ (Mariam) and Μαρία (Maria) - the spellings are interchangeable - which were from Hebrew מִרְיָם (Miryam), a name borne by the sister of Moses in the Old Testament. The meaning is not known for certain, but there are several theories including "sea of bitterness", "rebelliousness", and "wished for child". However it was most likely originally an Egyptian name, perhaps derived in part from mry "beloved" or mr "love".... [more]

Name: MARY ANN
Meaning: Combination of MARY and ANN.

Name: MARYANN
Meaning: Combination of MARY and ANN.

Name: MARY ANNE
Meaning: Combination of MARY and ANNE (1).

Name: MARYANNE
Meaning: Combination of MARY and ANNE (1).

Name: MARY BETH
Meaning: Combination of MARY and BETH.

Name: MARYBETH
Meaning: Combination of MARY and BETH.

Name: MARY JANE
Meaning: Combination of MARY and JANE.

Name: MARY JO
Meaning: Combination of MARY and JO.

Name: MARY LOU
Meaning: Combination of MARY and LOU.

Name: MARYLOU
Meaning: Combination of MARY and LOU.

Name: MARYLU
Meaning: Variant of MARYLOU.

Name: MARYLYN
Meaning: Variant of MARILYN.

Name: MASON
Meaning: From an English surname meaning "stoneworker", from an Old French word of Germanic origin (akin to Old English macian "to make"). In the United States this name began to increase in popularity in the 1980s, likely because of its fashionable sound. It peaked in 2011, when it ranked as the second most popular name for boys.

Name: MASTERMAN
Meaning: From a surname that originally belonged to a person who worked as a servant.

Name: MAT
Meaning: Short form of MATTHEW.

Name: MATHEW
Meaning: Variant of MATTHEW.

Name: MATHILDA
Meaning: Variant of MATILDA.

Name: MATILDA
Meaning: From the Germanic name Mahthildis meaning "strength in battle", from the elements maht "might, strength" and hild "battle". Saint Matilda was the wife of the 10th-century German king Henry I the Fowler. The name was common in many branches of European royalty in the Middle Ages. It was brought to England by the Normans, being borne by the wife of William the Conqueror himself. Another notable royal by this name was a 12th-century daughter of Henry I of England, known as the Empress Matilda because of her first marriage to the Holy Roman emperor Henry V. She later invaded England, laying the foundations for the reign of her son Henry II.... [more]

Name: MATT
Meaning: Short form of MATTHEW.

Name: MATTHEW
Meaning: English form of Ματθαῖος (Matthaios), which was a Greek form of the Hebrew name מַתִּתְיָהוּ (Mattityahu) meaning "gift of YAHWEH", from the roots מַתָּן (mattan) meaning "gift" and יָה (yah) referring to the Hebrew God. Matthew, also called Levi, was one of the twelve apostles. He was a tax collector, and supposedly the author of the first gospel in the New Testament. He is considered a saint in many Christian traditions. The variant Matthias also occurs in the New Testament belonging to a separate apostle. The name appears in the Old Testament as Mattithiah.... [more]

Name: MATTIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MATILDA or MATTHEW.

Name: MATTY (1)
Meaning: Diminutive of MATTHEW.

Name: MAUD
Meaning: Usual medieval form of MATILDA. Though it became rare after the 14th century, it was revived and once more grew popular in the 19th century, perhaps due to Alfred Lord Tennyson's 1855 poem Maud.

Name: MAUDE
Meaning: Variant of MAUD.

Name: MAUDIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MAUD.

Name: MAURA (2)
Meaning: Anglicized form of MÁIRE. It has also been associated with Gaelic mór meaning "great". This was the name of an obscure 5th-century Irish or Scottish martyr.

Name: MAUREEN
Meaning: Anglicized form of MÁIRÍN.

Name: MAURENE
Meaning: Variant of MAUREEN.

Name: MAURICE
Meaning: From the Roman name Mauritius, a derivative of MAURUS. Saint Maurice was a 3rd-century Roman soldier from Egypt. He and the other Christians in his legion were supposedly massacred on the orders of Emperor Maximian for refusing to worship Roman gods. Thus, he is the patron saint of infantry soldiers.... [more]

Name: MAURINE
Meaning: Variant of MAUREEN.

Name: MAVERICK
Meaning: Derived from the English word maverick meaning "independent". The word itself is derived from the surname of a 19th-century Texas rancher who did not brand his calves.

Name: MAVIS
Meaning: From the name of the type of bird, also called the song thrush, derived from Old French mauvis, of uncertain origin. It was first used as a given name by the British author Marie Corelli, who used it for a character in her novel The Sorrows of Satan (1895).

Name: MAX
Usage: German, English, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch, Czech, Russian, Catalan
Meaning: Short form of MAXIMILIAN (or sometimes of MAXWELL in English). It is also an alternate transcription of Russian Макс (see MAKS).

Name: MAXENE
Meaning: Variant of MAXINE.

Name: MAXIMILIAN
Meaning: From the Roman name Maximilianus, which was derived from MAXIMUS. It was borne by a 3rd-century saint and martyr. In the 15th century the Holy Roman emperor Frederick III gave this name to his son and eventual heir. In this case it was a blend of the names of the Roman generals Fabius Maximus and Cornelius Scipio Aemilianus (see EMILIANO), who Frederick admired. It was subsequently borne by a second Holy Roman emperor, two kings of Bavaria, and a short-lived Habsburg emperor of Mexico.

Name: MAXIMILLIAN
Meaning: Variant of MAXIMILIAN.

Name: MAXINE
Meaning: Feminine form of MAX. It has been commonly used only since the beginning of the 20th century.

Name: MAXWELL
Meaning: From a Scottish surname meaning "Mack's stream", from the name Mack, a short form of the Scandinavian name MAGNUS, combined with Old English wella "stream". A famous bearer of the surname was James Maxwell (1831-1879), a Scottish physicist who studied gases and electromagnetism.

Name: MAY
Meaning: Derived from the name of the month of May, which derives from Maia, the name of a Roman goddess. May is also another name of the hawthorn flower. It is also used as a diminutive of MARY, MARGARET or MABEL.

Name: MAYA (2)
Meaning: Variant of MAIA (1). This name can also be given in reference to the Maya peoples, a Native American culture who built a great civilization in southern Mexico and Latin America.

Name: MAYBELLE
Meaning: Variant of MABEL.

Name: MAYBELLINE
Meaning: Diminutive of MABEL. This is an American cosmetics company, which was named after the founder's sister Mabel in 1915.

Name: MAYME
Meaning: Possibly a variant of MAMIE.

Name: MAYNARD
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from the Germanic given name MEGINHARD.

Name: MAYNERD
Meaning: Variant of MAYNARD.

Name: MAYSON
Meaning: Variant of MASON.

Name: MCKAYLA
Meaning: Variant of MICHAELA, often spelled as McKayla with the third letter capitalized, influenced by surnames beginning with Mc.

Name: MCKENNA
Meaning: From a surname, the Gaelic form of which is Mac Cionaodha meaning "son of CIONAODH".

Name: MCKENZIE
Meaning: Variant of MACKENZIE.

Name: MCKINLEY
Meaning: From a surname, the Gaelic form of which is Mac Fhionnlaigh meaning "son of FIONNLAGH". A famous bearer was the assassinated American president William McKinley (1843-1901).

Name: MEADE
Meaning: From an English surname that indicated one who lived on a meadow (from Middle English mede) or one who sold or made mead (an alcoholic drink made from fermented honey; from Old English meodu).

Name: MEADOW
Meaning: From the English word meadow, ultimately from Old English mædwe.

Name: MEAGAN
Meaning: Variant of MEGAN.

Name: MEAGHAN
Meaning: Variant of MEGAN.

Name: MEG
Meaning: Medieval diminutive of MARGARET. It is now also used as a short form of the related name MEGAN.

Name: MEGAN
Meaning: Welsh diminutive of MARGARET. In the English-speaking world outside of Wales it has only been regularly used since the middle of the 20th century.

Name: MEGHAN
Meaning: Variant of MEGAN.

Name: MEL
Meaning: Short form of MELVIN, MELANIE, MELISSA, and other names beginning with Mel.

Name: MELANIE
Meaning: From Mélanie, the French form of the Latin name Melania, derived from Greek μέλαινα (melaina) meaning "black, dark". This was the name of a Roman saint who gave all her wealth to charity in the 5th century. Her grandmother was also a saint with the same name.... [more]

Name: MELANTHA
Meaning: Probably a combination of Mel (from names such as MELANIE or MELISSA) with the suffix antha (from Greek ἄνθος (anthos) meaning "flower"). John Dryden used this name in his play Marriage a la Mode (1672).

Name: MELANY
Meaning: Variant of MELANIE.

Name: MELBA
Meaning: From the surname of the Australian opera singer Nellie Melba (1861-1931). This was a stage name that she got from the name of the city Melbourne, where she was born.

Name: MELESINA
Meaning: Perhaps a form of MILLICENT. It was borne by the Irish writer and socialite Melesina Trench (1768-1827).

Name: MELICENT
Meaning: Older form of MILLICENT.

Name: MELINA
Meaning: Elaboration of Mel, either from names such as MELISSA or from Greek μέλι (meli) meaning "honey". A famous bearer was Greek-American actress Melina Mercouri (1920-1994), who was born Maria Amalia Mercouris.

Name: MELINDA
Meaning: Combination of Mel (from names such as MELANIE or MELISSA) with the popular name suffix inda. It was created in the 18th century, and may have been inspired by the similar name Belinda. In Hungary, the name was popularized by the 1819 play Bánk Bán by József Katona.

Name: MELISSA
Usage: English, Dutch, Ancient Greek, Greek Mythology
Meaning: Means "bee" in Greek. In Greek mythology this was the name of a daughter of Procles, as well as an epithet of various Greek nymphs and priestesses. According to the early Christian writer Lactantius this was the name of the sister of the nymph Amalthea, with whom she cared for the young Zeus. Later it appears in Ludovico Ariosto's 1516 poem Orlando Furioso belonging to the fairy who helps Ruggiero escape from the witch Alcina. As an English given name, Melissa has been used since the 18th century.

Name: MELLONY
Meaning: Variant of MELANIE.

Name: MELODY
Meaning: From the English word melody, which is derived (via Old French and Late Latin) from Greek μέλος (melos) meaning "song" combined with ἀείδω (aeido) meaning "to sing".

Name: MELVA
Meaning: Perhaps a feminine form of MELVIN.

Name: MELVILLE
Meaning: From a Scottish surname that was originally from a Norman French place name meaning "bad town". A famous bearer of the surname was the American author Herman Melville (1819-1891), who wrote several novels including Moby-Dick.

Name: MELVIN
Meaning: From a Scottish surname that probably originated as a variant of MELVILLE.

Name: MELVYN
Meaning: Variant of MELVIN.

Name: MELYSSA
Meaning: Variant of MELISSA.

Name: MEMPHIS
Meaning: From the name of an important city of ancient Egypt, or the city in Tennessee that was named after it. It is derived from a Greek form of Egyptian mn-nfr meaning "enduring beauty".

Name: MERCIA
Meaning: Latinate form of MERCY. This was also the name of an old Anglo-Saxon kingdom, though it has a different origin.

Name: MERCY
Meaning: From the English word mercy, ultimately from Latin merces "wages, reward", a derivative of merx "goods, wares". This was one of the virtue names adopted by the Puritans in the 17th century.

Name: MEREDITH
Meaning: From the Welsh name Maredudd or Meredydd, possibly meaning "great lord" or "sea lord". Since the mid-1920s it has been used more often for girls than for boys in English-speaking countries, though it is still a masculine name in Wales. A famous bearer of this name as surname was the English novelist and poet George Meredith (1828-1909).

Name: MERIDETH
Meaning: Variant of MEREDITH.

Name: MERIDITH
Meaning: Variant of MEREDITH.

Name: MERIEL
Meaning: Variant of MURIEL.

Name: MERILYN
Meaning: Variant of MARILYN.

Name: MERIT (1)
Meaning: Either a variant of MERRITT or else simply from the English word merit, ultimately from Latin meritus "deserving".

Name: MERIWETHER
Meaning: From a surname meaning "happy weather" in Middle English, originally belonging to a cheery person. A notable bearer of the name was Meriwether Lewis (1774-1809), who, with William Clark, explored the west of North America.

Name: MERLA
Meaning: Variant of MERLE.

Name: MERLE
Meaning: Variant of MERRILL or MURIEL. The spelling has been influenced by the word merle meaning "blackbird" (via French, from Latin merula).

Name: MERLETTA
Meaning: Diminutive of MERLE.

Name: MERLIN
Meaning: Form of the Welsh name Myrddin (meaning "sea fortress") used by Geoffrey of Monmouth in his 12th-century Arthurian tales. Writing in Latin, he likely chose the form Merlinus over Merdinus in order to prevent associations with French merde "excrement".... [more]

Name: MERLYN
Meaning: Variant of MERLIN, sometimes used as a feminine form. It has perhaps been influenced by the Welsh word merlyn meaning "pony".

Name: MERRICK
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from the Welsh given name MEURIG.

Name: MERRILL
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived either from the given name MURIEL or from place names meaning "pleasant hill".

Name: MERRILYN
Meaning: Variant of MARILYN.

Name: MERRITT
Meaning: From an English surname, originally from a place name, which meant "boundary gate" in Old English.

Name: MERRY (1)
Meaning: From the English word merry, ultimately from Old English myrige. This name appears in Charles Dickens' novel Martin Chuzzlewit (1844), where it is a diminutive of MERCY.

Name: MERTON
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "town on a lake" in Old English.

Name: MERV
Meaning: Short form of MERVYN.

Name: MERVIN
Meaning: Variant of MERVYN.

Name: MERVYN
Meaning: From the Welsh name Merfyn, which possibly meant "marrow famous". This was the name of a 9th-century Welsh king, Merfyn Frych.

Name: MERYL
Meaning: Variant of MURIEL, influenced by the spelling of the name CHERYL. A famous bearer is American actress Meryl Streep (1949-), whose real name is Mary Louise Streep.

Name: MESSIAH
Meaning: From the English word meaning "saviour", ultimately from Hebrew מָשִׁיחַ (mashiyach) meaning "anointed". The word appears in the Old Testament referring to a future king of the Jewish people. In the New Testament it is translated as Christ and is used as a title of Jesus.

Name: MIA
Usage: Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch, German, English
Meaning: Scandinavian, Dutch and German diminutive of MARIA. It coincides with the Italian word mia meaning "mine".

Name: MICA
Meaning: Short form of MICHAELA.

Name: MICAH
Meaning: Contracted form of MICAIAH. Micah is one of the twelve minor prophets of the Old Testament. He authored the Book of Micah, which alternates between prophesies of doom and prophesies of restoration. This is also the name of a separate person in the Book of Judges, the keeper of an idol. It was occasionally used as an English given name by the Puritans after the Protestant Reformation, but it did not become common until the end of the 20th century.

Name: MICHAEL
Usage: English, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Dutch, Czech, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: From the Hebrew name מִיכָאֵל (Mikha'el) meaning "who is like God?". This is a rhetorical question, implying no person is like God. Michael is one of the archangels in Hebrew tradition and the only one identified as an archangel in the Bible. In the Book of Daniel in the Old Testament he is named as a protector of Israel. In the Book of Revelation in the New Testament he is portrayed as the leader of heaven's armies in the war against Satan, and is thus considered the patron saint of soldiers in Christianity.... [more]

Name: MICHAELA
Usage: German, Swedish, English, Czech, Slovak, Greek
Meaning: Feminine form of MICHAEL.

Name: MICHAYLA
Meaning: Variant of MICHAELA.

Name: MICHEAL
Meaning: Variant of MICHAEL.

Name: MICHELE (2)
Meaning: Variant of MICHELLE.

Name: MICHELLE
Meaning: French feminine form of MICHEL. It has been common in the English-speaking world since the middle of the 20th century. A famous bearer is the former American first lady Michelle Obama (1964-).

Name: MICHELYNE
Meaning: Diminutive of MICHELLE.

Name: MICK
Meaning: Short form of MICHAEL. This name has become a slang term for an Irishman.

Name: MICKEY
Meaning: Diminutive or feminine form of MICHAEL. This was the name that Walt Disney gave to Ub Iwerks' cartoon character Mickey Mouse, who was originally named Mortimer Mouse. Another famous bearer was the American baseball player Mickey Mantle (1931-1995).

Name: MICKY
Meaning: Diminutive of MICHAEL.

Name: MIDGE
Meaning: Variant of MADGE.

Name: MIKAYLA
Meaning: Variant of MICHAELA.

Name: MIKE
Meaning: Short form of MICHAEL.

Name: MIKEY
Meaning: Diminutive of MICHAEL.

Name: MIKHAILA
Meaning: Variant of MICHAELA, possibly influenced by the spelling of Mikhail.

Name: MIKKI
Meaning: Strictly feminine variant of MICKEY.

Name: MILANI
Meaning: Possibly from the name of the Italian city of MILAN, or a variant of MELANIE.

Name: MILBURN
Meaning: From an English surname that was from a place name meaning "mill stream" in Old English.

Name: MILDRED
Meaning: From the Old English name Mildþryð meaning "gentle strength", derived from the elements milde "gentle" and þryð "strength". Saint Mildred was a 7th-century abbess, the daughter of the Kentish princess Saint Ermenburga. After the Norman Conquest this name became rare, but it was revived in the 19th century.

Name: MILES
Meaning: From the Germanic name Milo, introduced by the Normans to England in the form Miles. The meaning is not known for certain. It is possibly connected to the Slavic name element milu meaning "gracious". From an early date it was associated with Latin miles "soldier".... [more]

Name: MILEY
Meaning: In the case of actress and singer Miley Cyrus (1992-), it is a shortened form of the nickname Smiley, given to her by her father because she often smiled. Although it was not at all common before she brought it to public attention, there are some examples of its use before her time, most likely as a diminutive of MILES.

Name: MILFORD
Meaning: From an English surname that was originally derived from various place names all meaning "ford by a mill" in Old English.

Name: MILLARD
Meaning: From an occupational English surname meaning "guardian of the mill" in Old English.

Name: MILLICENT
Meaning: From the Germanic name Amalasuintha, composed of the elements amal "work, labour" and swinth "strong". Amalasuintha was a 6th-century queen of the Ostrogoths. The Normans introduced this name to England in the form Melisent or Melisende. Melisende was a 12th-century queen of Jerusalem, the daughter of Baldwin II.

Name: MILLIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MILDRED, MILLICENT and other names containing the same sound.

Name: MILLY
Meaning: Diminutive of EMILIE, MILDRED and other names containing the same sound.

Name: MILO
Meaning: Old Germanic form of MILES, as well as the Latinized form. This form of the name was used in official documents during the Middle Ages, and it has been used independently since the 19th century.

Name: MILTON
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from a place name meaning "mill town" in Old English. A famous bearer of the surname was John Milton (1608-1674), the poet who wrote Paradise Lost.

Name: MIMI
Meaning: Diminutive of MARIA and other names beginning with M.

Name: MINA (1)
Meaning: Short form of WILHELMINA and other names ending in mina. This was the name of a character in the novel Dracula (1897) by Bram Stoker.

Name: MINDY
Meaning: Diminutive of MELINDA.

Name: MINERVA
Meaning: Possibly derived from Latin mens meaning "intellect", but more likely of Etruscan origin. Minerva was the Roman goddess of wisdom and war, approximately equivalent to the Greek goddess Athena. It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since after the Renaissance.

Name: MINNIE
Meaning: Diminutive of WILHELMINA.

Name: MINTA
Meaning: Short form of ARAMINTA.

Name: MINTY
Meaning: Diminutive of ARAMINTA.

Name: MIRABELLE
Meaning: Derived from Latin mirabilis meaning "wonderful". This name was coined during the Middle Ages, though it eventually died out. It was briefly revived in the 19th century.

Name: MIRACLE
Meaning: From the English word miracle for an extraordinary event, ultimately deriving from Latin miraculum "wonder, marvel".

Name: MIRANDA
Meaning: Derived from Latin mirandus meaning "admirable, wonderful". The name was created by Shakespeare for the heroine in his play The Tempest (1611), about a father and daughter stranded on an island. It did not become a common English given name until the 20th century. This is also the name of one of the moons of Uranus, named after the Shakespearean character.

Name: MIRIAM
Usage: Hebrew, English, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Czech, Slovak, Polish, Biblical, Biblical Hebrew
Meaning: Hebrew form of MARY. It is used in the Old Testament, where it belongs to the elder sister of Moses and Aaron. She watched over the infant Moses as the pharaoh's daughter drew him from the Nile. The name has long been popular among Jews, and it has been used as an English Christian name (alongside Mary) since the Protestant Reformation.

Name: MISSIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MELISSA.

Name: MISSY
Meaning: Diminutive of MELISSA. This is also a slang term meaning "young woman".

Name: MISTI
Meaning: Variant of MISTY.

Name: MISTY
Meaning: From the English word misty, ultimately derived from Old English. The jazz song Misty (1954) by Erroll Garner may have helped popularize the name.

Name: MITCH
Meaning: Short form of MITCHELL.

Name: MITCHELL
Meaning: From a surname, itself derived from the given name MICHAEL or in some cases from Middle English michel meaning "big, large".

Name: MO
Meaning: Short form of MAUREEN, MAURICE, MORRIS, and other names beginning with a similar sound.

Name: MODESTY
Meaning: From the English word modesty, ultimately from Latin modestus "moderate", a derivative of modus "measure".

Name: MOE (1)
Meaning: Short form of MAURICE or MORRIS, or sometimes of other names beginning with a similar sound.

Name: MOIRA
Meaning: Anglicized form of MÁIRE. It also coincides with Greek Μοῖρα (Moira) meaning "fate, destiny", the singular of Μοῖραι, the Greek name for the Fates. They were the three female personifications of destiny in Greek mythology.

Name: MOLLIE
Meaning: Variant of MOLLY.

Name: MOLLY
Meaning: Medieval diminutive of MARY, now often used independently. It developed from Malle and Molle, other medieval diminutives. James Joyce used this name in his novel Ulysses (1922), where it belongs to Molly Bloom, the wife of the main character.

Name: MONA (1)
Meaning: Anglicized form of MUADHNAIT. It is also associated with Greek monos "one" and Leonardo da Vinci's painting the Mona Lisa (in which case it is a contraction of Italian ma donna meaning "my lady").

Name: MONDAY
Meaning: From the English word for the day of the week, which was derived from Old English mona "moon" and dæg "day". This was formerly given to girls born on Monday.

Name: MONICA
Usage: English, Italian, Romanian, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish, Late Roman
Meaning: Meaning unknown, most likely of North African or Phoenician origin. In the 4th century this name was borne by the North African saint Monica of Hippo, the mother of Saint Augustine, whom she converted to Christianity. Since the Middle Ages it has been associated with Latin moneo "advisor" and Greek monos "one". As an English name, Monica has been in general use since the 18th century.

Name: MONIQUE
Meaning: French form of MONICA.

Name: MONNA
Meaning: Variant of MONA (1).

Name: MONROE
Meaning: From a Scottish surname meaning "from the mouth of the Roe". The Roe is a river in Ireland. Two famous bearers of the surname were American president James Monroe (1758-1831) and American actress Marilyn Monroe (1926-1962).

Name: MONTAGUE
Meaning: From a surname meaning "pointed mountain" in French. In Shakespeare's tragedy Romeo and Juliet (1596) this is the surname of Romeo and his family.

Name: MONTANA
Meaning: From the name of the American state, which is derived from Latin montanus "mountainous".

Name: MONTE
Meaning: Either a diminutive of MONTGOMERY or from the Spanish or Italian vocabulary word meaning "mountain".

Name: MONTGOMERY
Meaning: From an English surname meaning "GUMARICH's mountain" in Norman French. A notable bearer of this surname was Bernard Montgomery (1887-1976), a British army commander during World War II.

Name: MONTY
Meaning: Variant of MONTE.

Name: MORA
Meaning: Variant of MAURA (2).

Name: MOREEN
Meaning: Anglicized form of MÓIRÍN. It is sometimes used as a variant of MAUREEN.

Name: MORGAN (1)
Meaning: From the Old Welsh masculine name Morcant, which was possibly derived from Welsh mor "sea" and cant "circle". Since the 1980s in America Morgan has been more common for girls than boys, perhaps due to stories of Morgan le Fay or the fame of actress Morgan Fairchild (1950-).

Name: MORGANA
Meaning: Feminine form of MORGAN (1).

Name: MORIAH
Meaning: From Hebrew מֹרִיָה (Moriyah) possibly meaning "seen by YAHWEH". This is a place name in the Old Testament, both the land where Abraham is to sacrifice Isaac and the mountain upon which Solomon builds the temple. They may be the same place. Since the 1980s it has occasionally been used as a feminine given name in America.

Name: MORLEY
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from an Old English place name meaning "marsh clearing".

Name: MORRIS
Meaning: Usual medieval form of MAURICE.

Name: MORT
Meaning: Short form of MORTON or MORTIMER.

Name: MORTIMER
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from a place name meaning "still water" in Old French.

Name: MORTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a place name meaning "moor town" in Old English.

Name: MORTY
Meaning: Diminutive of MORTON or MORTIMER.

Name: MOSES
Meaning: From the Hebrew name מֹשֶׁה (Mosheh), which is most likely derived from Egyptian mes meaning "son", but could also possibly mean "deliver" in Hebrew. The meaning suggested in the Old Testament of "drew out" from Hebrew משה (mashah) is probably an invented etymology (see Exodus 2:10).... [more]

Name: MOSS
Meaning: Medieval form of MOSES.

Name: MOZELLE
Meaning: Possibly a feminine form of MOSES.

Name: MURIEL
Meaning: Medieval English form of a Breton name that was probably related to the Irish name MUIRGEL. The Normans brought it to England from Brittany. In the modern era it was popularized by a character from Dinah Craik's novel John Halifax, Gentleman (1856).

Name: MURPHY
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from Ó Murchadha meaning "descendant of MURCHADH".

Name: MURRAY
Meaning: From a surname, which is either Scottish or Irish in origin (see MURRAY (1) and MURRAY (2)).

Name: MYA
Meaning: Variant of MAYA (2).

Name: MYLA
Meaning: Possibly a feminine form of MILES, influenced by similar-sounding names such as Kyla.

Name: MYLES (1)
Meaning: Variant of MILES.

Name: MYRA
Meaning: Created by the 17th-century poet Fulke Greville. He possibly based it on Latin myrra meaning "myrrh" (a fragrant resin obtained from a tree). Otherwise, he may have simply rearranged the letters from the name MARY. Although unrelated etymologically, this is also the name of an ancient city of Anatolia.

Name: MYRANDA
Meaning: Variant of MIRANDA.

Name: MYRON
Meaning: Derived from Greek μύρον (myron) meaning "sweet oil, perfume". Myron was the name of a 5th-century BC Greek sculptor. Saints bearing this name include a 3rd-century bishop of Crete and a 4th-century martyr from Cyzicus who was killed by a mob. These saints are more widely revered in the Eastern Church, and the name has generally been more common among Eastern Christians. As an English name, it has been used since the 19th century.

Name: MYRTIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MYRTLE.

Name: MYRTLE
Meaning: Simply from the English word myrtle for the evergreen shrub, ultimately from Greek μύρτος (myrtos). It was first used as a given name in the 19th century, at the same time many other plant and flower names were coined.

Name: NADIA (1)
Usage: French, Italian, Spanish, English, Russian, Bulgarian, Ukrainian
Meaning: Variant of NADYA (1) used in the western world, as well as an alternate transcription of the Slavic name. It began to be used in France in the 19th century. The name received a boost in popularity from the Romanian gymnast Nadia Comaneci (1961-).

Name: NADINE
Meaning: French elaborated form of NADIA (1).

Name: NAN
Meaning: Originally a diminutive of ANN. It may have originated with the affectionate phrase mine Ann, which was later reinterpreted as my Nan. It is now also used as a short form of NANCY.

Name: NANCE
Meaning: Short form of NANCY.

Name: NANCY
Meaning: Previously a medieval diminutive of ANNIS, though since the 18th century it has been a diminutive of ANN. It is now usually regarded as an independent name. During the 20th century it became very popular in the United States. A city in the Lorraine region of France bears this name, though it derives from a different source.

Name: NANETTE
Meaning: Diminutive of ANNE (1).

Name: NANNIE
Meaning: Diminutive of ANNE (1).

Name: NANNY
Meaning: Diminutive of ANNE (1).

Name: NAOMI (1)
Meaning: From the Hebrew name נָעֳמִי (Na'omi) meaning "pleasantness". In the Old Testament this is the name of the mother-in-law of Ruth. After the death of her husband and sons, she returned to Bethlehem with Ruth. There she declared that her name should be Mara (see Ruth 1:20).... [more]

Name: NAPIER
Meaning: From an English and Scots surname meaning "linen keeper" in Middle English, from Old French nappe "table cloth".

Name: NAPOLEON
Meaning: From the old Italian name Napoleone, used most notably by the French emperor Napoléon Bonaparte (1769-1821), who was born on Corsica. The etymology is uncertain, but it is possibly derived from the Germanic Nibelungen meaning "sons of mist", a name used in Germanic mythology to refer to the keepers of a hoard of treasure (often identified with the Burgundians). Alternatively, it could be connected to the name of the Italian city of Napoli (Naples).

Name: NARELLE
Meaning: Meaning unknown. It was borne by the wife of Umbarra, who was a 19th-century leader of the Yuin, an Australian Aboriginal people.

Name: NASH
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the Middle English phrase atten ash "at the ash tree". A famous bearer of the surname was the mathematician John Nash (1928-2015). The name was popularized in the 1990s by the television series Nash Bridges.

Name: NAT
Meaning: Short form of NATHAN, NATHANIEL, NATALIE, or other names beginning with Nat.

Name: NATALEE
Meaning: Variant of NATALIE.

Name: NATALIA
Usage: Polish, Italian, Spanish, Romanian, English, German, Dutch, Norwegian, Danish, Swedish, Greek, Georgian, Russian, Ukrainian, Bulgarian, Late Roman
Meaning: Latinate form of Natalia (see NATALIE).

Name: NATALIE
Usage: English, German, Dutch, Swedish, Danish, Norwegian
Meaning: From the Late Latin name Natalia, which meant "Christmas Day" from Latin natale domini. This was the name of the wife of the 4th-century martyr Saint Adrian of Nicomedia.
