Meaning: From the English word for the large grassy plain, ultimately deriving from the Taino (Native American) word zabana. It came into use as a given name in America in the 19th century. It was revived in the 1980s by the movie Savannah Smiles (1982).

Name: SAWYER
Meaning: From a surname meaning "sawer of wood" in Middle English. Mark Twain used it for the hero in his novel The Adventures of Tom Sawyer (1876).

Name: SAXON
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from the name of the Germanic tribe the Saxons, ultimately deriving from the Germanic word sahs meaning "knife". This name can also be given in direct reference to the tribe.

Name: SAYLOR
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from Old French sailleor meaning "acrobat, dancer". As a modern English given name it could also come from the homophone vocabulary word sailor.

Name: SCARLET
Meaning: Either a variant of SCARLETT or else from the English word for the red colour (both of the same origin, a type of cloth).

Name: SCARLETT
Meaning: From a surname that denoted a person who sold or made clothes made of scarlet (a kind of cloth, possibly derived from Persian سقرلاط (saghrelat)). Margaret Mitchell used this name for Scarlett O'Hara, the main character in her novel Gone with the Wind (1936). Scarlett's name came from her grandmother's maiden name.

Name: SCHUYLER
Meaning: From a Dutch surname meaning "scholar". Dutch settlers brought the surname to America, where it was subsequently adopted as a given name in honour of the American general and senator Philip Schuyler (1733-1804).

Name: SCOT
Meaning: Variant form of SCOTT.

Name: SCOTT
Meaning: From an English and Scottish surname that referred to a person from Scotland or a person who spoke Scottish Gaelic. It is derived from Latin Scoti meaning "Gaelic speaker", with the ultimate origin uncertain.

Name: SCOTTIE
Meaning: Diminutive of SCOTT.

Name: SCOTTY
Meaning: Diminutive of SCOTT.

Name: SCOUT
Meaning: From the English word scout meaning "one who gathers information covertly", which is derived from Old French escouter "to listen". Harper Lee used this name in her novel To Kill a Mockingbird (1960).

Name: SEAN
Meaning: Anglicized form of SEÁN.

Name: SEANNA
Meaning: Feminine form of SEÁN.

Name: SEBASTIAN
Usage: German, English, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Polish, Finnish, Romanian, Czech
Meaning: From the Latin name Sebastianus, which meant "from Sebaste". Sebaste was the name a town in Asia Minor, its name deriving from Greek σεβαστός (sebastos) meaning "venerable" (a translation of Latin Augustus, the title of the Roman emperors). According to Christian tradition, Saint Sebastian was a 3rd-century Roman soldier martyred during the persecutions of the emperor Diocletian. After he was discovered to be a Christian, he was tied to a stake and shot with arrows. This however did not kill him. Saint Irene of Rome healed him and he returned to personally admonish Diocletian, whereupon the emperor had him beaten to death.... [more]

Name: SEFTON
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "town in the rushes" in Old English.

Name: SELA
Meaning: From the name of a city, the capital of Edom, which appears in the Old Testament. It means "rock" in Hebrew.

Name: SELBY
Meaning: From an English surname that was from a place name meaning "willow farm" in Old Norse.

Name: SELINA
Meaning: Possibly a variant of CÉLINE or SELENE. As an English name, it first came into use in the 17th century.

Name: SELMA (1)
Usage: English, German, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Icelandic
Meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly a short form of ANSELMA. It could also have been inspired by James Macpherson's 18th-century poems, in which it is the name of Ossian's castle.

Name: SELWYN
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from an Old English given name, which was formed of the elements sele "manor" and wine "friend".

Name: SEPTEMBER
Meaning: From the name of the ninth month (though it means "seventh month" in Latin, since it was originally the seventh month of the Roman year), which is sometimes used as a given name for someone born in September.

Name: SEQUOIA
Meaning: From the name of huge trees that grow in California. The tree got its name from the 19th-century Cherokee scholar Sequoyah (also known as George Guess), the inventor of the Cherokee writing system.

Name: SERA
Meaning: Either a variant of SARAH or a short form of SERAPHINA.

Name: SERAPHINA
Meaning: Feminine form of the Late Latin name Seraphinus, derived from the biblical word seraphim, which was Hebrew in origin and meant "fiery ones". The seraphim were an order of angels, described by Isaiah in the Bible as having six wings each.... [more]

Name: SERENA
Meaning: From a Late Latin name that was derived from Latin serenus meaning "clear, tranquil, serene". This name was borne by an obscure early saint. Edmund Spenser also used it in his poem The Faerie Queene (1590).

Name: SERENITY
Meaning: From the English word meaning "serenity, tranquility", ultimately from Latin serenus meaning "clear, calm".

Name: SERINA
Meaning: Variant of SERENA.

Name: SERRENA
Meaning: Variant of SERENA.

Name: SETH (1)
Usage: English, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: Means "placed" or "appointed" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is the third named son of Adam and Eve, and the ancestor of Noah and all humankind. In England this name came into use after the Protestant Reformation.

Name: SEWARD
Meaning: From a surname that was itself derived from the Old English given name SIGEWEARD.

Name: SEYMOUR
Meaning: From a Norman surname that originally belonged to a person coming from the French town of Saint Maur (which means "Saint MAURUS").

Name: SHAD (2)
Meaning: Perhaps a variant of CHAD.

Name: SHAE
Meaning: Variant of SHEA.

Name: SHAELYN
Meaning: Combination of SHAE and LYNN.

Name: SHANA (1)
Meaning: Variant of SHANNA.

Name: SHANAE
Meaning: Elaboration of the popular name element Shan.

Name: SHANE
Meaning: Anglicized form of SEÁN. It came into general use in America after the release of the western movie Shane (1953).

Name: SHANELLE
Meaning: Variant of CHANEL.

Name: SHANENE
Meaning: Combination of the popular name elements Shan and ene.

Name: SHANIA
Meaning: In the case of singer Shania Twain (1965-), who chose it as her stage name, she has claimed it was based on an Ojibwe phrase meaning "on my way". This appears to be untrue.

Name: SHANNA
Meaning: Possibly a feminine variant of SHANNON.

Name: SHANNAH
Meaning: Variant of SHANNA.

Name: SHANNEN
Meaning: Variant of SHANNON.

Name: SHANNON
Meaning: From the name of the River Shannon, the longest river in Ireland, called Abha an tSionainn in Irish. It is associated with the goddess Sionann and is sometimes said to be named for her. However it is more likely the goddess was named after the river, which may be related to Old Irish sen "old, ancient". As a given name, it first became common in America after the 1940s.

Name: SHANON
Meaning: Variant of SHANNON.

Name: SHANTAE
Meaning: Variant of CHANTÉ.

Name: SHANTEL
Meaning: Variant of CHANTEL.

Name: SHANTELLE
Meaning: Variant of CHANTEL.

Name: SHAQUILA
Meaning: Variant of SHAKILA.

Name: SHAQUILLE
Meaning: Variant of SHAKIL. This name is borne by basketball player Shaquille O'Neal (1972-).

Name: SHARALYN
Meaning: Variant of CHERILYN.

Name: SHARI
Meaning: Diminutive of SHARON or a variant of SHERRY.

Name: SHARISE
Meaning: Variant of CHARISSE.

Name: SHARLA
Meaning: Variant of CHARLA.

Name: SHARLEEN
Meaning: Variant of CHARLENE.

Name: SHARLENE
Meaning: Variant of CHARLENE.

Name: SHARMAINE
Meaning: Variant of CHARMAINE.

Name: SHARON
Meaning: From an Old Testament place name, in Hebrew שָׁרוֹן (Sharon), which means "plain", referring to the fertile plain near the coast of Israel. This is also the name of a type of flowering shrub, the rose of Sharon. It has been in use as a given name since the 1920s, possibly inspired by the heroine in the serial novel The Skyrocket (1925) by Adela Rogers St. Johns.

Name: SHARONA
Meaning: Elaborated form of SHARON.

Name: SHARRON
Meaning: Variant of SHARON.

Name: SHARYL
Meaning: Variant of CHERYL.

Name: SHARYN
Meaning: Variant of SHARON.

Name: SHAUN
Meaning: Anglicized form of SEÁN.

Name: SHAUNA
Meaning: Feminine form of SHAUN.

Name: SHAVONNE
Meaning: Anglicized form of SIOBHÁN.

Name: SHAW (1)
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from Old English sceaga meaning "thicket".

Name: SHAWN
Meaning: Anglicized form of SEÁN.

Name: SHAWNA
Meaning: Feminine form of SHAWN.

Name: SHAWNDA
Meaning: Variant of SHONDA.

Name: SHAWNEE
Meaning: Means "southern people" in the Algonquin language. The Shawnee were an Algonquin tribe who originally lived in the Ohio valley.

Name: SHAYE
Meaning: Variant of SHEA.

Name: SHAYLA
Meaning: Variant of SHEILA, influenced by the spelling and sound of KAYLA.

Name: SHAYLYN
Meaning: Combination of SHAE and LYNN.

Name: SHAYNE
Meaning: Variant of SHANE.

Name: SHEARD
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from a place name meaning "gap between hills" in Old English.

Name: SHEELAGH
Meaning: Variant of SHEILA.

Name: SHEENA
Meaning: Anglicized form of SÌNE. This name was popularized outside of Scotland in the 1980s by the singer Sheena Easton (1959-).

Name: SHEENAGH
Meaning: Variant of SHEENA.

Name: SHEILA
Meaning: Anglicized form of SÍLE.

Name: SHEL
Meaning: Short form of SHELDON.

Name: SHELAGH
Meaning: Variant of SHEILA.

Name: SHELBY
Meaning: From a surname, which was possibly a variant of SELBY. Though previously in use as a rare masculine name, it was popularized as a feminine name by the main character in the movie The Woman in Red (1935). It was later reinforced by the movie Steel Magnolias (1989) in which Julia Roberts played a character by this name.

Name: SHELDON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a place name meaning "valley with steep sides" in Old English. Sheldon is the name of several locations in England.

Name: SHELIA
Meaning: Variant of SHEILA.

Name: SHELL
Meaning: Short form of MICHELLE or SHELLEY. It can also be simply from the English word shell (ultimately from Old English sciell).

Name: SHELLEY
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a place name meaning "clearing on a bank" in Old English. Two famous bearers of the surname were Percy Bysshe Shelley (1792-1822), a romantic poet whose works include Adonais and Ozymandias, and Mary Shelley (1797-1851), his wife, the author of the horror story Frankenstein. As a feminine given name, it came into general use after the 1940s.

Name: SHELLY
Meaning: Variant of SHELLEY.

Name: SHELTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a place name meaning "shelf town" in Old English.

Name: SHENA
Meaning: Variant of SHEENA.

Name: SHEPHERD
Meaning: From an English occupational surname meaning "sheep herder".

Name: SHEREE
Meaning: Variant of SHERRY. This particular spelling was popularized by American actress Sheree North (1932-2005), who was born Dawn Shirley Crang.

Name: SHERI
Meaning: Variant of SHERRY.

Name: SHERIDAN
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from Ó Sirideáin meaning "descendant of Sirideán". The name Sirideán means "searcher" in Gaelic.

Name: SHERIE
Meaning: Variant of SHERRY.

Name: SHERILL
Meaning: Variant of CHERYL.

Name: SHERILYN
Meaning: Variant of CHERILYN.

Name: SHERISSE
Meaning: Variant of CHARISSE.

Name: SHERLEY
Meaning: Variant of SHIRLEY.

Name: SHERMAN
Meaning: From a surname meaning "shear man" in Old English, originally denoting a person who cut cloth. Famous bearers of the surname include American politician Roger Sherman (1721-1793) and American Civil War general William Tecumseh Sherman (1820-1891).

Name: SHERRI
Meaning: Variant of SHERRY.

Name: SHERRIE
Meaning: Variant of SHERRY.

Name: SHERRY
Meaning: Before the 20th century this was probably from the Irish surname Ó Searraigh meaning "descendant of Searrach" (a name meaning "foal" in Gaelic). Later it may have been reinforced by the French word chérie meaning "darling", or the English word sherry, a type of fortified wine named from the Spanish town of Jerez. This name came into popular use during the 1920s, inspired by other similar-sounding names and by Collette's novels Chéri (1920, English translation 1929) and The Last of Chéri (1926, English translation 1932), in which it is a masculine name.

Name: SHERWOOD
Meaning: From an English place name (or from a surname that was derived from it) meaning "bright forest". This was the name of the forest in which the legendary outlaw Robin Hood made his home.

Name: SHERYL
Meaning: Variant of CHERYL.

Name: SHERYLL
Meaning: Variant of CHERYL.

Name: SHEVAUN
Meaning: Anglicized form of SIOBHÁN.

Name: SHEVON
Meaning: Anglicized form of SIOBHÁN.

Name: SHIRLEE
Meaning: Variant of SHIRLEY.

Name: SHIRLEY
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a place name meaning "bright clearing" in Old English. This is the name of a main character in Charlotte Brontë's semi-autobiographical novel Shirley (1849). The child actress Shirley Temple (1928-2014) helped to popularize this name.

Name: SHONDA
Meaning: Probably a blend of SHONA and RHONDA.

Name: SHYLA
Meaning: Variant of SHEILA.

Name: SIBYL
Meaning: From Greek Σίβυλλα (Sibylla), meaning "prophetess, sibyl". In Greek and Roman legend the sibyls were female prophets who practiced at different holy sites in the ancient world. In later Christian theology, the sibyls were thought to have divine knowledge and were revered in much the same way as the Old Testament prophets. Because of this, the name came into general use in the Christian world during the Middle Ages. The Normans imported it to England, where it was spelled both Sibyl and Sybil. It became rare after the Protestant Reformation, but it was revived in the 19th century, perhaps helped by Benjamin Disraeli's novel Sybil (1845).

Name: SID
Meaning: Short form of SIDNEY.

Name: SIDNEY
Meaning: From the English surname SIDNEY. It was first used as a given name in honour of executed politician Algernon Sidney (1622-1683). Another notable bearer of the surname was the poet and statesman Sir Philip Sidney (1554-1586).

Name: SIDONY
Meaning: Feminine form of SIDONIUS. This name was in use in the Middle Ages, when it became associated with the word sindon (of Greek origin) meaning "linen", a reference to the Shroud of Turin.

Name: SIENA
Meaning: Variant of SIENNA, with the spelling perhaps influenced by that of the Italian city.

Name: SIENNA
Meaning: From the English word meaning "orange-red". It is ultimately from the name of the city of Siena in Italy, because of the colour of the clay there.

Name: SIERRA
Meaning: Means "mountain range" in Spanish, referring specifically to a mountain range with jagged peaks.

Name: SIGMUND
Meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements sigu "victory" and mund "protector" (or in the case of the Scandinavian cognate, from the Old Norse elements sigr "victory" and mundr "protector"). In Norse mythology this was the name of the hero Sigurd's father, the bearer of the powerful sword Gram. A notable bearer was the Austrian psychologist Sigmund Freud (1856-1939), the creator of the revolutionary theory of psychoanalysis.

Name: SILAS
Usage: English, Greek, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: Probably a short form of SILVANUS. This is the name of a companion of Saint Paul in the New Testament. Paul refers to him as Silvanus in his epistles, though it is possible that Silas was in fact a Greek form of the Hebrew name SAUL (via Aramaic).... [more]

Name: SILVER
Meaning: From the English word for the precious metal or the colour, ultimately derived from Old English seolfor.

Name: SILVESTER
Usage: Slovak, Slovene, Serbian, German, English, Late Roman
Meaning: From a Roman name meaning "of the forest" from Latin silva "wood, forest". This was the name of three popes, including Saint Silvester I who supposedly baptized the first Christian Roman emperor, Constantine the Great. As an English name, Silvester (or Sylvester) has been in use since the Middle Ages, though it became less common after the Protestant Reformation.

Name: SILVIA
Usage: Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovak, German, Dutch, English, Late Roman, Roman Mythology
Meaning: Feminine form of SILVIUS. Rhea Silvia was the mother of Romulus and Remus, the founders of Rome. This was also the name of a 6th-century saint, the mother of the pope Gregory the Great. It has been a common name in Italy since the Middle Ages. It was introduced to England by Shakespeare, who used it for a character in his play The Two Gentlemen of Verona (1594). It is now more commonly spelled Sylvia in the English-speaking world.

Name: SIMON (1)
Usage: English, French, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, German, Dutch, Hungarian, Slovene, Romanian, Macedonian, Georgian, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: From Σίμων (Simon), the New Testament Greek form of the Hebrew name שִׁמְעוֹן (Shim'on) meaning "he has heard". This name is spelled Simeon, based on Greek Συμεών, in many translations of the Old Testament, where it is borne by the second son of Jacob. The New Testament spelling may show influence from the otherwise unrelated Greek name SIMON (2).... [more]

Name: SIMONE (1)
Usage: French, English, German, Dutch, Danish, Portuguese
Meaning: French feminine form of SIMON (1). A famous bearer was Simone de Beauvoir (1908-1986), a French feminist and philosopher.

Name: SIMONETTE
Meaning: Diminutive of SIMONE (1).

Name: SINCLAIR
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a Norman French town called "Saint CLAIR". A notable bearer was the American author Sinclair Lewis (1885-1951).

Name: SINDY
Meaning: Variant of CINDY.

Name: SINJIN
Meaning: Phonetic variant of ST JOHN.

Name: SISSIE
Meaning: Variant of SISSY.

Name: SISSY
Meaning: Diminutive of CECILIA, FRANCES or PRISCILLA. It can also be taken from the nickname, which originated as a nursery form of the word sister.

Name: SKY
Meaning: Simply from the English word sky, which was ultimately derived from Old Norse sky "cloud".

Name: SKYE
Meaning: From the name of the Isle of Skye off the west coast of Scotland. It is sometimes considered a variant of SKY.

Name: SKYLA
Meaning: Feminine variant of SKYLER, formed using the popular name suffix la.

Name: SKYLAR
Meaning: Variant of SKYLER.

Name: SKYLER
Meaning: Variant of SCHUYLER. The spelling was modified due to association with the name Tyler and the English word sky.

Name: SLADE
Meaning: From a surname that meant "valley" in Old English.

Name: SLOAN
Meaning: Variant of SLOANE.

Name: SLOANE
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from an Anglicized form of the given name SLUAGHADHÁN.

Name: SLY
Meaning: Short form of SYLVESTER. The actor Sylvester Stallone (1946-) is a well-known bearer of this nickname.

Name: SMITH
Meaning: From an English surname meaning "metal worker, blacksmith", derived from Old English smitan "to smite, to hit". It is the most common surname in most of the English-speaking world.

Name: SOLOMON
Usage: Biblical, English, Jewish, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: From the Hebrew name שְׁלֹמֹה (Shelomoh), which was derived from Hebrew שָׁלוֹם (shalom) meaning "peace". As told in the Old Testament, Solomon was a king of Israel, the son of David and Bathsheba. He was renowned for his wisdom and wealth. Towards the end of his reign he angered God by turning to idolatry. Supposedly, he was the author of the Book of Proverbs, Ecclesiastes and the Song of Solomon.... [more]

Name: SOMMER
Meaning: Variant of SUMMER, coinciding with the German word for summer.

Name: SONDRA
Meaning: Variant of SAUNDRA. It was popularized in the English-speaking world by a character in Theodore Dreiser's novel An American Tragedy (1925) and the subsequent movie adaptation (1931).

Name: SONIA
Usage: English, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Romanian, Polish
Meaning: Variant of SONYA.

Name: SONNIE
Meaning: Variant of SONNY.

Name: SONNY
Meaning: From a nickname that is commonly used to denote a young boy, derived from the English word son.

Name: SONYA
Meaning: Russian diminutive of SOPHIA. This is the name of a character in Leo Tolstoy's novel War and Peace (1869, English translation 1886).

Name: SOPHIA
Meaning: Means "wisdom" in Greek. This was the name of an early, probably mythical, saint who died of grief after her three daughters were martyred during the reign of the emperor Hadrian. Legends about her probably arose as a result of a medieval misunderstanding of the phrase Hagia Sophia "Holy Wisdom", which is the name of a large basilica in Constantinople.... [more]

Name: SOPHIE
Meaning: French form of SOPHIA.

Name: SOPHY
Meaning: Variant of SOPHIE or a diminutive of SOPHIA.

Name: SORREL
Meaning: From the name of the sour tasting plant, which may ultimately derive from Germanic sur "sour".

Name: SPARROW
Meaning: From the name of the bird, ultimately from Old English spearwa.

Name: SPENCER
Meaning: From a surname that meant "dispenser of provisions", derived from Middle English spense "larder, pantry". A famous bearer was American actor Spencer Tracy (1900-1967). It was also the surname of Princess Diana (1961-1997).

Name: SPIKE
Meaning: From a nickname that may have originally been given to a person with spiky hair.

Name: SPIRIT
Meaning: From the English word spirit, ultimately from Latin spiritus "breath, energy", a derivative of spirare "to blow".

Name: SPRING
Meaning: From the name of the season, ultimately from Old English springan "to leap, to burst forth".

Name: STACE
Meaning: Medieval short form of EUSTACE. As a modern name it is typically a short form of STACY.

Name: STACEE
Meaning: Feminine variant of STACY.

Name: STACEY
Meaning: Variant of STACY.

Name: STACI
Meaning: Feminine variant of STACY.

Name: STACIA
Meaning: Short form of ANASTASIA or EUSTACIA.

Name: STACIE
Meaning: Feminine variant of STACY.

Name: STACY
Meaning: Either a diminutive of ANASTASIA, or else from a surname that was derived from Stace, a medieval form of EUSTACE. As a feminine name, it came into general use during the 1950s, though it had earlier been in use as a rare masculine name.

Name: STAFFORD
Meaning: From a surname that was from a place name meaning "landing-place ford" in Old English.

Name: STAN (1)
Meaning: Short form of STANLEY. A famous bearer was British comedian Stan Laurel (1890-1965).

Name: STANFORD
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "stone ford" in Old English.

Name: STANLEY
Meaning: From a surname meaning "stone clearing" in Old English. A notable bearer of the surname was the British-American explorer and journalist Sir Henry Morton Stanley (1841-1904), the man who found David Livingstone in Africa. As a given name, it was borne by American director Stanley Kubrick (1928-1999), as well as the character Stanley Kowalski in Tennessee Williams' play A Streetcar Named Desire (1947).

Name: STAR
Meaning: From the English word for the celestial body, ultimately from Old English steorra.

Name: STARLA
Meaning: Elaborated form of STAR.

Name: STARR
Meaning: Variant of STAR.

Name: STE
Meaning: Short form of STEPHEN.

Name: STEFANI
Meaning: Variant of STEPHANIE.

Name: STELLA (1)
Meaning: Means "star" in Latin. This name was created by the 16th-century poet Sir Philip Sidney for the subject of his collection of sonnets Astrophel and Stella. It was a nickname of a lover of Jonathan Swift, real name Esther Johnson (1681-1728), though it was not commonly used as a given name until the 19th century. It appears in Tennessee Williams' play A Streetcar Named Desire (1947), belonging to the sister of Blanche DuBois and the wife of Stanley Kowalski.

Name: STEPH
Meaning: Short form of STEPHANIE or STEPHEN.

Name: STEPHANI
Meaning: Variant of STEPHANIE.

Name: STEPHANIA
Meaning: Latinate feminine form of STEPHEN.

Name: STEPHANIE
Meaning: Feminine form of STEPHEN.

Name: STEPHANY
Meaning: Variant of STEPHANIE.

Name: STEPHEN
Meaning: From the Greek name Στέφανος (Stephanos) meaning "crown, wreath", more precisely "that which surrounds". Saint Stephen was a deacon who was stoned to death, as told in Acts in the New Testament. He is regarded as the first Christian martyr. Due to him, the name became common in the Christian world. It was popularized in England by the Normans.... [more]

Name: STERLING
Meaning: From a Scottish surname that was derived from city of Stirling, which is itself of unknown meaning. The name can also be given in reference to the English word sterling meaning "excellent". In this case, the word derives from sterling silver, which was so named because of the emblem that some Norman coins bore, from Old English meaning "little star".

Name: STEVE
Meaning: Short form of STEVEN. A notable bearer was American technology entrepreneur Steve Jobs (1955-2011).

Name: STEVEN
Meaning: Medieval English variant of STEPHEN, and a Dutch variant of STEFAN. The filmmaker Steven Spielberg (1946-), director of E.T. and Indiana Jones, is a famous bearer of this name.

Name: STEVIE
Meaning: Diminutive of STEPHEN or STEPHANIE. A famous bearer is the American musician Stevie Wonder (1950-).

Name: STEW
Meaning: Short form of STEWART.

Name: STEWART
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant STUART.

Name: STIRLING
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant STERLING. This is the name of a city in Scotland.

Name: ST JOHN
Meaning: From the title and name of Saint John the Baptist or Saint John the Evangelist (see JOHN).

Name: STONE
Meaning: From the English vocabulary word, ultimately from Old English stan.

Name: STORM
Meaning: From the vocabulary word, ultimately from Old English or Old Dutch storm, or in the case of the Scandinavian name, from Old Norse stormr.

Name: STU
Meaning: Short form of STUART.

Name: STUART
Meaning: From an occupational surname originally belonging to a person who was a steward. It is ultimately derived from Old English stig "house" and weard "guard". As a given name, it arose in 19th-century Scotland in honour of the Stuart royal family, which produced several kings and queens of Scotland and Britain between the 14th and 18th centuries.

Name: SUE
Meaning: Short form of SUSANNA.

Name: SUELLEN
Meaning: Contraction of SUSAN and ELLEN (1). Margaret Mitchell used this name in her novel Gone with the Wind (1936), where it belongs to Scarlett's sister.

Name: SUKIE
Meaning: Diminutive of SUSANNA.

Name: SULLIVAN
Meaning: From an Irish surname that was derived from Ó Súileabháin meaning "descendant of Súileabhán". The name Súileabhán means "little dark eye" in Irish.

Name: SUMMER
Meaning: From the name of the season, ultimately from Old English sumor. It has been in use as a given name since the 1970s.

Name: SUNDAY
Meaning: From the name of the day of the week, which ultimately derives from Old English sunnandæg, which was composed of the elements sunne "sun" and dæg "day".

Name: SUNNY
Meaning: From the English word meaning "sunny, cheerful".

Name: SUNSHINE
Meaning: From the English word, ultimately from Old English sunne "sun" and scinan "shine".

Name: SUSAN
Meaning: English variant of SUSANNA. This has been most common spelling since the 18th century. It was especially popular both in the United States and the United Kingdom from the 1940s to the 1960s. A notable bearer was the American feminist Susan B. Anthony (1820-1906).

Name: SUSANNA
Usage: Italian, Catalan, Swedish, Finnish, Russian, Dutch, English, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Old Church Slavic
Meaning: From Σουσάννα (Sousanna), the Greek form of the Hebrew name שׁוֹשַׁנָּה (Shoshannah). This was derived from the Hebrew word שׁוֹשָׁן (shoshan) meaning "lily" (in modern Hebrew this also means "rose"), perhaps ultimately from Egyptian sšn "lotus". In the Old Testament Apocrypha this is the name of a woman falsely accused of adultery. The prophet Daniel clears her name by tricking her accusers, who end up being condemned themselves. It also occurs in the New Testament belonging to a woman who ministers to Jesus.... [more]

Name: SUSIE
Meaning: Diminutive of SUSAN.

Name: SUZ
Meaning: Short form of SUSAN.

Name: SUZAN (1)
Meaning: Variant of SUSAN.

Name: SUZANNA
Meaning: Variant of SUSANNA.

Name: SUZANNE
Meaning: French form of SUSANNA.

Name: SUZI
Meaning: Diminutive of SUSAN.

Name: SUZIE
Meaning: Diminutive of SUSAN.

Name: SUZY
Meaning: Diminutive of SUSAN.

Name: SYBELLA
Meaning: Variant of SIBYLLA.

Name: SYBIL
Meaning: Variant of SIBYL. This spelling variation has existed since the Middle Ages.

Name: SYD
Meaning: Short form of SYDNEY.

Name: SYDNE
Meaning: Variant of SYDNEY.

Name: SYDNEY
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of the surname SIDNEY. This is the name of the largest city in Australia, which was named for Thomas Townshend, 1st Viscount Sydney in 1788. Since the 1990s this name has been mainly feminine.

Name: SYDNIE
Meaning: Variant of SYDNEY.

Name: SYLVAN
Meaning: Either a variant of SILVANUS or directly from the Latin word silva meaning "wood, forest".

Name: SYLVANUS
Meaning: Variant of SILVANUS.

Name: SYLVESTER
Meaning: Medieval variant of SILVESTER. This is currently the usual English spelling of the name. A famous bearer is the American actor Sylvester Stallone (1946-).

Name: SYLVIA
Usage: English, German, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish
Meaning: Variant of SILVIA. This has been the most common English spelling since the 19th century.

Name: SYMPHONY
Meaning: Simply from the English word, ultimately deriving from Greek σύμφωνος (symphonos) meaning "concordant in sound".

Name: TABATHA
Meaning: Variant of TABITHA.

Name: TABBY
Meaning: Diminutive of TABITHA.

Name: TABITHA
Meaning: Means "gazelle" in Aramaic. Tabitha in the New Testament was a woman restored to life by Saint Peter. Her name is translated into Greek as Dorcas (see Acts 9:36). As an English name, Tabitha became common after the Protestant Reformation. It was popularized in the 1960s by the television show Bewitched, in which Tabitha (sometimes spelled Tabatha) is the daughter of the main character.

Name: TACEY
Meaning: Derived from Latin tace meaning "be silent". It was in use from the 16th century, though it died out two centuries later.

Name: TAD
Meaning: Short form of THADDEUS.

Name: TAEGAN
Meaning: Variant of TEAGAN.

Name: TAHLIA
Meaning: Variant of TALIA (2).

Name: TAHNEE
Meaning: Variant of TAWNY.

Name: TALBOT
Meaning: From a surname that was perhaps derived from a Germanic given name composed of the elements tal "to destroy" and bod "message".

Name: TALIA (2)
Meaning: From the name of a town in South Australia, perhaps meaning "near water" in an Australian Aboriginal language.

Name: TALLULAH
Meaning: Popularly claimed to mean "leaping waters" in the Choctaw language, it may actually mean "town" in the Creek language. This is the name of waterfalls in Georgia. It was borne by American actress Tallulah Bankhead (1902-1968), who was named after her grandmother, who may have been named after the waterfalls.

Name: TALON
Meaning: From the English word meaning "talon, claw", ultimately derived (via Norman French) from Latin talus "anklebone".

Name: TAMARA
Usage: Russian, Ukrainian, Belarusian, Czech, Slovak, Polish, Slovene, Croatian, Serbian, Macedonian, Hungarian, English, Dutch, Spanish, Italian, Lithuanian, Georgian
Meaning: Russian form of TAMAR. Russian performers such as Tamara Karsavina (1885-1978), Tamara Drasin (1905-1943), Tamara Geva (1907-1997) and Tamara Toumanova (1919-1996) introduced it to the English-speaking world. It was also borne by the Polish cubist painter Tamara de Lempicka (1898-1980).

Name: TAMEKA
Meaning: Variant of TAMIKA.

Name: TAMELA
Meaning: Probably a blend of TAMARA and PAMELA. It first arose in the 1950s.

Name: TAMERA
Meaning: Variant of TAMARA.

Name: TAMI
Meaning: Variant of TAMMY.

Name: TAMIA
Meaning: Elaborated form of the popular name syllable Tam, from names such as TAMARA or TAMIKA. It was popularized by Canadian singer Tamia Hill (1975-), who is known simply as Tamia.

Name: TAMIKA
Meaning: Variant of TAMIKO, inspired by the American jazz singer Tamiko Jones (1945-) or the American movie A Girl Named Tamiko (1963).

Name: TAMMARA
Meaning: Variant of TAMARA.

Name: TAMMI
Meaning: Variant of TAMMY.

Name: TAMMIE
Meaning: Variant of TAMMY.

Name: TAMMY
Meaning: Short form of TAMARA and other names beginning with Tam.

Name: TAMRA
Meaning: Contracted form of TAMARA.

Name: TAMSEN
Meaning: Variant of TAMSIN.

Name: TAMSIN
Meaning: Contracted form of THOMASINA. It was traditionally used in Cornwall.

Name: TAMSYN
Meaning: Variant of TAMSIN.

Name: TAMZEN
Meaning: Variant of TAMSIN.

Name: TANIA
Meaning: Variant of TANYA.

Name: TANNER
Meaning: From an English surname meaning "one who tans hides".

Name: TANSY
Meaning: From the name of the flower, which is derived via Old French from Late Latin tanacita.

Name: TANYA
Meaning: Russian diminutive of TATIANA. It began to be used in the English-speaking world during the 1930s.

Name: TANZI
Meaning: Variant of TANSY.

Name: TARA (1)
Meaning: Anglicized form of the Irish place name Teamhair, which possibly means "elevated place" in Gaelic. This was the name of the sacred hill near Dublin where the Irish high kings resided. It was popularized as a given name by the novel Gone with the Wind (1936) and the subsequent movie adaptation (1939), in which it is the name of the O'Hara plantation.

Name: TARAH
Meaning: Variant of TARA (1).

Name: TARINA
Meaning: Perhaps an elaborated form of TARA (1).

Name: TARYN
Meaning: Probably a feminine form of TYRONE. Actors Tyrone Power and Linda Christian created it for their daughter Taryn Power (1953-).

Name: TASHA
Meaning: Short form of NATASHA.

Name: TATE
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from the Old English given name Tata, of unknown origin.

Name: TATIANA
Usage: Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Romanian, French, Slovak, Polish, Finnish, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, German, Dutch, Greek, Georgian, English, Russian, Bulgarian, Ancient Roman
Meaning: Feminine form of the Roman name Tatianus, a derivative of the Roman name TATIUS. This was the name of a 3rd-century saint who was martyred in Rome under the emperor Alexander Severus. She was especially venerated in Orthodox Christianity, and the name has been common in Russia (as Татьяна) and Eastern Europe. It was not regularly used in the English-speaking world until the 1980s.

Name: TATIANNA
Meaning: Variant of TATIANA.

Name: TATTON
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a place name meaning "Tata's town" in Old English.

Name: TATUM
Meaning: From a surname that was originally derived from a place name meaning "Tata's homestead" in Old English.

Name: TATYANNA
Meaning: Variant of TATIANA.

Name: TAWNEE
Meaning: Variant of TAWNY.

Name: TAWNIE
Meaning: Variant of TAWNY.

Name: TAWNY
Meaning: From the English word, ultimately deriving from Old French tané, which means "light brown".

Name: TAWNYA
Meaning: Variant of TONYA.

Name: TAYLA
Meaning: Probably a feminine form of TAYLOR influenced by similar-sounding names such as Kayla.

Name: TAYLER
Meaning: Variant of TAYLOR.

Name: TAYLOR
Meaning: From an English surname that originally denoted someone who was a tailor, from Norman French tailleur, ultimately from Latin taliare "to cut". Its modern use as a feminine name may have been influenced by the British-American author Taylor Caldwell (1900-1985).

Name: TEAGAN
Meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Tadhgáin meaning "descendant of Tadhgán". The given name Tadhgán is a diminutive of TADHG.

Name: TEAL
Meaning: From the English word for the type of duck or the greenish-blue colour.

Name: TEALE
Meaning: Variant of TEAL.

Name: TED
Meaning: Short form of EDWARD or THEODORE. A famous bearer was the American baseball player Ted Williams (1918-2002), who was born as Theodore.

Name: TEDDIE
Meaning: Diminutive of EDWARD or THEODORE, sometimes a feminine form.

Name: TEDDY
Meaning: Diminutive of EDWARD or THEODORE.

Name: TEL
Meaning: Short form of TERENCE or TERRY (1).

Name: TEMPERANCE
Meaning: From the English word meaning "moderation" or "restraint". This was one of the virtue names adopted by the Puritans in the 17th century.

Name: TEMPEST
Meaning: From the English word meaning "storm". It appears in the title of William Shakespeare's play The Tempest (1611).

Name: TEMPLE
Meaning: From a surname that originally belonged to a person who was associated with the Knights Templar, a medieval religious military order.

Name: TENNYSON
Meaning: From an English surname that meant "son of Tenney", Tenney being a medieval form of DENIS. A notable bearer of the surname was British poet Alfred Lord Tennyson (1809-1892).

Name: TERA
Meaning: Variant of TARA (1).

Name: TERANCE
Meaning: Variant of TERENCE.

Name: TERELL
Meaning: Variant of TERRELL.

Name: TERENCE
Meaning: From the Roman family name Terentius, which is of unknown meaning. Famous bearers include Publius Terentius Afer, a Roman playwright, and Marcus Terentius Varro, a Roman scholar. It was also borne by several early saints. The name was used in Ireland as an Anglicized form of TOIRDHEALBHACH, but it was not in use as an English name until the late 19th century.

Name: TERESA
Usage: Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, Catalan, Polish, Finnish, German, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, English
Meaning: Form of THERESA used in several languages. Saint Teresa of Ávila was a 16th-century Spanish nun who reformed the Carmelite monasteries and wrote several spiritual books. It was also borne by the Albanian missionary Saint Teresa of Calcutta (1910-1997), better known as Mother Teresa, who worked with the poor in India. She adopted the name in honour of the French saint Thérèse of Lisieux, who is the patron of missionaries.

Name: TERI
Meaning: Either a feminine variant of TERRY (1) or a diminutive of THERESA.

Name: TERRA
Meaning: Variant of TARA (1), perhaps influenced by the Latin word terra meaning "land, earth".

Name: TERRANCE
Meaning: Variant of TERENCE.

Name: TERRELL
Meaning: From an English surname that was probably derived from the Norman French nickname tirel "to pull", referring to a stubborn person. It may sometimes be given in honour of civil rights activist Mary Church Terrell (1863-1954).

Name: TERRENCE
Meaning: Variant of TERENCE.

Name: TERRI
Meaning: Either a feminine variant of TERRY (1) or a diminutive of THERESA.

Name: TERRIE
Meaning: Either a feminine variant of TERRY (1) or a diminutive of THERESA.

Name: TERRY (1)
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from the medieval name Thierry, a Norman French form of THEODORIC.

Name: TERRY (2)
Meaning: Diminutive of TERENCE or THERESA. A famous bearer was Terry Fox (1958-1981), a young man with an artificial leg who attempted to run across Canada to raise money for cancer research. He died of the disease before crossing the country.

Name: TESS
Meaning: Diminutive of THERESA. This is the name of the main character in Thomas Hardy's novel Tess of the D'Ubervilles (1891).

Name: TESSA
Meaning: Diminutive of THERESA.

Name: TESSIE
Meaning: Diminutive of THERESA.

Name: TETTY
Meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH.

Name: TEVIN
Meaning: Invented name, probably inspired by Kevin and Devin. This name was popularized by the American singer Tevin Campbell (1976-).

Name: TEX
Meaning: From a nickname denoting a person who came from the state of Texas. A famous bearer was the American animator Tex Avery (1908-1980), real name Frederick, who was born in Texas.

Name: THAD
Meaning: Short form of THADDEUS.

Name: THADDEUS
Meaning: From Θαδδαῖος (Thaddaios), the Greek form of the Aramaic name Thaddai. It is possibly derived from a word meaning "heart", but it may in fact be an Aramaic form of a Greek name such as Θεόδωρος (see THEODORE). In the Gospel of Matthew, Thaddaeus is listed as one of the twelve apostles, though elsewhere in the New Testament his name is omitted and Jude's appears instead. It is likely that the two names refer to the same person.

Name: THANE
Meaning: From the Scottish and English noble title, which was originally from Old English thegn.

Name: THANKFUL
Meaning: From the English word thankful. This was one of the many virtue names used by the Puritans in the 17th century.

Name: THATCHER
Meaning: From an English surname that referred to a person who thatched roofs by attaching straw to them, derived from Old English þæc "thatch". The surname was borne by British prime minister Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013).

Name: THEA
Meaning: Short form of DOROTHEA or THEODORA.

Name: THELMA
Meaning: Meaning unknown. It was a rare name when British author Marie Corelli used it for the Norwegian heroine of her novel Thelma (1887). The name became popular around the end of the 19th century after the novel was published. It is sometimes claimed to derive from Greek θέλημα (thelema) meaning "will", though this seems unlikely.

Name: THEO
Meaning: Short form of THEODORE, THEOBALD, and other names that begin with Theo.

Name: THEOBALD
Meaning: Means "bold people", derived from the Germanic elements theud "people" and bald "bold". The Normans brought the name to England, where it joined an existing Old English cognate. The medieval forms Tibald and Tebald were commonly Latinized as Theobaldus. It was rare by the 20th century.

Name: THEODORA
Meaning: Feminine form of THEODORE. This name was common in the Byzantine Empire, being borne by several empresses including the influential wife of Justinian in the 6th century.

Name: THEODORE
Meaning: From the Greek name Θεόδωρος (Theodoros), which meant "gift of god" from Greek θεός (theos) meaning "god" and δῶρον (doron) meaning "gift". The name Dorothea is derived from the same roots in reverse order. This was the name of several saints, including Theodore of Amasea, a 4th-century Greek soldier; Theodore of Tarsus, a 7th-century archbishop of Canterbury; and Theodore the Studite, a 9th-century Byzantine monk. It was also borne by two popes.... [more]

Name: THERESA
Meaning: From the Spanish and Portuguese name Teresa. It was first recorded as Therasia, being borne by the Spanish wife of Saint Paulinus of Nola in the 4th century. The meaning is uncertain, but it could be derived from Greek θέρος (theros) meaning "summer", from Greek θερίζω (therizo) meaning "to harvest", or from the name of the Greek island of Therasia (the western island of Santorini).... [more]

Name: THERESE
Meaning: German and Scandinavian variant of THERESA.

Name: THOM
Meaning: Short form of THOMAS.

Name: THOMAS
Usage: English, French, German, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Greek, Biblical, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: Greek form of the Aramaic name תָּאוֹמָא (Ta'oma') meaning "twin". In the New Testament this is the name of an apostle. When he heard that Jesus had risen from the dead he initially doubted the story, until Jesus appeared before him and he examined his wounds himself. According to tradition he was martyred in India. Due to his renown, the name came into general use in the Christian world.... [more]

Name: THOMASINA
Meaning: Medieval feminine form of THOMAS.

Name: THORBURN
Meaning: From a Scottish and English surname that was derived from the Norse name Þórbjǫrn (see TORBJÖRN).

Name: THORLEY
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "thorn clearing" in Old English.

Name: THORNTON
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "thorn town" in Old English.

Name: THURSTAN
Meaning: From an English surname that was derived from the Norse name Þórsteinn (see TORSTEN).

Name: TIA
Meaning: Short form of names ending with tia. It has been suggested that its use since the 1950s is the result of the brand name for the coffee liqueur Tia Maria. In the brand name, Tia is not a given name; rather, it means "aunt" in Spanish or Portuguese.

Name: TIANA
Meaning: Short form of TATIANA or CHRISTIANA.

Name: TIANNA
Meaning: Variant of TIANA.

Name: TIARA
Meaning: From the English word for a semicircle crown, ultimately of Greek origin.

Name: TIBBY
Meaning: Diminutive of TABITHA or THEOBALD.

Name: TIERNEY
Meaning: Anglicized form of TIGHEARNACH. In part, it is from a surname derived from the given name.

Name: TIFFANI
Meaning: Variant of TIFFANY.

Name: TIFFANY
Meaning: Medieval form of THEOPHANIA. This name was traditionally given to girls born on the Epiphany (January 6), the festival commemorating the visit of the Magi to the infant Jesus. The name died out after the Middle Ages, but it was revived by the movie Breakfast at Tiffany's (1961), the title of which refers to the Tiffany's jewelry store in New York.

Name: TIFFINY
Meaning: Variant of TIFFANY.

Name: TIGER
Meaning: From the name of the large striped cat, derived (via Old French and Latin) from Greek τίγρις (tigris), ultimately of Iranian origin. A famous bearer is American golfer Tiger Woods (1975-).

Name: TILDA
Meaning: Short form of MATILDA.

Name: TILLIE
Meaning: Diminutive of MATILDA.

Name: TILLY
Meaning: Diminutive of MATILDA.

Name: TIM
Usage: English, German, Dutch, Slovene, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish
Meaning: Short form of TIMOTHY or (in Germany) DIETMAR. It was borne by the fictional character Tiny Tim, the ill son of Bob Cratchit in Charles Dickens' novel A Christmas Carol (1843).

Name: TIMMY
Meaning: Diminutive of TIMOTHY.

Name: TIMOTHA
Meaning: Feminine form of TIMOTHY.

Name: TIMOTHY
Meaning: English form of the Greek name Τιμόθεος (Timotheos) meaning "honouring God", derived from τιμάω (timao) meaning "to honour" and θεός (theos) meaning "god". Saint Timothy was a companion of Paul on his missionary journeys and was the recipient of two of Paul's epistles that appear in the New Testament. He was of both Jewish and Greek ancestry. According to tradition, he was martyred at Ephesus after protesting the worship of Artemis. As an English name, Timothy was not used until after the Protestant Reformation.

Name: TINA
Usage: English, Italian, Dutch, Slovene, Croatian, Macedonian, Georgian
Meaning: Short form of CHRISTINA, MARTINA, and other names ending in tina. In addition to these names, it is also used in Dutch as a diminutive of CATHARINA, in Croatian as a diminutive of KATARINA, and in Georgian as a short form of TINATIN.

Name: TISHA
Meaning: Short form of LETITIA or LATISHA.

Name: TITTY
Meaning: Diminutive of LETITIA. This is now a slang word for the female breast, and the name has subsequently dropped out of common use.

Name: TITUS
Usage: Ancient Roman, English, Biblical, Biblical Latin
Meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, which is of unknown meaning, possibly related to Latin titulus "title of honour". It is more likely of Oscan origin, since it was borne by the legendary Sabine king Titus Tatius.... [more]

Name: TOBIAS
Usage: Biblical, German, Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, English, Biblical Latin, Biblical Greek
Meaning: Greek form of TOBIAH. This is the name of the hero of the apocryphal Book of Tobit, which appears in many English versions of the Old Testament. It relates how Tobit's son Tobias, with the help of the angel Raphael, is able to drive away a demon who has plagued Sarah, who subsequently becomes his wife. This story was popular in the Middle Ages, and the name came into occasional use in parts of Europe at that time. In England it became common after the Protestant Reformation.

Name: TOBIN
Meaning: From an English surname that was itself derived from the given name TOBIAS.

Name: TOBY
Meaning: Medieval form of TOBIAS. It was sometimes used as a feminine name in the 1930s and 40s due to the influence of American actress Toby Wing (1915-2001).

Name: TOD
Meaning: Variant of TODD.

Name: TODD
Meaning: From a surname meaning "fox", derived from Middle English todde.

Name: TOLLY
Meaning: Diminutive of BARTHOLOMEW.

Name: TOM (1)
Usage: English, Dutch, German, Norwegian, Danish, Swedish
Meaning: Short form of THOMAS. Tom Sawyer was the main character in several of Mark Twain's novels, first appearing in The Adventures of Tom Sawyer (1876). Other famous bearers include American actors Tom Hanks (1956-) and Tom Cruise (1962-).

Name: TOMMIE
Meaning: Diminutive of THOMAS, sometimes used as a feminine form.

Name: TOMMY
Meaning: Diminutive of THOMAS.

Name: TONI (2)
Meaning: Short form of ANTONIA.

Name: TONIA
Meaning: Variant of TONYA.

Name: TONY
Meaning: Short form of ANTHONY.

Name: TONYA
Meaning: English diminutive of ANTONIA or a Russian diminutive of ANTONINA. In the English-speaking world its use has likely been positively influenced by the name TANYA.

Name: TOPAZ
Meaning: From the English word for the yellow precious stone, the birthstone of November, ultimately derived from Greek τόπαζος (topazos).

Name: TOPHER
Meaning: Short form of CHRISTOPHER.

Name: TOPSY
Meaning: From a nickname that is of unknown meaning, perhaps deriving from the English word top. This is the name of a young slave in Harriet Beecher Stowe's novel Uncle Tom's Cabin (1852).

Name: TORI
Meaning: Diminutive of VICTORIA.

Name: TORIA
Meaning: Short form of VICTORIA.

Name: TORY (2)
Meaning: Variant of TORI.

Name: TOTTIE
Meaning: Diminutive of CHARLOTTE.

Name: TOTTY
Meaning: Diminutive of CHARLOTTE.

Name: TRACE
Meaning: Short form of TRACY.

Name: TRACEE
Meaning: Feminine variant of TRACY.

Name: TRACEY
Meaning: Variant of TRACY.

Name: TRACI
Meaning: Feminine variant of TRACY.

Name: TRACIE
Meaning: Feminine variant of TRACY.

Name: TRACY
Meaning: From an English surname that was taken from a Norman French place name meaning "domain belonging to THRACIUS". Charles Dickens used it for a male character in his novel The Pickwick Papers (1837). It was later popularized as a feminine name by the main character Tracy Lord in the movie The Philadelphia Story (1940). This name is also sometimes used as a diminutive of THERESA.

Name: TRAFFORD
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "fish-trap ford" in Old English.

Name: TRANTER
Meaning: From a surname meaning "wagoner" in Old English.

Name: TRAVERS
Meaning: From the surname TRAVERS.

Name: TRAVIS
Meaning: From the English surname Travis (a variant of TRAVERS). It was used in America in honour of William Travis (1809-1836), the commander of the Texan forces at the Battle of the Alamo.

Name: TREASURE
Meaning: From the English word, ultimately from Greek θησαυρός (thesauros) meaning "treasure, collection".

Name: TRECIA
Meaning: Variant of TRICIA.

Name: TRENT
Meaning: From a surname that originally denoted someone who lived by the River Trent in England. Trent is also a city in Italy, though the etymology is unrelated.

Name: TRENTON
Meaning: From the name of a New Jersey city established in the 17th century by William Trent. It means "TRENT's town".

Name: TRESHA
Meaning: Variant of TRICIA.

Name: TREV
Meaning: Short form of TREVOR.

Name: TREVELYAN
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a Cornish place name meaning "homestead on the hill".

Name: TREVOR
Meaning: From a surname that was originally from a place name meaning "big village" from Welsh tref "village" and mawr "large".

Name: TREY
Meaning: From an English nickname meaning "three".

Name: TRIA
Meaning: Perhaps a short form of DEMETRIA and other names ending in a similar sound.

Name: TRICIA
Meaning: Short form of PATRICIA.

Name: TRINA
Meaning: Short form of KATRINA.

Name: TRINITY
Meaning: From the English word Trinity, given in honour of the Christian belief that God has one essence, but three distinct expressions of being: Father, Son and Holy Spirit. It has only been in use as a given name since the 20th century.

Name: TRISH
Meaning: Short form of PATRICIA.

Name: TRISHA
Meaning: Short form of PATRICIA.

Name: TRISTA
Meaning: Feminine form of TRISTAN.

Name: TRISTAN
Meaning: Old French form of the Pictish name Drustan, a diminutive of DRUST. The spelling was altered by association with Latin tristis "sad". Tristan is a character in medieval French tales, probably inspired by older Celtic legends, and ultimately merged into Arthurian legend. According to the story Tristan was sent to Ireland in order to fetch Isolde, who was to be the bride of King Mark of Cornwall. On the way back, Tristan and Isolde accidentally drink a potion that makes them fall in love. Their tragic story was very popular in the Middle Ages, and the name has occasionally been used since that time.

Name: TRISTEN
Meaning: Variant of TRISTAN, sometimes used as a feminine form.

Name: TRISTIN
Meaning: Variant of TRISTAN, sometimes used as a feminine form.

Name: TRISTON
Meaning: Variant of TRISTAN.

Name: TRISTRAM
Meaning: Medieval English form of TRISTAN.

Name: TRIX
Meaning: Short form of BEATRIX.

Name: TRIXIE
Meaning: Diminutive of BEATRIX.

Name: TROY
Meaning: Originally from a surname that denoted a person from the city of Troyes in France. It is now more likely used in reference to the ancient city of Troy that was besieged by the Greeks in Homer's Iliad. The city's name, from Greek Τροία (Troia), is said to derive from its mythical founder Τρώς (Tros), but is more likely of Luwian or Hittite origin. This name was popularized in the 1960s by the actor Troy Donahue (1936-2001), who took his stage name from that of the ancient city.

Name: TRUDI
Meaning: Diminutive of GERTRUDE and other Germanic names ending with the element thrud "strength".

Name: TRUDIE
Meaning: Diminutive of GERTRUDE.

Name: TRUDY
Meaning: Diminutive of GERTRUDE.

Name: TRUEMAN
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of TRUMAN.

Name: TRUMAN
Meaning: From a surname that meant "trusty man" in Middle English. A famous bearer of the surname was American president Harry S. Truman (1884-1972). It was also borne by American writer Truman Capote (1924-1984).

Name: TUCKER
Meaning: From an occupational surname for a cloth fuller, derived from Old English tucian meaning "offend, torment". A fuller was a person who cleaned and thickened raw cloth by pounding it.

Name: TWILA
Meaning: Meaning unknown. Perhaps based on the English word twilight, or maybe from a Cajun pronunciation of French étoile "star". It came into use as an American given name in the late 19th century.

Name: TWYLA
Meaning: Variant of TWILA.

Name: TY
Meaning: Short form of TYLER, TYSON, TYRONE, and other names beginning with Ty.

Name: TYE
Meaning: From a surname meaning "pasture" in Middle English.

Name: TYLAR
Meaning: Variant of TYLER.

Name: TYLER
Meaning: From an English surname meaning "tiler of roofs", derived from Old English tigele "tile". The surname was borne by American president John Tyler (1790-1862).

Name: TYLOR
Meaning: Variant of TYLER.

Name: TYRELL
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of TERRELL.

Name: TYRON
Meaning: Variant of TYRONE.

Name: TYRONE
Meaning: From the name of a county in Northern Ireland, which is derived from Irish Gaelic Tir Eoghain meaning "land of EOGHAN". This name was popularized by American actor Tyrone Power (1914-1958), who was named after his great-grandfather, an Irish actor.

Name: TYRRELL
Meaning: From a surname that was a variant of TERRELL.

Name: TYSON
Meaning: From an English surname that could be derived from a nickname for a quarrelsome person, from Old French tison meaning "firebrand". Alternatively, it could be a variant of DYSON. A famous bearer of the surname was boxer Mike Tyson (1966-).

Name: ULRIC
Meaning: Middle English form of the Old English name Wulfric meaning "wolf ruler". When it is used in modern times, it is usually as a variant of ULRICH.

Name: ULYSSA
Meaning: Feminine form of ULYSSES.

Name: ULYSSES
Meaning: Latin form of ODYSSEUS. It was borne by Ulysses S. Grant (1822-1885), the commander of the Union forces during the American Civil War, who went on to become an American president. Irish author James Joyce used it as the title of his book Ulysses (1922), which loosely parallels Homer's epic the Odyssey.

Name: UNICE
Meaning: Variant of EUNICE.

Name: UNIQUE
Meaning: From the English word unique, ultimately derived from Latin unicus.

Name: UNITY
Meaning: From the English word unity, which is ultimately derived from Latin unitas.

Name: UPTON
Meaning: From a surname that was derived from a place name meaning "upper town" in Old English. A famous bearer of this name was the American novelist Upton Sinclair (1878-1968).

Name: URSELLA
Meaning: Variant of URSULA.

Name: URSULA
Usage: English, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, German, Dutch, Finnish, Late Roman
Meaning: Means "little bear", derived from a diminutive form of the Latin word ursa "she-bear". Saint Ursula was a legendary virgin princess of the 4th century who was martyred by the Huns while returning from a pilgrimage. In England the saint was popular during the Middle Ages, and the name came into general use at that time.

Name: VAL
Meaning: Short form of VALENTINE (1), VALERIE, and other names beginning with Val.

Name: VALARIE
Meaning: Variant of VALERIE.

Name: VALARY
Meaning: Variant of VALERIE.

Name: VALE
Meaning: From the English word meaning "wide river valley".

Name: VALENTINE (1)
Meaning: From the Roman cognomen Valentinus, which was itself a derivative of the cognomen Valens meaning "strong, vigorous, healthy" in Latin. Saint Valentine was a 3rd-century martyr. His feast day was the same as the Roman fertility festival of Lupercalia, which resulted in the association between Valentine's day and love. As an English name, it has been used occasionally since the 12th century.

Name: VALERIE
Meaning: English and German form of VALERIA, as well as a Czech variant of VALÉRIE.

Name: VALORIE
Meaning: Variant of VALERIE.

Name: VAN
Meaning: Short form of names containing van, such as VANCE or IVAN.
